story:
A Girl's Gotta Eat & How To Be Your Own Wife

A girl’s gotta eat, and a guy too.  Why not eat well, thoughtfully, and with style in the idiosyncratic, often funny, deeply personal company of author and cook Hanne Blank?  Themed issues dig deep into the heart of not just what to cook and how but also why and what it does to us and for us, and all those who share our table, when we do.  A Girl’s Gotta Eat is essay, recipes, technique tips, and deeply personal reflections on food, cooking, serving, and eating.

Everyone enjoys a well-run household.  Everyone it seems -- including wives -- seems to dream of having a wife who makes it so.  How To Be Your Own Wife says don’t dream it, be it.  Author Hanne Blank, queer feminist scion of a long line of top-notch midwestern housekeepers, helps you rethink domesticity and “wife skills” as good politics and good self-care, a source of pleasure, comfort, and self-sufficiency.  How To Be Your Own Wife is thought-provoking prose, seriously road-tested domestic technique, and uncompromising good housekeeping on a quarterly basis, 100% free of crafts and decorating.

These will go out together in doubleheader quarterly editions, one half A Girl's Gotta Eat and one half How To Be Your Own Wife, served up quarterly via email in the form of PDFs you can keep forever and even print out if you are so inclined.  

At the end of the year, you'll receive a compilation of all 4 issues in a single PDF, complete with index and recipe listing.

Why Crowdfund This Project?

As an author, crowdfunding these highly idiosyncratic, very personal projects lets me do work that I'd have a hard time finding a place for in the traditional publishing industry.  YOU make it possible for me to write about things that I'm passionate about in the ways that I'm fired-up about writing.  

Doing it this way means I don't have to write about domestic stuff in all the predictable, traditional ways we've all seen a thousand times before.    I don't have to shill products.  I don't have to assume there's any predetermined goal or standard for amazing food and a great domestic environment.  

Crowdfunding this project means I get to talk about domesticity and cooking as personal responsibility, as modes of competence... as political acts and places to create pleasure.  Crowdfunding this project means I don't have to talk about hosting holiday dinners (unless I feel like it) but instead can talk about the ways consciously creating your own domestic environment can be a radical, transformational source of self-sufficiency and self-care. 

Crowdfunding a project like this means I get to speak directly to YOU, and you can, in turn, speak directly back to me.  My experience with writing A Girl's Gotta Eat during 2013-2014 made me realize how amazing having that tight relationship with my readers could be.

I hope you'll join me for A Girl's Gotta Eat & How To Be Your Own Wife.

Where does my money go?

100% of your money goes directly to production costs.  That is, it goes to paying me to write, and to paying the lovely and talented graphic design goddess who will be putting together the fancy-schmancy beautiful PDF editions of the collected 2013-14 A Girl's Gotta Eat and eventually, an even more fancy-schmancy and beautifuller PDF edition of the 2015-16 A Girl's Gotta Eat & How To Be Your Own Wife.

story:
How This Story Came To Be

Nearly three and a half years ago I witnessed, for the first time since childhood, the true warrior power of women, when my sister gave birth to my nephew Leo. I was with her in the birthing room at Saint Thomas’ Hospital during her labour, perhaps the best hospital in London to have a British baby met as it is situated across from Big Ben on the river Thames and each room features large windows which overlook the sweet sights below. In front of the hospital, on the south side of Westminster bridge, is a large stone lion known as The Southbank Lion whose gaze rests on the room Leo arrived in.

Before he was born, his name was to be Preston, but my sister changed it in the last moments of birth announcing in the inarguable tone only a woman in the last moments of life creation can summon: “his name will be Leo and that’s it” as she gave the final push. I had felt the lion’s gaze for the duration of the labour but at that moment I looked towards it and in the delirium that long hours’ awake offer, I was sure he gave me a wink.

I held Leo for the first time while my sister rested, introducing him to the first sunrise while whispering blessings and promises to him and the universe for the life he’d lead and the love and protection I promised to provide.

About a year later, on a Friday night in Paris, there were numerous attacks on the city and 130 innocent people were killed.

As the city mourned, I sat on my computer assuring family my husfriend and I were safe, while trying to understand what had happened and what to do next. A video shared by a friend on facebook caught my eye and upon playing it, caught my heart as well. It was of a father and his child, probably a few years older than my nephew Leo, at Place de la République, where a memorial for the lives lost had been set up. A journalist interviewed the child, who was around age 4 at the time, about what he understood had happened and his response made me think of my nephew and how the children of today will have to learn how to digest the growing violence. (You can watch the video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=96b-QPJsYK4)

This little boy got me thinking of my nephew and how the children of today will have to learn how to digest the growing violence and how parents (or Aunts) might communicate its complexities, especially to those who are very young. In response, I wrote this book, for both adults and children, which tries to explain and make sense of it all.

 

The Words

LEO & THE LION LEARN OF LOVE | By Holly Rose | © Copyright 2015 - 2017

[Page 1]

The Lion knew Leo before he was here when they were lights in the sky beaming big, bright and clear

[Page 2]

The Lion had arrived long before little Leo and had learned all he could about wisdom and ego

[Page 3]

The Lion was eager to share all he’d gathered, from his time here on earth on subjects that mattered

[Page 4]

But Leo first needed to grow, feed and learn, as many lessons arrive soon after you’re born

[Page 5]

So the Lion he waited and watched and enjoyed, as this human grew from a small baby to a little boy

[Page 6]

And then one day to the Lion's surprise, the boy named Leo looked right in his eyes

[Page 7]

And asked him a question needing an answer so big, it took the Lion some time to reflect on and think

[Page 8]

"What Is Love?" Leo asked with a sparkle in his eye and the Lion felt so joyful he nearly started to cry

[Page 9]

"Love" said the Lion with a voice soft and deep, is the most important and beautiful of all the feelings

[Page 10]

It's a word which transcends every race, gender and language, which can cure any hurt without so much as a bandage

[Page 11]

It is a magical thing made to nourish and share, as it shows the world how much your heart and soul can care

[Page 12]

It is meant to be shared with every living thing, from the animals and plants to each human being

[Page 13]

"But what if we don't" Leo whispered with worry, and his eyes filled with tears making his vision all blurry

[Page 14]

The Lion hugged Leo and slowly explained, how the planet they live on creates most of its pain

[Page 15]

If we don't love the animals, the animals get hurt, if we don't love the trees they fall to the dirt

[Page 16]

If we don't love each human we have war, not peace, which makes the world run like it's sick with disease

[Page 17]

We need all living things to coexist and be balanced, which is why we must always choose Love even when it is challenged

[Page 18]

"I will Love them!" said Leo and he finally smiled, and he hugged the Lion, a tree and another small child

[Page 19]

And he laughed and he played and he promised to always remember, the lessons of the lion on that day in September

 

The Illustrator

I’ve been sitting on this book since I wrote it, trying to find an illustrator who aligned, aesthetically and spiritually. This Christmas while looking for cards I came across the talented illustrator Caroline from Saltwater and Feathers (www.saltwaterandfeathers.com) who fit the part. We immediately connected and she joyfully agreed to illustrate the book. The image above is the first of her creations to coincide with the first page)

 

The Crowdfunding

If the strength of my passions were equal to the strength of my bank account I would probably do this the other way around (print the book, then sell it), but alas, the life of a freelance writer / eco blogger (I write www.leotielovely.blogspot.com) is not one of great monetary fulfilment so in order to bring this book to life, I need your help.

Any money pledged will be in the form of a pre-order and will fund the first run of the books as well as the remainder of the illustrations to get this little project off the ground. You will find the various options in the perks for a printed book or digital version which you can pre-order for your little one. I’m hoping to have it completed by summer, but at the very latest, I’ll have it in your arms before the winter holiday season comes.

story:
Hello! My name is Deborah Kane Goldblatt. I'm a New Zealander by birth, an American immigrant-citizen and live in Mexico.  My work as a dialogue facilitator and consultant for not for profit organizations focusing on multi-generational, youth and family programming has taken me all over the world. Syria was a country I was very fortunate to see just before the Syrian Arab revolution began in March 2011. 

"Syria Welcomes A Stranger": stories and photographs of my journey to Syria - October 2010 is written in a narrative style, giving voice to the hospitable Syrians I met with photographs of some of them in the places I saw. 

Little did we know or ever possibly imagine what would happen beginning just months after my visit. In Syria's eighth year of terror, slaughter and genocide, 8.4 million children are affected by the war. 3.3 million children have been displaced. More than 15,000 unaccompanied and separated children have crossed Syrian borders. 

As extremely complicated a story as Syria’s demise is, what’s true is Syria’s people, dead or alive, surviving in or out of Syria, are all too forgotten. I keep asking myself: in their suffering and devastation, how can I ever forget them? I owe my Syrian hosts and acquaintances something. When so few people outside Syria know about the country or its people other than war historians, human rights workers and journalists, how could my travel stories and photographs move someone to care and act?

At the very least, in gratitude for their kindness and warm hospitality, this e-book will raise funds to practically help Syrian refugees in displacement camps survive, offer some hope and, perhaps inspire a stranger to welcome them in, if only for a short time to help build life anew.

What We Need & What You Get

In my effort to raise funds for the production and distribution of my e-book, I am also raising funds for Help Refugees. 

Help Refugees is a volunteer charity based in the UK doing amazing work through its 75 partner organizations with minimal overheads and maximum impact. 94% of donations go straight to the frontline delivered by Help Refugees partner organizations and volunteers. Help Refugees is my choice of charity to locate, distribute and supply the items we buy for the Syrian refugees' needs.

Last year, Help Refugees opened the world’s first shop inviting visitors to “shop your heart out, leave with nothing, and feel the love”. Shoppers can buy a range of items for refugees, including sleeping bags, emergency blankets and solar lamps or even the keys to a rental home and NO CAMP for a month. The items are representational of what their partner organizations provide refugees on the ground. In late November of this year, Help Refugees will open two pop shops in NYC and in December in London. I intend to shop at both shops and spend 90% of the money we raise from my e-book readings and this online fund-raising campaign. 

Help me buy the pop-up shop several times over! A donation of $80 or more today will buy one free copy of my e-book as well a shelter bundle. A donation of $350 will buy one month's rent for a family outside a displacement camp. A donation of $750 will buy everything in the whole Help Refugees shop!

By contributing to my page here, I will send you my e-book “Syria Welcomes A Stranger” after my shopping in NYC and in London by mid-December with a picture of all the items we’ve bought together to help Syrian refugees.

Thank you! Shukrun!

story:
I am Janet Boucher, a former school teacher and now a writer. I have written a picture book for children called Hold On, Toby.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The story begins with Toby, a little maple leaf bud on a very big tree. As he grows and matures, he journeys through each season, encountering the wonder and forces of nature, and various critters and people of all sizes along the way. Throughout his journey Toby is often told to ‘hold on,’ although he has no idea what that means. Children will delight in Toby’s interaction with other characters, and will wonder, along with Toby, what is going to happen!

I wrote this book because I wanted children to become aware of, experience and learn to appreciate the cycle that occurs as a natural part of life --- the renewal of life each spring, the blossoming of summer, the glory of the changing colors of fall, and the resting nature of winter. Moving through life with awareness of the natural cycles in our lives helps us to celebrate each season and to engage in the natural flow of life with appreciation and recognition of the miracle of life itself.

Hold On, Toby presents to young minds an opportunity to recognize and experience the joy and opportunity in each season of the year, and glimpse an understanding of the life cycle as expressed through the seasons of Toby’s life.   

The book is beautifully illustrated by the magical artwork of award-winning graphic designer Susan Andra Lion. The illustrations depict Toby’s adventures as well as images of families and other creatures sharing activities in each season.

 

Hold On, Toby will be available in November, just in time for the holidays! If you pre-order a copy, I will personally autograph the book to you or the person of your choice. You can also order copies to be donated in your name, or donated anonymously to schools, libraries or persons your designate. Shipping is included, and I will ship to multiple address, if you order a book offering more than one book.  We will mail your copy within a week of receiving the books from the printer. I hope you will take a look at my campaign here on Indiegogo and find a perk that especially appeals to you.

I will be truly grateful and honored to receive the support and assistance of each of you to raise the money through pre-sales of personally autographed copies of my book, through copies of the illustrations, through including your name on the acknowledgements page or through other perks as described on this page. There are lots of ways to become a part of the Toby team and to help to bring this book forward where so many children can experience its positive message and beautiful story illustrations.

The money from pre-sales of Hold On, Toby will be used to fund the printing and national marketing of the book and to help me to get the word out to parents, grandparents, librarians, book store owners and others about the launch of my book.  Because there are so many new books being brought to market every year, I need the pre-sales of my book to help provide the funding to do the fully complete marketing job that this book requires and deserves. I will also be supported by the services of a publishing professional to assure Toby’s success in the market. Even if I don’t hit my full goal, all perks will be fulfilled.

Would you please join the team of those helping to bring Hold On, Toby forward, where its message of seasonal change and the unending cycle of life are presented in an engaging and gentle manner?

Please share the crowd-funding link and information about Hold On, Toby with your email and social media contacts and help Hold On, Toby to find its way into many young hands.

Thank you so much!

story:
Short Summary

The creation of Glorious Atrocities and Barbaric Nobles began several years ago in Calgary. With a unifying interest in the bizarre, the macabre, and the art of storytelling, Paul Stapfer and Kyle D. Mack pondered an age-old question:

"If Earth was a petri-dish under observation from a visitor from the cosmic beyond, how would such an alien intelligence perceive Christmas?"

Thus began the compilation of a book which detailed four Christmas-themed events, as seen through the eyes of a sentient and near omnipotent life form from another universe with no concept of humanity's most festive occasion. These surreal, character rich, and classic-with-a-dark-twist stories became a labour of love and pain as much as it was a journey of the mind and the soul. Soon, they evolved into a globe-spanning narrative, which showcases the varying celebratory practices and origins of Western civilization's most profoundly revered and perversely commercialized holiday. 

Once the manuscript was nearing completion, Paul and Kyle took the extraordinarily wise step of electing to add illustrations to their latest collection of stories. With the help of Calgary artist, Jason Mathis, a mere collection of words evolved into the essential elements of everything held dear by true connoisseurs of art, literature, and grand Christmas story telling itself.

Ideally, with generous contributions, Glorious Atrocities and Barbaric Nobles will soon greet its dawn and then grace the hearts, minds, and very souls of the Christmas masses.

What We Need & What You Get

Terra Bulla Ink is looking for $5000 to cover the initial overhead of editing, front and back cover design and illustrations, first edition printing costs, and the ultimate shipping and distribution to you, the contributors. Any finances exceeding the minimum will be applied towards expanded online sales and marketing as well as nationwide distribution and touring schedules to predetermined brick and mortar retail outlets.

Here is a more finite breakdown of how we plan to use the $5000 we are hoping to raise:

Art and Design – 30%

This will cover the costs associated with taking a manuscript with illustrations and arranging it in a manner suitable for publication. To do this, we will need to acquire a few new art-meets-technology gadgets and pay a few people to help with formatting.

Editing – 28%

Editors don’t generally work for free. We intend to recoup costs from our professional editor who helped us ensure that we did not produce a book about a multiverse where multiverse is spelled with a “B”.

Printing and Digitizing – 20%

You know those companies that print books and make them look amazing so that you actually want to buy them AND feel good about your purchase? They generally charge cash money for this type of work. Sad but true. We will need to pay them as well as those tech savvy folks who will help make our project easily available on your electronic book reading tablet device and this new thing called the inter-web or net … whatever the kids are calling it these days.

Promotion and Distribution – 20%

We do not expect everyone who wants to read Glorious Atrocities and Barbaric Nobles  to come to our homes and pick up their copy in person. We will almost certainly need to ship our product to many places around the world. We will also need to help many people around the world learn about Glorious Atrocities and Barbaric Nobles in the first place. Hence, promotion and distribution costs.

Incidentals – 2%

Sometimes we forget things. Sometimes we need things we did not think of. Sometimes things come up. Life happens. We plan to allocate two percent of our budget to the “what if” category, in case we forget things or something unexpected happens.

Together, those number add up to 100%

 

I like what I see, I like what I hear. So how can I help?

The best way to help us get Glorious Atrocities and Barbaric Nobles into your hands is to donate to our project through this page. Check out the Perks to see what we plan to offer to our supporters, and follow us on Instagram/Facebook/Twitter as well, in order to get to know us better and learn more about who we are and what we do. Although it goes without saying, we really appreciate any support we receive. We also believe that a project like this is made even more amazing as a result of the fact that fans, friends, family, supporters, and well-wishers have the opportunity to be part of turning our dream into reality.

 

The Impact

We have always believed that the world is a soul-crushing, dream-smashing, life-sucking, and downright Terra Bulla place. However, when independent creators have opportunities to share their creations with the world, it can sometimes become a little bit better. There's always a glimmer of hope out there somewhere (www.facebook.com/terrabullaink).

Yes, we see the good, the bad, and the satire in everything, especially Christmas. 

By helping us get our creation out into the world, you will also be helping the world itself. We want to make sure that this year's Christmas season is not dominated entirely by the usual concoction of trends and fads and mega-corps and all the other revolting mass-consumerism that goes hand in hand with the festive season.

We're sure you're on the same page. 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

We know we are small fish in a very big pond. We also know that when new and/or aspiring writers attempt to enter into a world dominated by very big names with very big followings, things might not go exactly as planned.

The risks associated with Glorious Atrocities and Barbaric Nobles are fairly minimal, but it is somewhat possible that the costs we have budgeted for will increase, distribution of the book to the greater multiverse will run into obstacles, and a meteor could strike the earth AT ANY TIME which could result in all of this hard work being completely wasted OR scattered amidst the remainders of human civilization to one day be found and then reused by some alien race for their own bizarre and/or narcissistic purposes. We sincerely hope none of those things happen, but stranger things have happened.

To put that another way, we may have to use some of our own personal finances, in addition to the funds we collect, to offset unforeseen costs. We might also run into trouble getting the book distributed and have to do more leg work than we planned. We might also find out that some people do not like the book as much as we do … improbable, but it could happen.

However, there is very little (aside from that pesky and devastating meteor) that could stop us from actually completing this project, getting the book printed, making it available, and getting it into the hands of those who really want it.

Terra Bulla Ink is doing this on its own, Terra Bulla Ink has been doing this on its own for years, and no one has the power to stop us from doing this except Terra Bulla Ink.

Our biggest challenge will be taking our self-published collection of short stories and turning it into a widely loved property that sits on bookshelves alongside the work of other well renowned writers and storytellers. Of course, that is our own challenge, and it will not get in the way of us getting Glorious Atrocities and Barbaric Nobles to our supporters and fans (especially those who help us with the funding).

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and Terra Bulla Ink gets that, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask others to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Remind them to use all known varieties of social media as well as word of mouth, and the Indiegogo share tools.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
HOLOS c’est quoi?


HOLOS est un chemin du retour à la maison, à l’Unité! Une voie rapide et verticale pour se connecter à notre essence originelle. C’est une visualisation qui propose de retrouver cette partie de nous dont nous avons été séparés à la naissance, le Placenta. Cette Pratique a été pour moi et pour plusieurs l’accès au grand retour à SOI.

Ce que nous avons cherché en vain à l’extérieur, est là, à l’intérieur. Notre quête vers l’absolu prend fin. Connectée, je me sens confiante ou que je sois, car je sais que les ressources sont là. C’est ce que la pratique HOLOS m’a appris : un chemin direct de Présence en SOI.

HOLOS propose de vous connecter à votre essence, de trouver Votre Vérité et d’Être profondément vous-mêmes, libres!
Un rôle à jouer? Le vôtre! Rien d’autre…


Qui est Ginette?

« Nous entendons beaucoup parler d’ouverture de conscience et de développement personnel. Ginette vit et porte cette connexion au plus grand que soi dans sa vie quotidienne. Elle incarne l’amour et les gens qui la côtoient aiment tous être pris dans ses bras et goûter à un contact de cœur à cœur sans aucune retenue. » (…)

« Dans ce livre, vous allez découvrir son parcours personnel qu’elle dévoile avec beaucoup d’humilité : nous comprenons peu à peu comment elle est parvenue à son état actuel d’ouverture, de présence, d’amour et de joie. Comment ses passions, ses rencontres l’ont amené de l’art vers le rebirth, la méditation puis vers la naissance et la création d’Holos. »

Extrait de la Préface d’Isabelle Challut


Auteure de cette page :


Ginette Forget : Je suis une artiste de la Présence, Créatrice de la Pratique HOLOS, auteure du livre « HOLOS, La Présence en SOI ». En 1986, j’ai fondé l’école « Souffle de vie » où j’ai enseigné le rebirth, la méditation et le Cours en Miracles, ce qui m’a amené à enseigner à l’international. Mon attention se porte maintenant sur L’Art de la PRÉSENCE et je me laisse guider là où la vie me porte. J’aime rencontrer les gens et transmettre en direct, dans la simplicité du moment. Ce que vous retrouvez sur ma chaîne Youtube sont des extraits de ces rencontres que j’offre. 


http://ginetteforget.blogspot.ca/
http://www.lapratiqueholos.blogspot.ca/ 


À quoi servira la collecte ?
Votre soutien m’aidera à payer les professionnels que le mode d’édition adopté nécessite. 

A savoir: le graphisme et l'infographie, la correction, la mise en page, l'impression ainsi que la conversion en EPub.

Il permet également de créer un lien entre nous dans la joie et l’entraide.. MERCI!


En Euros, voici une approximation des prix équivalents : 

  • MP3 : 5€
  • Livre numérique : 8€
  • MP3 + livre numérique : 13€
  • Livre papier : 17€
  • Livre papier + MP3 : 19,50€
  • Livre papier + MP3 + Skype : 45,50€
  • 3 livres : 45,50€
  • 10 livres : 145€


D'autres façons de m’aider

N'hésitez pas à partager le site de la pré-vente, ma chaine Youtube ou ma page Facebook ou à offrir un forfait cadeau à un ami(e)..


Cas particuliers d'envois 

Pour toutes commande hors Europe-Canada et Etats-Unis, veillez prendre contact avec l'auteure avant la commande, des frais de livraison supplémentaires s'appliqueront. Merci de votre compréhension.


Pour en savoir plus sur les Éditions du Grand Ruisseau, vous pouvez aller sur leur site web ou les contacter à cette adresse :

info@editionsdugrandruisseau.ca


Un immense merci de votre lecture attentive, de votre générosité, de votre amour et de votre bienveillance.. et au plaisir que nos chemins se croisent :-)

story:
What is the Weekly List?

The “new normal” of American politics is not normal. The Weekly List reminds us of that. On a weekly basis, the List tracks specific news stories representing eroding norms under the current regime. Taken together, they reveal a nation pushed towards authoritarianism, the wielding of unchecked governmental authority by one person or group at the expense of the freedom of those who oppose them.

How is this possible? Weary from the 2016 election, many voters embraced uninformed obliviousness, unquestioning optimism, or an uncritically visceral reaction for or against the new administration. Instead, Amy Siskind sought facts. The Weekly List was born on November 20, 2016, chronicling Amy’s findings. Originally for her friends and social media followers, the List quickly went viral. The earliest weeks listed fewer than a dozen items. Now, nearly a year later, each week brings with it at least one-hundred new abnormalities.

Who is Amy Siskind?

After leaving Wall Street, Amy helped co-found The New Agenda, a national women’s advocacy organization, in 2008. As the President of The New Agenda, Amy continues to work toward equitable gender representation, fair pay, and women’s networking, while fighting against sexual assault and gender bias. Amy is also an activist in the LGBTQ community. Because the welfare of women and other marginalized communities and the welfare of our democracy are inseparable, Amy’s advocacy for equality now occurs alongside her mission as one of the most thorough and vocal observers of our failing-but-not-yet-failed democracy.

Why a Website?

The Weekly List has taken on a life of its own. In the beginning, it was enough for the Weekly List to exist. Now it needs to be as visible, permanent, and independent as possible. A freestanding website under Amy’s direct control is the obvious solution.

Although it will continue to be published weekly on Medium and will be archived by the Library of Congress, Amy and her allies need a central place online for sharing videos, links, and other resources for those wanting to fully inform themselves to help save our democracy. An independent website will also preserve the Weekly List for posterity. The website will launch later this fall.

Where does your contribution go?

Startup costs include website design and development, domain registration, and the licensing of editorial images and other proprietary content. Maintenance costs include the hosting, security, licensing of editorial images, and ongoing upkeep.

Why Only Small Contributions?

This is a grassroots effort. No one should be priced out of saving our democracy. As a result, the maximum contribution is $25.

All donors will be recognized on the List website (you may opt out of this recognition.)

Where Can I Read More?

The original home of the list on Amy’s thread on Medium

Margaret Sullivan’s Washington Post column on the Weekly List’s spike in popularity

MoveOn.org’s interviews with Amy [Interview #1] [Interview #2] [Interview #3]

As “The Chronicler of Fallen Norms,” Amy’s ranking among The Politico 50 of 2017

Follow Amy on Facebook or Twitter

story:
Update: This Indiegogo store will close down sometime in the evening of 31 December 2019. (Indiegogo is no longer available in South Africa.) I'm doing final orders for 2019, and will dispatch all parcels from the US and UK by 10 January 2020.
 

The backstory

For years as a digital rights campaigner, I’ve been talking to grown-ups about data privacy. But I wanted a playful, engaging way to start a discussion with the kids in my life about these issues.

So I wrote and illustrated Boris the BabyBot, the world’s first (?) children’s book about corporate surveillance.

Data collection may seem like a scary topic for adults, but kids are smart and curious and resilient – especially when it comes to the frolics and follies of a beeping, booping, baby-tracking robot.

Boris the BabyBot is written for ages 3-5, and grown-ups of all ages.

Through its whimsical illustration and playful repetition, this book aims to amuse and delight young minds, and maybe help spark an important conversation about the world around them.

The response to this book has been incredible -- we met our funding goal on Indiegogo in less than a week, and it's been featured on the BBC and Reuters, to name a few.


 

What it took to get Boris published

Boris the BabyBot is a 40-page, full-color picture book. (Its page count and dimensions have been upgraded due to the early success of the crowdfunding campaign.)

After the campaign's massive success, we've published it as a hardcover, with high-quality gloss-art paper inside, at a print-run of 2500 books.

Funds raised went directly to completing, printing, and distributing this book:


 


Donating books
I'm a supporter of Nal’ibali (South Africa’s awesome national reading campaign), which promotes the power of stories to spark kids’ imaginations and curiosity about the world. We donated 10% of the print run to reading clubs through our friends at Nal'ibali.
 

What you got for backing Boris

Some of the perks for those who supported the publishing of Boris the BabyBot:

  • Vinyl stickers - for laptops, fridges, lunchboxes, etc
  • The book, in glorious hardcover
  • Boris lapel buttons, assembled with love
  • A Boris-branded anti-spying webcam shield
  • Limited-edition hand-printed lino art by activist-mama-sociologist Natasha Vally.
  • Limited edition hand-crafted onesie/toddler t-shirt
  • Limited edition hand-crafted tree ornaments
     

Why this book matters

Why a story book about surveillance? Well - why not?

The main goal of Boris the BabyBot is to delight young readers.

The future of privacy is a really important issue, and if this book opens up a conversation between kids and grown-ups, great!

But I didn't want to be prescriptive or try to hammer home a lesson.

And yet, amid the silliness and mischief, Boris the BabyBot does offer some basic visual references for invisible and abstract concepts of ‘data collection’, which could help shape a child's awareness of these processes as they grow and develop.

And if not, at least we had fun!
 

Deliveries

story:
Introduction

Hello there! I'm Heather, and I've been writing and talking about history since 1991 when I started a summer job at a Revolutionary War museum when I was in high school. In 1998 I built my first history website, on Colonial America. And in 2009 I started the Renaissance English History Podcast, which makes it one of the longest continuously running indie history podcasts. 

In 2016 I created the 2017 Tudor Planner, a weekly/monthly planner that brings together history with planning - something that I definitely need as a mom with a young kiddo, who is also an entrepreneur (me, not the kiddo, though I'm sure she'll be an entrepreneur when she's older!). I've always loved planners, since I bought my first Ziggy assignment book - I color coded my assignments with Crayola skinny markers (the Bold colors - do they still make those?).

So creating a Tudor Planner was really a mixture of the two things I love - Tudor history, and planners. The first one was way more successful than I ever imagined, and last year, for the 2018 one, I worked with a printer. I'm working with the same printer this year, but making even more improvements, which is driving the cost up. 

Some of the changes I'm making this year are stickers (!!!), and tabs in between each week - both of those were major requests. I'm also adding in more holidays and Tudor historical days. It's going to be awesome!

 

What We Need & What You Get

The initial print run is going to cost about $10,000. I'm crowdfunding for most of that so that I can offset my up front costs. I'm using the same printer as last year, so I know the quality will be just as good as before. 

What you get by supporting the planner are:
1) You get to be involved from the very early stages - I'll keep you updated as things happen like we get proofs, and the print run happens. 
2) You get the planner at a way discounted price - it won't be this inexpensive again this year.
3) Awesome perks! 

All the money I raise will go towards these printing costs. Even if I don't make the full amount, I'll use everything I get towards paying the printer. 

 

The Impact

I'm a huge believer in building empathy and peace through history. As we learn more about the motivations of people from the past, and start to really understand them, it builds our empathy muscle, and helps us understand people who are different than we are today. I also see the connections between Tudor England and today - it's a time very similar to our own. New technologies made disseminating information easier than ever before, with less control than ever before. Wars of religion mixed with exploration made the world seem more in touch than ever, yet also led to people being nervous about their own culture, and fearful of the unknown. There are so many parallels. These are the stories I tell in my podcast.

The planner is a major source of income for me, and helps to keep my show running, and independent. It helps to keep me doing these shows every week or two, and keep bringing these stories alive. It also allows me to create events that bring together Tudor enthusiasts from around the world, like the Tudor Summit, a virtual online event that happens every six months, and features leading historians, bloggers, and podcasters in the Tudor World. All of this takes time, and energy, and the Planner is a major way that my work is supported. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't support the campaign financially, you can make a huge difference by sharing my work with others. Share the podcast. Share this project. Tell your friends who are into planning, and history. There are easy share tools right here on the Indiegogo page. Share, share, share!

And thank you!!!

story:
Story of My Book

In Love With A Lie is about a boy who meets a girl, falls in love, and starts to discover who he is during the midst of the worst time in his life.

My name is Stanley Ihejirika and I am the author of In Love With A Lie. I wrote this book because I wanted people to see what falling in love can be like when your world is crashing down.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how chaotic life situations can impact who you are and how you love. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for love/romance stories within you. And ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you understand why the person you fell in love with may change after a chaotic situation.

In this book, you'll learn about love and chaos:

  • Brothers but not by blood - Dame and Trey first meet in one of the most random ways. They are different in every way, but it’s these differences that have shaped them to become who they are. Dame can be lost in his head more than in the world. Trey is able to make him live in the world and not his head.
  • Death of a loved one - Dame loses his dad—the man he idolizes most, and his last conversation with him was the worst ever.
  • Personality - Dame is quiet and doesn’t interact with women too much. But for this girl he lays it all on the line. Not every guy can be outgoing, charming, or flirtatious. A lot of us are quiet and reserved. Our worst fear is talking to girls that we think are above us or we are unworthy of. Dame fights that fear while being pulled by two girls he feels he doesn’t deserve.

You will love this book if you love humor, real life situations, Chicago, and romance. In Love With A Lie is a fiction book that speaks to people who’ve been manipulated and heart broken, and who are looking at their pain and the way they evolved from it for the first time.

 

The Book - In Love With A Lie

The book is written in 3 Parts.

  • Part 1 contains the Introduction + Chapters 1-3. You are introduced to Dame, his family network, friends and his internal struggle.
  • Part 2 contains Chapters 4-7. You will learn about Dame’s first love and the interactions that start to mold him in different ways. In one part, Dame is going on a college tour that he’s excited about. He heard his first love say she liked a man with a button up shirt, so that’s what he decides to wear when he sees her next.
  • Part 3 contains Chapters 8-10. You will see the breaking and the building up of Dame. For once, he has to decide who he is and not what the world is trying to define him to be. In one situation, Dame gets into an emotional, heated argument with his counselor who sees through the anger to the immense pain.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

 

About the Author

Stanley Ihejirika is an alumni of Michigan State University where he earned a bachelors in Political Science. He is a fanatic of poetry and beautiful romance stories and movies. What he believes love is can be fully encompassed in the movie ‘Aladdin’. Stanley’s favorite author is Nicholas Sparks and his favorite days are spent reading his books with a great meal.

He wrote this book to show how movies and books can be drastically different than real life, but have real life applications. He wanted people to feel they are not alone in being scarred from love.

He is extremely shy, especially when it comes to letting girls know his own feelings. So how he got a girlfriend is still confusing to him. But he loves to read about how passion can make someone feel. He watches a scene between Richard Castle and Beckett in the show “Castle” over and over for inspiration.

For more information you can connect with Stanley at stanleysvision@yahoo.com and on Twitter @PoeticGeni.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Stanley Ihejirika

story:
Story of My Book

Free from Me, Free to Be

My name is Luke Schumacher and I am the author of Free from Me, Free to Be. I wrote this book because I want young adults to see how they can be Christians and still enjoy the newfound freedoms they get in college/after high school.

In reading this book, you will discover what it truly means to be free. Through this book, I want the same passion and excitement that I have for Jesus and the Gospel to be found in you. Ultimately, I want you to use this book as a tool to help you understand what freedom in Christ looks like.

In this book, you'll learn about positive and negative freedoms as well as read stories about:
  • Josh Thames and his rodeo adventure
  • Luke Lezon and how he explains freedom
  • My college experience and faith journey

You will love this book if you are a young adult and don't know what to expect when you go off into “the real world” or if you are a parent and want to give your child a collection of stories for them to learn from.

Free from Me, Free to Be is a non-fiction book that speaks to young people, and parents of young adults, who are looking at what sort of new challenges students face in college and how the freedom Christ gives us what is essential for facing those challenges for the first time.

The Book - Free from Me, Free to Be

The book is written in 3 parts

Part 1 Contains the Introduction + Chapters 1-3. In this section, you'll learn about the idea of positive and negative freedoms as well as the first years of “freedom” that some people experienced.

Part 2 Contains Chapters 4-6. In these chapters, I talk about some of the negative views of freedom and challenges that young people face in college. I show how, as a Christian, we're free from those burdens.

Part 3 Contains Chapters 7-13. In these chapters, I talk about positive freedom and the ways that it applies to young adults who are Christian.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish February 2020.
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #FreeToBe and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

About the Author

Luke Schumacher is a journalist in the Dallas-Fort Worth, Texas area and recent graduate from the University of Oklahoma.

While he was in college, Luke noticed how many other young adults who called themselves Christians were more eager to enjoy their newfound freedoms than to follow Christ. It was during a conversation with some peers that he heard the term “Collegiate Christianity” that he wanted to write a book about freedom and enjoying the college experience. However, it is not intended to be treated as a rule book of what to do and not to do.

When he is not working on the book, Luke loves writing fiction, poetry and anything creative that pops into his head. If you see him writing with earbuds in, he is probably listening to Christian metal music. Luke also enjoys playing video games, photography, watching movies and petting every corgi and golden retriever he comes across.

For more information, you can connect with Luke at schustories@gmail.com, on Linked In (https://www.linkedin.com/in/luke-schumacher-1a0...), or on Instagram @schunotshoe.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support! God bless!

Thanks again,
Luke Schumacher

In this section, you'll learn about the idea of positive and negative freedoms as well as the first years of “freedom” that some people experienced.Part 2 Contains Chapters 4-6. In these chapters, I talk about some of the negative views of freedom and challenges that young people face in college. I show how, as a Christian, we're free from those burdens.Part 3 Contains Chapters 7-13. In these chapters, I talk about positive freedom and the ways that it applies to young adults who are Christian. What I Need & What You'll Get This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February 2020.
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish February 2020.
 When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #FreeToBe and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

About the Author
Luke Schumacher is a journalist in the Dallas-Fort Worth, Texas area and recent graduate from the University of Oklahoma.While he was in college, Luke noticed how many other young adults who called themselves Christians were more eager to enjoy their newfound freedoms than to follow Christ. It was during a conversation with some peers that he heard the term “Collegiate Christianity” that he wanted to write a book about freedom and enjoying the college experience. However, it is not intended to be treated as a rule book of what to do and not to do.When he is not working on the book, Luke loves writing fiction, poetry and anything creative that pops into his head. If you see him writing with earbuds in, he is probably listening to Christian metal music. Luke also enjoys playing video games, photography, watching movies and petting every corgi and golden retriever he comes across.For more information, you can connect with Luke at schustories@gmail.com, on Linked In (https://www.linkedin.com/in/luke-schumacher-1a0...), or on Instagram @schunotshoe.
Thank you so much for all of your love and support! God bless!Thanks again,Luke Schumacher

story:
Que?

Hai que roelo reflicte unha época mediante os acontecementos que xiran ao redor dun modesto equipo de fútbol.

Ao berro de «Hai que roelo!» a afección galega ateigaba as gradas do Estadio de Pasarón. Alí, un equipo formado por xogadores descoñecidos para o gran público, facía as ledicias dos afeccionados galegos ao deporte do balón. Paralelamente aos éxitos deportivos do equipo granate, Galicia esperta paseniñamente da súa ancestral e eterna noite. Tres amigos reúnense nas tabernas da cidade do Lérez para comentar o devir cotián daqueles anos, así coma os éxitos dos Cobo, Irulegui, Batalla, Cholo e compañía. Aínda que coinciden na análise social da época, teñen distintos pareceres en como afrontalos derradeiros anos do franquismo, que van de o roturismo radical que representa o avogado Pedro Fontales ata a inacción do seu amigo, o xornalista chairego Amador Sanfiz, que é un home da Galicia interior, dese territorio costumista que carece dun mínimo de auto estima, malia que sabe que así non se vai a ningures. No medio deles irrompe Moncho Botes, un retranqueiro por excelencia que prefire unha terceira vía.

Na súa novela, Antonio Cendán lévanos a esa Galicia dos sesenta, na que a do interior e o litoral se ignoran mutuamente a extremos que raian co paroxismo.

Quen?

Do Peirao é unha editorial con vontade de cambio, de dar a alternativa a autores que non a atopan noutro lugar, con novas e refrescantes ideas como é o empregar unha campaña preventa para valorar a aceptación e viabilidade de cada título.

Deste xeito es ti, agora que te estás expondo como colaborar, o que decide se a obra que che presentamos verá a luz pasando a formar parte do noso catálogo... porque consideramos ao lector parte fundamental do proceso.

Hoxe presentámosche a Antonio Cendán.

Nado na parroquia chairega de Sancobade, no concello de Vilalba, licenciouse en Xornalismo pola Universidade Complutense de Madrid en 1989. Sete anos máis tarde, en 1996, obtería o doutorado polo mesmo centro académico despois de defender unha tese de doutoramento baixo o título El Sistema Informativo en Galicia durante el franquismo, coa que obtivo a máxima cualificación académica.

O xornalista chairego desenvolveu o seu labor profesional en distintos medios de comunicación entre eles a Axencia EFE, Televisión de Galicia e os xornais El Mundo e La Voz de Galicia. Así mesmo foi columnista do xornal compostelán El Correo Gallego e colaborador asiduo de diversos medios dixitais.

Aínda que esta é a súa primeira novela, Antonio Cendán publicou varios ensaios sobre o xornalismo galego, converténdose no maior experto na historia dos medios de comunicación galegos. Entre as súas obras destacan Xornalismo e Medios de Comunicación en Galicia durante o Franquismo, A Televisión en Galicia e A Prensa en Galicia a partir de 1976.

Por que?

Por aquí un fragmento do texto como mostra:

«O domingo vindeiro comeza a liga en tódalas categorías nacionais. Amador Sanfiz, o xornalista chairego, ten que seguir ao Pontevedra. Unha entrevista súa causa sensación mundial, xa que se fai eco ela o xornal soviético Pravda. Vén de entrevistar ao defensa Cholo, do que salienta a súa categoría profesional sen deixar tampouco de lado que é condutor de trolebús. O xornal ruso ensalza ao equipo galego, dicindo que é o dos traballadores, nun pais no que o fútbol está superprofesionalizado. Os xornais deportivos loan unha Galicia que agora nace nas Rías Baixas. Os dous amigos de Amador Sanfiz, Moncho Botes e Pedro Fontales, seguen con paixón ao equipo granate que se enfronta ao Athletic Bilbaíno, tal e como dirían os xornais de hai trinta anos».

Como?

Para arrincar o proxecto fixámonos como obxectivo 880€; esta é a cantidade que recadariamos se ao redor de cincuenta mecenas se fixesen, cada cal, cun exemplar desta primeira edición.

  • Tendo acceso ás galeradas de edición.
  • Recibindo un exemplar semanas antes da saída ao mercado da obra.
  • Aínda que, tamén poderías ver o teu nome nos agradecementos achegando un pouco máis.

Os fondos recadados utilizaranse como axuda para sacar adiante esta primeira edición de Hai que roelo, que sairía despois á venda.

Ademais...

Sabemos que son tempos difíciles, tamén nós os sufrimos, e é posible que non esteas en disposición de apoiarnos co teu mecenado nestes momentos... pero agardamos que se isto te chegou á alma, mesmo se talvez coñeces en persoa ao autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-orella... ) para que academos a nosa meta e Antonio Cendán vexa publicada a súa obra.

Grazas polo voso tempo.

story:
Short Summary

My name is A.C. Burton and I am the author of Find Me in the Trenches. I wrote this book to reflect on my own testimony, as I struggled with family trauma at the end of my childhood which led to an identity crisis during my adulthood. This experience has led me through several years of seasonal defective disorder and I was ultimately diagnosed with mild depression in 2018.

My hope is, in reading this book, readers can discover what it takes to ultimately begin the process of healing - in family, relationships, and in self-identity. In this book, I hope to instill in readers the same sort of passion and excitement I have for the journey of healing and renewal of human spirit. Ultimately, I want readers to use this book as a testimony to share how overcoming adversity can be the ultimate strength to be resilient towards life’s challenges.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

The Impact

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #FindMeintheTrenches and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
A.C. Burton

story:
What is Mighty Myths?

MIGHTY MYTHS is a book series for 7 to 12 year olds about ancient myths. It’s a funny, easy to read, comical retelling of the classic stories loaded with humour, drawings, quizzes and adventure. It’s sort of like Andy Griffiths meets Horrible Histories! 

Check out the free sample of MIGHTY MYTHS: Greek Heroes- click the picture below!

 

Getting Kids Reading

MIGHTY MYTHS is all about getting kids reading. Scholastic has shown that the main thing kids want in a book is fun and laughs. That’s what parents want too, to have their children reading and laughing.

MIGHTY MYTHS is educational but really it’s all about the laughs. We agree, the best way to get kids reading is to get them laughing.

 

Giving Back

As well as getting kids reading, we also really want to help kids in marginalised communities improve their reading and writing. So we're going to donate 10% of this fund raising campaign to two wonderful children's literacy charity, The Reading Room and The Australian Literacy and Numeracy Foundation.

 

The Story so far...

Mick and I stumbled across MIGHTY MYTHS, Eighteen months ago. We were completely hooked. It was so much fun we just had to do it.

Our book sample nabbed us an agent who almost snagged us a publishing deal but after a year of drawn out negotiations, it collapsed.

Still totally passionate about Mighty Myths we decided to bypass the publishers, and ask our audience, 7 to 12 year olds,  what they thought of MIGHTY MYTHS?

We started with my son, Joey’s, year 6 class and have now surveyed 152 children and discovered that 90% of them (yes we have the stats) LOVE MIGHTY MYTHS!

Writing, illustrating and producing a 120 page kids book is a HUGE job, but with your support we can get MIGHTY MYTHS: Greek Heroes made and into kids hands where it belongs!

 

About Us

Mick Wannenmacher and myself, Andrew Traucki, have been writing for  years. I have written three produced feature films, Black Water, The Reef and The Jungle. Mick is a former primary school teacher currently writing and performing in the Los Angeles comedy scene.

 

How You Can Help Create a Book

Being in a classroom, watching kids laugh as they read your writing, is an amazing experience that has made us extremely passionate about MIGHTY MYTHS. 

With your help, we can make sure that MIGHTY MYTHS gets made and gets kids reading.

By ordering MIGHTY MYTHS: Greek Heroes during this campaign, you'll not only get an exclusive Indiegogo copy of MIGHTY MYTHS but you'll also help bring a book to life!

We’ve got some great rewards on offer including:

1. Soft Cover copies of MIGHTY MYTHS: Greek Heroes

2. Being drawn as a Greek Hero!

3. Hard cover copies and getting drawn into the book

We’re very lucky to have all of you who appreciate the value of reading, and want to see kids reading and laughing. 

Spread The Word!!!

You can also help by, posting on your social media channels, getting kids reading the free download and telling others, every bit helps. Truly!

To post to your own page, click the social media icons at the top of this page. You can visit our pages here.

Facebook 

Instagram

and The Mighty Myths Website

Anything you do to get the word out is greatly appreciated!

Also If you'd like to Back Us for an amount of your choice, click the Back It button, at the top right of this page.

 

Thank You

Many, many thanks to the Australian School Library Association, the hundreds of boys and girls that provided feedback and all of you who are backing us. We really appreciate your help. It's wonderful to feel supported and have so many good people help us  create MIGHTY MYTHS.

story:
Truth. 

We seek the truth, we deserve the truth, in anything. In this book it is my goal to answer the many unanswered questions about one of the most bizarre terrorist attacks of the past decade. My research left no stone unturned and the results are astonishing. 

Funds. 

In order to get the technical side covered: cover design, editing and printing, we need $5,000. It would be great to have this money before mid-summer so that the book, fresh from the printing machine, will be made available in time for the anniversary of the Moscow theatre siege. And, of course, all of you, will get a signed copy.  

 

The Impact.

Your contribution will make an enormous difference, including to those who lost their loved ones in the siege, and who feel that 'the truth will never come out'.

With your help the first proper non-biased account of the events will see the light of day. 

For me this is the work of many years, but, most importantly, with your help, this is a chance to right a wrong. 

 

Please let others know!

I would greatly appreciate it if you could spread the word about our campaign and what we are trying to do! It can be done very easily with a link to Facebook or twitter!

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH!

Funds.

story:
It's not over yet folks! LAST WEEK! LAST WEEK!

Help Raise $10,000 to cover costs of The New Rockstar Philosophy Book! 

The New Rockstar Philosophy is all about helping artists understand businesss and navigate the digital world we live in. We've been around for 5 years and we've been giving away our game changing content to all readers who were embracing the digital evolution as artists. In that time we've managed to:

  • Release our ebook in 2010 to thousands of downloads.
  • Had a fan translate it into Italian
  • That fan turned out to be the engineer for the MUSE, Tommaso Colliva
  • Tommaso helped get The New Rockstar Philosophy published in Italy in 2011
  • The New Rockstar Philosophy won Best New Book of the Year in Italy
  • In 2012 signed a collaborative partnership agreement with indie book publisher Indie Ink to get the physical book out in stores across North America, and promote it

But what we want to do now is go that final step. We need your help to cover the costs of getting The New Rockstar Philosophy printed in English. 

With the deal we've signed with Indie Ink, we're coming into the process as partners. So we want to extend that partnership to you because you guys have been asking for the physical book since the beginning.  

What You Can Do: 

Order Your Copy of The New Rockstar Philosophy via the Rewards. 

You've always wanted to help us out and have a copy of the "real" book. Here is your chance to do both. Plus we have more than just books to offer as rewards. But before we get there let's explain exactly where this money is going. We need to raise $10,000 to pay for:

  • the first run of printing costs
  • the art work for the cover

Yep it's that simple and straight forward. The coolest part is that through this campaign you'll get a chance to pre-order the book before ANYONE ELSE. You'll be the cool kid on the block! 

What Your Support Means:

The New Rockstar Philosophy has had a long and interesting journey to get to this point. We've been trying to ingnite new thoughts in our readers minds for 5 years. That's like 15 in Internet Years. We didn't know where these ideas would take us but we kept going. With your support of this campaign will help us:

  • Keep The New Rockstar Philosophy alive and going with new ideas and content
  • Expand our coverage to more music industry events
  • Share and spread the New Rockstar Philosophy ideas and help more bands transform their love into a full time income. 
  • Prove that the online world is a viable and real alternative to going the traditional route.

Tell Your Friends

The biggest reason The New Rockstar Philosophy has grown so much is because of people sharing our content. If you think any of your friends could use the New Rockstar Philosophy please tell them about our campaign and share it with them.

Thank You!

story:
Short Summary

UPDATE: THANK YOU FOR HELPING ME ACHIEVE MY PRE-ORDERS GOAL!

SO HOW DOES THIS WORK AND WHY CONTINUE WITH YOUR PRE-ORDER?  

I set the preorder funding at $2500, a number to help me raise money TOWARD printing.  In simple math terms, 250 books x 17.00 (the avg. cost I estimated receiving from preorders) = $4250.00.  I didn't think I could raise $4250.00 so I estimated something I felt I could achieve.  As of now, (including proofs) I've sold 161 books.  That means, I still have about 90 more to go! 

So you ARE STILL HELPING reduce my out of pocket costs by ordering early!  Thank you so much.

MY STORY 

Five 1/2 years.  That's how long it's been since I first sat down to write this novel. As a former reporter, I wrote timely stories in a day.  As a t.v. writer for Tyler Perry, I wrote episodes in a week.  But this book was the hardest piece of writing I've ever done.  I'd been told over the years, write faster, you're taking too long. From an artistic viewpoint, for an incredible true story that involves both history and an autistic character lost in the cracks of time, I had to take the special care to do my absolute best.  I believe writing a great book is akin to making fine wine.  To achieve the highest excellence, first, you must start with the highest quality fruit which takes time to cultivate.

When I began the journey of trying to tell the story of a remarkable figure lost in history-Thomas Bethune, a slave born blind and feeble, left for dead, who began playing Mozart at three-I didn't think I had the ability to write it. After a few drafts and receiving 48 rejection letters from agents, I returned to the story, took writing classes for two years, and nearly five years and a hundred drafts later, here I am. 

What I Need & What You Get

I need a minimum, 250 preorders, to help reduce the cost of printing the books for either 1000 paperback books or 500 hardback books.  What you get is an autographed copy of the book if your order is more than $20 and other perks as described on the site.

    The Impact

    You know Herr Mozart, you've heard of Maestro Beethoven, but do you know Maestro Thomas?  As a lifelong storyteller in film and journalism, my deepest desire is to share with the world the once famous Blind Tom, how he thrilled heads of state, frustrated his master, dazzled Mark Twain, and mesmerized the world.  How his life was in danger, how he rose to become the most famous figure on earth, an American virtuoso treated as a P.T. Barnum-type freak performer, who fell into obscurity.  I want the world to know, Thomas Bethune is America's Mozart.  That's my dream and your preorder of the book helps me move closer to that goal. 

    It was the best feeling when a music professor at a Seattle university thanked me for introducing him to Blind Tom's compositions and now he has started to incorporate his compositional works into the music curriculum.

    Risks & Challenges

    Self-publishing isn't an easy endeavor.  It's very difficult to stand out in a sea of authors, which is why I spent so much time and care on the book-to make it special.  I'm honored and humbled by the U.S. librarians Library Journal recognizing my book as the holiday must read for November 2015.  Now, there's one last hurdle.  As a self-publisher I need your help to bring the printing costs down.  I need to sell 250 to order 500 hardbacks or 1000 paperbacks. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some of you are not readers and perhaps others are unable to contribute due to financial constraints.  You can purchase a book as a gift for someone else or simply make a smaller donation. If you can't buy a book or you're not a historical fiction reader, just know every $5.00 donation helps toward the goal of making a book order.  If that's not possible for you, there are other ways you can help! Tell others! Please help support me by forwarding this campaign to your friends and telling them about the book.  I'd really appreciate it.  I need you.  Will you support me?  

    Thank you, all of you, and a special thanks to all of you who have been in my corner for all these years.  It means more than you know.


    Always,


    A.M. Cal

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone! The purpose of this campaign is to fund the publishing of our children's book. We have a subsidized offer from a publisher to publish the first of what we hope will be a series of children's books. 

The series is based on the true life adventures of my sister Kristen and I. We lived in a small town and grew up on a little farm across the street from an apple orchard so we had plenty of adventures! The first book is called A Little Magic by the Stream. We have a very talented illustrator working with us to bring these adventures to life! 

Here's the story:

On a Saturday...

 ...it began with a walk

 .....that finds a hole in the fence

 .......that finds the path

 .....that leads to a stream

 ....and a tree with a swing

 ....they follow the stream

 ...bath some frogs as they sing

 ...."nice and shiney and clean" 

......an eye spots a cat tail

 .....but they see magic wands

 ....and wave them until they stumble upon

.... the road that leads back home.

Please help us make this dream a reality!

What We Need & What You Get

  • The minimum package is for publishing our book is $6,900 and this includes a yearlong marketing package.
  • This money will make it possible to make a dream a reality

The Impact

I don't know that these books will have that significant of an impact but I like to think the story of our friendship and the childhood we enjoyed can help children long for strong family relationships and a realization that they can have endless adventures if they go outside and use their imaginations.

That may be too lofty of a goal...but it will help us accomplish one of our life goals and if nothing else - then our family will have these books to enjoy.

    Risks & Challenges

    We already have the offer - so I do not foresee any obstacles once we've reached our fundraising goal.


        And that's about all there is to it.
