story:
Basic Synopsis:

 Kyan Rawlings’ life has been forever changed by an incident he wishes he could erase from his memory, but never will. After this unspeakable tragedy, he is left with Post Traumatic Stress and a state of irascibility. However, little does he know, that the most significant change in his somewhat mundane life is yet to come. Dealing with the perfunctory day-to-day is nothing compared to finding out what he truly is. He discovers that he is an Adept, a powerful animal kindred spirit. Unwittingly, Kyan will not only become immersed in a world that he does not understand, but also protecting a woman he only recently met, Drea, from an unseen force. She is one of four remaining Dragons, a dying breed, and the Prince of the clan wants her for the sole purpose of reviving their kind. In order to protect her, Kyan will need the help Berik Woodson, who will give him the guidance he needs to fully accept his place in the animal kingdom and how to control the rage within.

I have already completed the first book in the trilogy.  I will be starting graduate school in the fall to begin workshopping it.  My goal is to have it published by that time.  I am taking a road trip to Seattle and then to Vancouver in the next couple weeks.  This is an integral part of the beginning of the second novel.  The characters take this journey as the story unfolds. 

As I writer, I generally try and write from my own experience or at least try to relate to what the characters are going through.  I believe this makes the situation seem as real as possible, even in fiction/fantasy.  I felt committed and obligated to take the journey the characters will take myself as part of my writing process.  

As a result of this trip, I can begin to write the second book.  I have been unable to really delve into it, because this road trip is kind of a huge prerequisite.

 

About me:

I feel that nothing is more fitting for a bio than what I sent for school:

Growing up, I hated school. I seriously loathed getting up in the morning, rising out of bed and leaving the house. My grades were poor as a result, not stemming from a lack of intelligence, but because I was totally bored. I excelled when truly challenged or genuinely interested in the subject matter. Otherwise, I simply didn’t care. It seems ironic now that I teach English and have finished my first novel. 
In my youth, my thoughts and repose resided in a pretend play world. I spent hours in the backyard fighting as a knight or a ninja. I would usually be found watching movies in my bedroom or playing with my G.I. Joes. Regardless of the activity, I was always reenacting movies or creating intricate story lines about how to save the world. This abhorrence of school continued until high school. My love for acting and theatre outweighed my aversion for school. I needed to maintain a solid G.P.A. to participate in extracurricular activities, so I conceded to becoming a better student. 
When my great uncle, a long time advocate for education, passed away I was devastated. I was very close with him and at his wake I learned more about all of his accolades. I felt the need for an altruistic life path like he led. I participated in children’s theatre and fell completely in love with performing literature in education. I eventually graduated with an English education degree, Suma Cum Laude. 
I thought that I could save the world one student at a time by trying to make the classroom an engaging place full of passion for literature, just like Mr. Keating from Dead Poets Society. I wanted to be what the documentary Waiting for Superman was asking for, the hero or the “answer”. To my utter chagrin, it seemed to be a more difficult endeavor in the classrooms of today. Technology, in my experience, has the danger to render children lazy, lethargic and apathetic. Education was like a battlefield and I had to refocus my efforts to achieve victories. I would not be defeated. 
Then, a dreadful incident occurred in 2010. I was on a field trip and a student drowned. I watched him die after over a half an hour of searching for him in the water. The paramedics failed to revive him. The event was a complete accident, but nonetheless devastating. I maintained relationships with the damaged and frail student population. It was very rough and a fight everyday. But Winston Churchill declared, "If you're going through hell, keep going,” and that became my life mantra. 
Toward the middle of the next school year, in 2011, my students worked on an imaginary stories unit. My student teacher developed the idea that we should work on a draft of our own writing with the students. I began thinking about what to write and the contemplation became obsession. The short story became a novel, much more elaborate and adult than originally intended. 
With sleep deprivation and Post Traumatic Stress, I drove myself to the brink of insanity developing the intricacies of my story. The catastrophic death and the maelstrom of experiences in my educational life culminated into a cathartic finished draft of a novel. This tragic experience sparked a liberation of feelings reinvigorating me to write as a way of dealing with hardships in life just like I did in adolescence. 
My only course of action is to pursue my love of literature and creative writing. I yearn to engage with fellow storytellers. My goal is to collaborate with other writers and take any constructive criticisms to grow as a novelist. I need to be in a creative writing graduate school. My existence in a growing erudite community is essential. 
I have always been a writer really. The stories just resided inside my brain. My goal is to take all of the ideas, which are fully developed in my head and create living breathing stories for people to sink their own teeth into. I have always lived in a world of fiction. Now, I want to be the creator of the fictional worlds that help people to escape from their own lives as I did mine.

Risks and challenges:

I have dedicated the last three years of my life to this story and the need to tell it. This story is truly a piece of my soul. I have spent countless hours of my repose crafting it and driving myself a bit crazy.

I applied to graduate school for the fall of 2012 and the fall of 2013. This is not only an arduous process, both mentally and emotionally taking, but also has proven to be very expensive.

Thus far, I have not wanted or needed financial support to pursue my love. I find that with the looming school year and the significant amount I spent to move etc, etc, I am not as comfortable financially as I would like to be to take this trip. I was hoping to have a partner in crime to save on funds and also so that I won't drive the 30 hours alone, but I may rock it solo.

This tragic experience sparked a liberation of feelings reinvigorating me to write as a way of dealing with hardships in life just like I did in adolescence. My only course of action is to pursue my love of literature and creative writing. I yearn to engage with fellow storytellers. My goal is to collaborate with other writers and take any constructive criticisms to grow as a novelist. I need to be in a creative writing graduate school. My existence in a growing erudite community is essential. I have always been a writer really. The stories just resided inside my brain. My goal is to take all of the ideas, which are fully developed in my head and create living breathing stories for people to sink their own teeth into. I have always lived in a world of fiction. Now, I want to be the creator of the fictional worlds that help people to escape from their own lives as I did mine.
Risks and challenges:
I have dedicated the last three years of my life to this story and the need to tell it. This story is truly a piece of my soul. I have spent countless hours of my repose crafting it and driving myself a bit crazy.
I applied to graduate school for the fall of 2012 and the fall of 2013. This is not only an arduous process, both mentally and emotionally taking, but also has proven to be very expensive.
Thus far, I have not wanted or needed financial support to pursue my love. I find that with the looming school year and the significant amount I spent to move etc, etc, I am not as comfortable financially as I would like to be to take this trip. I was hoping to have a partner in crime to save on funds and also so that I won't drive the 30 hours alone, but I may rock it solo.

story:
Help the SNP to win Dumfriesshire, Clydesdale & Tweeddale by donating to the DCT SNP Election Fighting Fund

This year the SNP can win Dumfriesshire, Clydesdale & Tweeddale , where we've had Joan McAlpine as a effective South of Scotland SNP MSP as well as Christine Grahame and Aileen Campbell as dedicated local MSPs- but where, David Mundell (Tory) has been an ineffective MP. We know that Emma Harper,for the SNP, will really represent the people who live here.  Now we need your help with the campaign to get Emma elected to work for us all.

What We Need & What You Get

We aim to raise enough to make our presence visible in all our communities and to get out the information so everyone can see the real benefit of voting SNP, so we can elect Emma Harper- a local MP who'll focus on our whole constituency, towns and villages, and farmlands, businesses and colleges. 

If we raise more money than our target, we’ll just be able to do a better job, building an SNP team to fight for you.

The Impact

Dumfriesshire, Clydesdale & Tweeddale is a huge area and it will make a real difference to have a campaign budget that allows us to reach every part of the constituency.  We need premises, publicity materials, leaflets and much, much more.  To run this winning campaign, we need to raise funds, which is where you come in…

Risks & Challenges

David Mundell's majority looks set to crumble - but we need to help it on its way. We need to make sure that the thousands of voters disappointed by Mundell's Westminster government, get the chance to see how Emma Harper and the SNP can work successfully for their futures.  We need your support to make that certain - by electing an MP for Dumfriesshire, Clydesdale & Tweeddale - Emma Harper, a real voice for our communities.  Please give us your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know everyone can’t be in a position to contribute, but we’d still appreciate your active support.  If you’re local, please come and help us campaign, and if you’re further afield, please share our page, and our social media campaign pages.

story:
Hello everyone. My name is Connor and I'm here today to try and receive some help towards my first full length novel. I have been working on this particular project for several years with the help of writing classes, critiques, and revisions. At this point I have decided to look outward for help in getting my novel self-published. 

  • Apocalypse Please is a story about a young man, Caden, and his horrific journey across America amid the apocalypse.  Caden's adventure begins as he says a temporary goodbye to the love of his life in order to meet up with potential publishers in New York. Fate appears to have something else in store. The plane is in mid flight when suddenly the sky turns to fire. A fiery crash in the middle of nowhere is only the beginning of what turns out to be a fight for survival against cataclysmic events, insanity, despair, the four horsemen, and much more. All Caden wants is to be with his love at the end of the world and with the help of a few companions, he may be with her the day the world goes away. 

For me, as a writer, it is incredibly daunting to put this entire story onto page, but it needs to be done. I have been working tirelessly on many projects throughout the last 14 years of my life, ranging from novels to short stories to screenplays, the latter being a few feature length movies that just didn't pan out. I have tried my hand at other things in life and yet I always return to writing. 

I have followed and read a lot of the top sellers on the market and as a reader, they just don't catch me like they used to. The genre I am working towards in general has also seen a decline with the only big seller being the incredible Stephen King. Like Mr. King, I am in it for the story telling. I would like to give readers something to escape into. Something to let their imaginations feed off of in the same way reading did for me when I was younger. 

  • This is where you come in. I have researched self-publishing over the last couple of years and I am trying to get the essential amount needed for bare bones publishing which includes getting an editor, an ISBN number, printing and distribution, book cover art, formatting, etc. The book writing itself is a long process, but I aim to have a steady schedule to get it released in a timely manner. After all, this is my one and only dream. 

In the end, any contribution, no matter how small or how big, is a huge thing for me. The thought of someone taking the time to back me is enough to get me to put out the best possible product I can. All funds go directly into this book and any extra funds I receive will be put towards my next project. 

  • In this day and age I am incredibly thankful for a medium such as this website that can help get a new voice out into a world which may have otherwise ignored it so I thank you from the deepest part of my being.

story:
Read The Cliff Notes

Our big hairy audacious goal or BHAG (to steal a line from business guru Jim Collins) is to travel to 7 South American countries in 7 months and to interview 100 entrepreneurs and write about them in our book and blog! Funding our goal will allows us to pay for the traveling costs associated with our entrepreneurial journey. In return, we’ll send you a copy of our book in either print or ebook form along with an indigenous hand crafted good selected while touring these amazing countries. No matter the contribution, we are grateful for your support and belief in our goal. Thank you for all that you do. We are your biggest fans!


Why?

Entrepreneurship has a magical ring to it – it speaks of innovation, progress, prosperity and risk. And for that reason, it is perhaps the greatest change agent our society knows. While entrepreneurship might be synonymous with the good old U.S. of A, it’s flourishing abroad – especially in South America and could seriously change the way we see what it means to be an entrepreneur.

For example, 2012 was named “The year of entrepreneurship in Chile, and 2013, “the year of innovation”. The Global Entrepreneurship monitor named Bolivia as having one of the highest entrepreneurship potential in the world in 2008 and Colombia was recently named by Fortune Magazine as being one of the top emerging countries to watch for. 

In the book Reverse Innovation; Dartmouth professor, Vijay Govindarajan explores the concept of innovating in the developing world and bringing it to developed countries. The result? Creative innovations that aren’t hemmed in by traditional “Developed world” thought, and super cost effective products and services.

What if we brought developing world entrepreneurship to the U.S.? Could it change the way we do business? Or the way we see what it means to be an entrepreneur? By gathering the stories of South American entrepreneurs, we deem to do just that: discover what it means to be an entrepreneur in the developing world and translate that to America. It’s reverse innovation… for entrepreneurs.

You can learn more about our adventure by visiting our website: www.entrepreneurialtrek.com.


Destinations

We plan on visiting the following countries... and some! Our departure is scheduled for July. As a note, our schedule is totally flexible so please don't hold us to our below dates and countries. There's a good chance we may take a couple detours or visit some other places in between. 

1. ARGENTINA


Because of the connections we've already formed and the amazing entrepreneurial community, we plan on starting in Buenos Aires. 

2. URUGUAY

Uruguay was ranked number 5 out of 29 in the South and Central America/Caribbean region for economic freedom. Within South America, Uruguay ranks second behind Chile.

3. CHILE 


There are a lot of reasons why Chile's entrepreneurship community is growing. According to the Perceived Corruption Index, Chile is number 1 in terms of transparency in Latin America. Chile was also named the most competitive economy in Latin America according to the World Economic Forum and was first in Latin America for economic freedom according to the Economic Freedom Index in 2010. 

4. BOLIVIA

Despite being one of the poorest Latin American countries, The Global Entrepreneurship Monitor showed Bolivia as having one of the highest entrepreneurship potential in the world in 2008. 

5. PERU


According to a 2015 Gem Study, there are more people in Peru intending to pursue entrepreneurship than in other Latin American country.

6. ECUADOR 

This entire adventure began with an internship in Quito, Ecuador. That experience sparked our goal to interview 100 South American entrepreneurs.

7. COLOMBIA

Colombia has an amazing entrepreneurial community and was recently named by Fortune Magazine as one of the top emerging countries to be on the watch for.

*Due to complications, we have replaced Brazil with Uruguay on our adventure.


Our Story

Kaitlyn Ersek – Writer and wanna-be-entrepreneur

Growing up, my parents encouraged my siblings and I to discover our freak flag – that thing that makes you stand out, the thing makes you freaky. For me, there are three key things that make up my freak flag. 

1.  The first thing is traveling. I had the opportunity to study and volunteer abroad during my high school and college career. In 2011, I volunteered for Quito-based Fundacion Pachama, a nonprofit organization founded by Lynne Twist aimed at protecting the rainforest and the rights of the indigenous populations located there.

2.  The second thing is stories. I’m a total bookworm and spend more time in a book than anywhere else. That passion for stories led me to intern for Entrepreneurs’ Organization in 2015 where I had the opportunity to interview Philadelphia EO Members about their experiences and businesses.

3.  The last and third thing is entrepreneurship. While I’m just a wanna-be entrepreneur, I grew up with an entrepreneur for a father and spent time watching him build businesses. Entrepreneurship is a huge part of what makes me tick. In 2012, I interned with Verne Harnish and helped in his Fortune Magazine’s Leadership and Growth Summits where I was surrounded by rock star speakers and entrepreneurs. I also worked with my Dad’s (Barrett Ersek) company Holganix, managing their inbound marketing including their website, social media, blogging and content creation.

I truly believe that these three things that make up my freak flag have culminated into our BHAG: to travel to 7 South American countries in 7 months and interview 100 entrepreneurs, learn their stories and write about them in our blog. For more information on me, check out my LinkedIn profile here.


Andrew Bagwell – Videographer, artist and innovator 

As a recent college graduate at Temple University, I had the opportunity to spend time working for several start up companies, soaking in everything they told me. Working with start-ups pushed me to wear many hats and get creative in order to best help build their companies. In 2011, I had the opportunity to work in the marketing department of start up snack manufacturer: Pretzel Pete. In 2012, I helped a start up Yoga Studio design their studio and launch their marketing strategy. Later that year, I had my first taste of big business in a sales function at Kellogg’s and in 2015, I joined forces with a friend to help build his start up fire alarm company.

People see me as a thrill seeker; whether it's skydiving or action sports like skateboarding, skimboarding or bodybuilding, I'm always looking for the next big adventure. In addition to my passion for excitement, I love art, being physically active and helping others. Because of my love for helping others, while in South America I plan on volunteering with start-ups and non profits.

Throughout the adventure, I’ll be video taping several of the interviews and designing the overall book layout and plan.

For more information on me, check out my LinkedIn profile here and my art website here.


Perks

Our reward levels are simple and straight-forward.

Each of our perks feature an indigenous hand crafted good, made by South American entrepreneurs coupled with either a print or ebook version of our story featuring interviews with 100 South American entrepreneurs.

Show your support with the purchase of: 

Perk 1: $5 Bracelet   
Perk 2: $25 Bracelet and E-Book 
Perk 3: $50 Bracelet and Printed Book
Perk 4: $100 Printed Book and Alpaca Hat
Perk 5: $200 Printed Book and Alpaca Gift Set (Includes alpaca hat and scarf)

Use of Funds

By contributing to our fund, you'll help us pay for the traveling costs we need to visit each region of South America. After all, without transportation, how would we get to each out our amazing entrepreneurial interviews? In return, we'll send you a gift ranging from alpaca blankets, indigenous handcrafted jewelry and more.


Stretch Goals


Risks and Challenges 

As with any endeavor, our goal comes with some risks and challenges. The biggest risks are if we have to cut our trip short or reroute our destination list to avoid any travel problems made note of by the U.S. Government.  


What else can you do to help?

Want to do more than fund our adventure? Or not interested in our perks? No worries, you can still help! If you know any South American entrepreneurs that would be willing to be interviewed for our blog and book, we'd love an introduction! 

 

Gratitude

We are so grateful for your support and belief in our goal. Thank you for all that you do. We are your biggest fans!

story:
Short Summary

This isn't a one time activity. This is a mission to really do something meaningful in an ongoing way to help the homeless and heighten awareness about this epidemic in the United States. Our Number One Priority is to get our care packages into the hands of those who need them--show that they are not forgotten, that they matter, and to give hope. We also want to share our love of books--reading, writing, and publishing, and assist those who otherwise wouldn’t have the means, or the ability, to tell their own life's story. 

Our vision is tri-fold:

#1 ANTHOLOGY  

Our first goal is to interview homeless people in the San Jacinto Valley/Inland Empire of Southern California and compile their stories into an anthology. The anthology will be offered for sale on the major online bookstores and in independents everywhere. The goal is to share the stories of the homeless with the communities in which they live to foster a sense of understanding and compassion. 100% of the proceeds from the sale of the book will go to support the shelters where we give Writing Workshops...

#2 WRITING WORKSHOPS

Our second goal is to offer free writing workshops at the shelters where the homeless find refuge. These workshops will provide the information, tools and techniques to help participants learn how to tell their own stories and to make a record of their own histories. Providing the connection to a publisher willing to publish their books free of charge, these workshops give participants the opportunity to write more books and share their own gifts and talents for writing. (Learn more about Alten Ink below)

#3 TRAVELING LIBRARY AND SUNDRY

Our third goal is to open a traveling library, to provide books, reading glasses, care packages that include toiletries and hygiene products, clothes, and sleeping bags for those living in subpar housing and life out on the streets. The library will offer books and other resources to the homeless to encourage and support their writing, offer an opportunity to check out books, even without a library card, and provide other living essentials as they may need them at no cost to them.


What We Need

To make this anthology and ongoing ministry to the homeless possible we are committed to raise $50,000 which will cover the expenses for:

The Anthology: Costs associated with publishing the anthology.

The Workshops: Writing supplies, portable computers, reference books.

The Library: A vehicle to use for the Traveling Library and Sundry, permits, licensing, insurance and all the items to be included in the library :

  • Books, books, books!
  • Reading glasses
  • Notepads, pens and pencils
  • Clothes, ponchos, towels
  • Sleeping bags and tarps
  • Backpacks
  • Nonperishable food and bottled water
  • Hygiene items, feminine items
  • Baby Wipes
  • Laundry detergent and quarters for the laundromat
  • Scarves (check out our one-dollar donation perk), hats
  • First Aid kits, lip balm and  sunscreen
  • A more extensive list can be found here: AltenInk.com 


ALTEN INK:

Mission Statement: Our desire is to help new writers become published writers. Whether it’s publishing for family and friends, or a slightly bigger audience, it’s AI’s goal to show each writer how to begin this journey, stay on course and finish well. We’ll coach them on how to begin the writing process: then from self-editing to finding an editor. Submitting their polished manuscripts to AI or other publishers is the next step. Our focus is to be there every step of the way.

Business Philosophy: We want to work with writers who can’t seem to find a fit for their manuscripts; book might be slightly controversial, different, or submissions may have been living on the slush pile because the author had no reputation/clout yet, or submitted their work to the wrong publisher. AI will publish all genres, especially speculative fiction, poetry collections, short/flash fiction stories and cookbooks because these are a hard sell to traditional publishers. We want to resurrect the Slush Pile.

For the purpose of The Anthology: Interviews with Invisible People, and in accordance with the overall mission of Alten Ink all participants in the workshops will have the opportunity to have their books edited and published at absolutely no charge to them.  Offer is contingent on overall funding and the ability of Alten Ink to raise funds for unavoidable publication costs.
story_txt:
Short Summary This isn't a one time activity. This is a mission to really do something meaningful in an ongoing way to help the homeless and heighten awareness about this epidemic in the United States. Our Number One Priority is to get our care packages into the hands of those who need them--show that they are not forgotten, that they matter, and to give hope. We also want to share our love of books--reading, writing, and publishing, and assist those who otherwise wouldn’t have the means, or the ability, to tell their own life's story. 
Our vision is tri-fold:
#1 ANTHOLOGY  
Our first goal is to interview homeless people in the San Jacinto Valley/Inland Empire of Southern California and compile their stories into an anthology. The anthology will be offered for sale on the major online bookstores and in independents everywhere. The goal is to share the stories of the homeless with the communities in which they live to foster a sense of understanding and compassion. 100% of the proceeds from the sale of the book will go to support the shelters where we give Writing Workshops...
#2 WRITING WORKSHOPS

Our second goal is to offer free writing workshops at the shelters where the homeless find refuge. These workshops will provide the information, tools and techniques to help participants learn how to tell their own stories and to make a record of their own histories. Providing the connection to a publisher willing to publish their books free of charge, these workshops give participants the opportunity to write more books and share their own gifts and talents for writing. (Learn more about Alten Ink below)
#3 TRAVELING LIBRARY AND SUNDRY
Our third goal is to open a traveling library, to provide books, reading glasses, care packages that include toiletries and hygiene products, clothes, and sleeping bags for those living in subpar housing and life out on the streets. The library will offer books and other resources to the homeless to encourage and support their writing, offer an opportunity to check out books, even without a library card, and provide other living essentials as they may need them at no cost to them.

What We NeedTo make this anthology and ongoing ministry to the homeless possible we are committed to raise $50,000 which will cover the expenses for:
The Anthology: Costs associated with publishing the anthology.
The Workshops: Writing supplies, portable computers, reference books.
The Library: A vehicle to use for the Traveling Library and Sundry, permits, licensing, insurance and all the items to be included in the library :

Books, books, books!
Reading glasses
Notepads, pens and pencils
Clothes, ponchos, towels
Sleeping bags and tarps
Backpacks

Nonperishable food and bottled
water
Hygiene items, feminine items
Baby Wipes
Laundry detergent and quarters for the laundromat
Scarves (check out our one-dollar donation perk), hats
First Aid kits, lip balm and  sunscreen
A more extensive list can be found here: AltenInk.com 


ALTEN INK:

Mission Statement: Our desire is to help new writers become published writers. Whether it’s publishing for family and friends, or a slightly bigger audience, it’s AI’s goal to show each writer how to begin this journey, stay on course and finish well. We’ll coach them on how to begin the writing process: then from self-editing to finding an editor. Submitting their polished manuscripts to AI or other publishers is the next step. Our focus is to be there every step of the way.
Business Philosophy: We want to work with writers who can’t seem to find a fit for their manuscripts; book might be slightly controversial, different, or submissions may have been living on the slush pile because the author had no reputation/clout yet, or submitted their work to the wrong publisher. AI will publish all genres, especially speculative fiction, poetry collections, short/flash fiction stories and cookbooks because these are a hard sell to traditional publishers. We want to resurrect the Slush Pile.
For the purpose of The Anthology: Interviews with Invisible People, and in accordance with the overall mission of Alten Ink all participants in the workshops will have the opportunity to have their books edited and published at absolutely no charge to them.  Offer is contingent on overall funding and the ability of Alten Ink to raise funds for unavoidable publication costs.

story:
The Book I Want to Write

Second only to my novelistic response to Ayn Rand's Atlas Shrugged, (which will take at least three years and a much more secure position to produce) Bones of Contention is the book that I've wanted to write for the longest long time. 

The theme of the novel is life in the twenty-first century and the human cost of corporate and personal greed, pervasive snake oil philosophies, social hypocrisy, talentless celebrity, and false but precious myths—such as the "work hard, be rewarded" American Dream and the ever-popular rags-to-riches stories that, when uncovered, most often reveal that there were never any rags at all.

It's a novel about those who struggle to find a place and those whose places have been assured. 

Where the Funds Will Go

  • $6000 for a year's worth of rent and utilities;
  • $1000 to augment living expenses;
  • $1000 for Indiegogo fees, shipping and perk expenses;
  • Any additional funds will be used for promoting existing books and future expenses for the editing, design, and promotion of Bones of Contention.

Other Ways You Can Help 

  • Read Elephant Girl: A Human Story or Bright Lines. If you like them, please pass the word on to your friends. Every penny I make from Amazon allows me to continue writing.
  • SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN! The more people who share it, the better my chances are. If you can't personally donate, maybe you know some people who can. I would appreciate it very much. 
  • After two books and thousands of miles around the country, my MacBook is dying. I have a PC backup, but prefer Mac. If you have one you're willing to part with or sell cheap, please contact me.

A little about us

Hi! I'm Crystal Huskey, the editor of Clinton Life and Secret City Living magazines. My husband Paul and I own Huskey Media, a media company based in Anderson County that aims to produce high-end, community-focused content every month. We deliver to 5,500 homes in each town we cover. 

We moved to Clinton a year and a half ago and immediately fell in love with the town. The first few weeks, our kids referred to Clinton as Pegasus Land -- we're not completely sure why, but it only has positive connotations! 

I have a background in community journalism. It's what I'm most passionate about, and something I believe very strongly in. We live in a time where loneliness is an epidemic -- we're all busier than ever and people move around the world for jobs and school. I can relate to this: I've moved a lot over the course of my life. Now that we plan to permanently call Clinton home, I want to be involved in sharing the stories that make our town great and that will hopefully inspire you. 

I've always learned the most through the written word, and it's the only way I know to make a difference in the world.

What We Do 

I've had the honor of covering some incredible, inspiring and interesting stories in our magazines, including:  

  • Patsy Harper, pre-K teacher at Andersonville Elementary
  • A spotlight on the nationally acclaimed McKameys, Clinton's most well-known musical ensemble
  • A guide to eating local food on a budget
  • An interview with Gale Hinton, the woman who painted most of the murals in Clinton's schools
  • A photo gallery on the Tennesseans for Living History
  • A feature on a teen who traveled to the barrel racing world championships
  • and multiple stories on nonprofits that are making a positive difference in our towns
We highlight the stories that make our town great, interesting and unique. We also take a deeper look at issues that are important to you, but that are often overlooked by big media. 

The Impact

We are ready to take this magazine to the next level. We want to expand our base of writers, designers and photographers, and to build a dynamic, interesting website. We want to include film to show you some behind the scenes shots of the stories we cover, as well as a weekly show where we can interview business owners and local celebrities. 

To do this, we need magazine sponsors to help us reach our goal. Your sponsorship will: 

  • Enable us to expand our number of freelance writers, photographers and designers
  • Get our website launched
  • Get our weekly online show started
  • Grow the sense of community in our town

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't sponsor a publication, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about us!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
above: the first 'zine we ever printed, n'aw, baby R&C.

Risk & Consequence: Who we are and what we do.

Hello potential funders!
I'm Kaylea and I'm looking to relaunch 'Risk & Consequence', an independent, free, nationally distributed 'zine filled with words, illustration and love thanks to the collaboration of some very passionate people.

We've already printed four issues over the last two years, which you can see here, all paid for out of our own pockets. We're due to re-launch with the goal of printing quarterly, on the 2nd October, and for now, we're paying for the printing ourselves, and have done for the last four issues, which is why we've been so sporadic with release schedules!


All we need is to get this copy back out into circulation so that we can seek funding through advertisement, and then print quarterly as we've always dreamed.


Printing a 'zine for people who love.

Regardless of whether or not we reach our funding goal on here, we'll be printing the first issue on the 2nd October, so we'll be out of pocket for a while but at least the 'zine will be out there, being picked up and read by the people who are really interested in what we do and want to support us.

We've had an amazing response to each of the last four issues printed, with most of the focus and praise being on the shape of the thing! (It's chequebook sized, so easy to carry I guess, ha)!

ANY funding from you guys will be appreciated, as it'll make it a little more bearable to live on beans on toast for the foreseeable future, just so that I and the 'zine's contributors can see it in print.


Sadly, printing costs money, sigh.

All of the money received from this campaign will help us with the printing costs, which for the amount we want to print will cost £390 (I think I've worked out the USD equivalent correctly....).


Hopefully the interest generated from this issue will allow us to seek some advertising, which will make future issues a less daunting prospect funding-wise.


We've also managed to claim a launch party at the Old Blue Last in London, where we'll be putting on Heart-ships, Us Baby Bear Bones and Hot Feet for free entry, to try and raise awareness of the 'zine and where our interests lie; in the heart of the reader and our shared love of music, fun and creativity.


If you can't donate, INNOVATE (cringe).

If you can't spare any money then why not shout about us and help us with a bit of promotion? Shout about the 'zine to all that you know and, for a small fee, once we've printed we can send you a copy via the postal service, because we want everyone to see exactly how much fun we have doing this.

Otherwise, email riskandconsequence(at)gmail(dot)com and WRITE FOR US.

:D

story:
Young poets who represent Austin Texas in the National Youth Poetry Slam need your help to achieve their dreams.  They Speak U21 Slam, part of the Texas Youth Word Collective, is a nonprofit that engages local youth in spoken word and fosters their development of self reflection, critical thinking, community engagement and literacy as young writers and artists. The late Dr. Shelia Siobhan and her daughter, the late Shannon Leigh created the Texas Youth Word Collective in 2004 and it has been working to provide a community for young writers ever since.  

A small community of volunteers have worked over the last year to help maintain They Speak, TXYWC and keep the work of Sheila and Shannon alive.  Throughout the year, They Speak holds monthly writing workshops and monthly slams to provide opportunities for growth in development for youth through their writing.  Additionally, we have held workshops within local high schools as well.  Ultimately, at the end of the slam year, a final slam of the year's competitors selects a team to represent ATX at Brave New Voices National Youth Poetry Festival and Slam, which takes place in a different US city each July. This year the festival will be in San Francisco.  Even prior to founding TXYWC, Sheila had taken an Austin youth team to Nationals every year since 2003. 

This organization and the work up to it's creation has touched and changed the lives of numerous youth over the last 10 years.  We desperately need your help to provide this opportunity.  For many, without this fundraising, attending BNV would not be possible.  The video above is a poem performed by three of last years team members on the final stage, a celebration and recognition of the work Sheila and Shannon created, work we deeply continue to believe in.  Please consider giving to our organization to help out.  The funds are used to pay for BNV attendance fees. 

In order to attend, the team needs to raise over $6000 by June to cover the costs of travel, accommodations and registration for the event.  We have already raised $2000 from various shows and fundraising to help us pay for registration fees for the team... However, we've still got a long way to go and your support would mean a lot to us and to these incredibly talented kids!

Thank you for your time and donation.

Texas Youth Word Collective is a 501(c)3 organization and all donations are fully tax-deductible.

story:
Peter Iengo was born and raised in Brooklyn, New York. He earned his Bachelor degree of Fine Arts in the study of creative writing, and production of films from Five Towns College. Peter has written many award winning films, and shares his experiences and knowledge with young artists, teaching college courses where he expresses the value, and art of great story telling.

I have longed to bring this story to the canvas of the literary world. I published the novel “The Last Prophet” with Trafford Publishing, and I am hoping to raise 3,000 thousand dollars to help with the Marketing and Publicity campaign.  With this 3,000 thousand dollars, I will be able to obtain book reviews from top reviewers, hold a book signing at a major book convention, and release press kits to radio, TV, and major Newspapers. All of these things are essential to help build awareness for the book. “The Last Prophet” book series is about reminding people where true heroes came from. All of the great writers, who have ever penned words to paper, have taken the basic inspiration and ideal of heroes from religious tales. David and Goliath, Moses, Christ, and Joan Arc are only a few examples. It is these stories that taught use the value of a true hero, a person we could look to with abilities, and morals greater then our own. A figure who could by example inspire us, to have faith, yearn to be better, and create a better tomorrow. Its from these stories we have been able to creature such inspirational heroes, it is with the same inspiration that I have chosen to create my own hero. A hero who draws his abilities and morals from the very same stem as these other figures. Not from radioactivity, technology, or outer space, but instead from the root of all morals, and great power. This tale is about the human race facing its annihilation from the evilest of all beings, and the rise of a true hero, a young man who must find faith within himself to become the savor mankind desperately needs. I would like to take a moment to briefly discuss the origin of this story. The storyline of The Last Prophet series has been one I have been creating since I was in high school.  I have always wanted to share my love for comic books, and the super heroes they represent. My passion and admiration for those stories inspired me to create my own hero. It wasn’t until I went to college that I found a way to really constructing this storyline. The Last Prophet became the focus of my screenwriting course, and inevitable final project. During college The Last Prophet universe was the storyline for many of my independent films. In 2011 I decided that the canvas of a book was where this story truly belonged. With no real limits, only the limits of one’s imagination, I knew this was the right way to reinvent, and expend the storyline. It was an elegant blend of my love for both comic books, and religion that gave birth to this novel.    

Please find it in your hearts to help this journey, and dream.  Any amount helps, and counts. Remember to spread the word for this year’s most new and exciting fictional novel!

story:
Who I am and what this is about

Hi! My name is Ed Akehurst. I am writing a book that I hope will help many people for the reasons below.

I have been on a very diverse, interesting spiritual journey for most of my life and by sharing my stories, I am hopeful that others will benefit from it.

I was raised in the Christian church (Methodist) and was very active in it as a youth. I was a youth leader and even spent time working with the Billy Graham Crusades as a teen counselor. I was in the process of enrolling in seminary when I started having some serious spritual doubts. I had many questions and I either couldn't get answers to them or I was uncomfortable with the answers I recieved.

That led me to 20 years of self discovery. Some of it "good", some of it "bad", all of it helpful and important, and as it turns out, much needed.

I spent those 20 years "trying out" different faiths and philosophies, some of which included Wicca, Taoism, Buddhism, Native American spirituality, Humanism, and even Atheism. Some fit better than others, but none were a really good fit for me at that time in my life.

Then, in my late 30s, I was introduced to Advaita Vedanta, which is a school within traditional Hinduism. After a few years of self study and many personal discoveries, I eventually found my Guru and my spiritual home. I had arrived in a mental and spiritual place much different from where I started.

By sharing my stories and revelations along the way, others can be helped and made more secure in their own spiritual path, whatever that may be. More importantly, by understanding others and the journey they have been on, we can begin to have meaningful dialogue with them.

Why is this important and who will it help?

The purpose of getting this book written and released is not just to share my story, but to promote open, honest, caring interfaith dialogue. 

It is not my intention to disparage or denigrate any other faith, nor to convert anyone to my way of thinking. Just because some of the the faiths I investigated were not a good fit for me does not mean they aren't a good fit for others. 

Besides crafting an entertaining and enlightening tale, I hope to create greater understanding between people of differing faiths, especially between people of the Abrahamic and Dharmic faiths. 

In this modern era, there is a lot of religious tension and even outright hatred. I am convinced that most of it can be reduced or even eliminated if we simply took the time to understood the people of other faiths and where they come from, emotionally, intellectually and spiritually. That understanding can bring us all closer together.

When we put our efforts into understanding others, rather than trying to change them or convince them we are right, then, and only then, can we truly know, love and honor them.

By shining a light on my personal journey, I am optimistic that people from all faiths will benefit.

If my personal journey can help others to be more loving and understanding towards each other, then this will have been a most worthwhile endeavor.

The Project

Please help me towards this goal. Initial monies raised from this project will allow me to spend more of my time getting the book written. If you can help me reach my goal or beyond, there will be sufficient funds to cover editing, formatting, cover art work, printing and promotion.

I am going to take initial funds and free up some of my time to do nothing but write. I write for a living, but it is mostly marketing pieces and in order to dedicate more time to the book, I need to be able to support my family.

The remaining funds are going to be used to:

  1. Have the book properly edited and formatted;
  2. Have cover artwork created;
  3. Pay for the initial print run;
  4. Do marketing and promotion to get the book widely dispersed. This will include press releases, advertisements, articles and interviews, social media campaigns. The amount of this I am able to do will depend entirely on how much funding comes in.

This book will be written and rewards will be granted whether the goal is reached. If I meet or exceed the goal, I expect to be in print in 60 - 90 days. If I do not reach the goal, it wil still get to print, but it may take longer, depending on how close to the goal you can help me get.

Check out the rewards to the right. I am giving away some great rewards for your help. I hope you enjoy them!

The Impact

As mentioned above, this book is intended to help many people.

There is value in knowing and understanding others. By seeing their journey and better understanding what it is they believe and why they believe it, we can better accept them for who they are.

As I grew up, I was taught things about other religions that were simply not true. They were based on fear and ignorance. if we can shine a light on some of that, we can end it. We can put ourselves in a place where we truly understand the other person and can accept them for who they are.

That is the place from which true, loving interfaith dialogue can begin.

That's the place where hatred, fear and intolerance disappear and are replaced with love, kindness and understanding.

I sincerely hope you are able to help. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I hope you can contribute, but whether you do, please help us get the word out. Connect to this on your social media sites and pass the word around.

Thank you,

Ed Akehurst

I spent those 20 years "trying out" different faiths and philosophies, some of which included Wicca, Taoism, Buddhism, Native American spirituality, Humanism, and even Atheism. Some fit better than others, but none were a really good fit for me at that time in my life.
Then, in my late 30s, I was introduced to Advaita Vedanta, which is a school within traditional Hinduism. After a few years of self study and many personal discoveries, I eventually found my Guru and my spiritual home. I had arrived in a mental and spiritual place much different from where I started.
By sharing my stories and revelations along the way, others can be helped and made more secure in their own spiritual path, whatever that may be. More importantly, by understanding others and the journey they have been on, we can begin to have meaningful dialogue with them.
Why is this important and who will it help?
The purpose of getting this book written and released is not just to share my story, but to promote open, honest, caring interfaith dialogue. 
It is not my intention to disparage or denigrate any other faith, nor to convert anyone to my way of thinking. Just because some of the the faiths I investigated were not a good fit for me does not mean they aren't a good fit for others. 
Besides crafting an entertaining and enlightening tale, I hope to create greater understanding between people of differing faiths, especially between people of the Abrahamic and Dharmic faiths. 
In this modern era, there is a lot of religious tension and even outright hatred. I am convinced that most of it can be reduced or even eliminated if we simply took the time to understood the people of other faiths and where they come from, emotionally, intellectually and spiritually. That understanding can bring us all closer together.
When we put our efforts into understanding others, rather than trying to change them or convince them we are right, then, and only then, can we truly know, love and honor them.
By shining a light on my personal journey, I am optimistic that people from all faiths will benefit.
If my personal journey can help others to be more loving and understanding towards each other, then this will have been a most worthwhile endeavor.
The Project
Please help me towards this goal. Initial monies raised from this project will allow me to spend more of my time getting the book written. If you can help me reach my goal or beyond, there will be sufficient funds to cover editing, formatting, cover art work, printing and promotion.
I am going to take initial funds and free up some of my time to do nothing but write. I write for a living, but it is mostly marketing pieces and in order to dedicate more time to the book, I need to be able to support my family.
The remaining funds are going to be used to:

Have the book properly edited and formatted;
Have cover artwork created;
Pay for the initial print run;
Do marketing and promotion to get the book widely dispersed. This will include press releases, advertisements, articles and interviews, social media campaigns. The amount of this I am able to do will depend entirely on how much funding comes in.



This book will be written and rewards will be granted whether the goal is reached. If I meet or exceed the goal, I expect to be in print in 60 - 90 days. If I do not reach the goal, it wil still get to print, but it may take longer, depending on how close to the goal you can help me get.
Check out the rewards to the right. I am giving away some great rewards for your help. I hope you enjoy them!
The Impact
As mentioned above, this book is intended to help many people.
There is value in knowing and understanding others. By seeing their journey and better understanding what it is they believe and why they believe it, we can better accept them for who they are.
As I grew up, I was taught things about other religions that were simply not true. They were based on fear and ignorance. if we can shine a light on some of that, we can end it. We can put ourselves in a place where we truly understand the other person and can accept them for who they are.
That is the place from which true, loving interfaith dialogue can begin.
That's the place where hatred, fear and intolerance disappear and are replaced with love, kindness and understanding.
I sincerely hope you are able to help. 
Other Ways You Can Help


I hope you can contribute, but whether you do, please help us get the word out. Connect to this on your social media sites and pass the word around.
Thank you,Ed Akehurst

story:
We are Vici MacDonald and Tamar Yoseloff, the founders of Hercules Editions, a new independent press specialising in publications and projects that combine innovative poetry and textual work with contemporary and cutting-edge visual material.

Hercules' first publication, Formerly, combined Vici's photographs of forgotten corners of London with Tamar's cycle of 14 sonnets written in response to the photos. The book is now in its second printing, and was shortlisted for the 2012 Ted Hughes Award for New Work in Poetry: http://formerlysonnets.wordpress.com

Heart Archives is our latest project. The author is Sue Rose, a poet and translator whose first collection, From the Dark Room, was published in 2011. The Heart Archives poem cycle was originally inspired by the work of the French artist Christian Boltanski, and references his long-term project Archives du Coeur, in which he records heartbeats and stores them on a Japanese island. Sue Rose’s poems extend Boltanski's work to explore the notion of 'personal archaeology', considering the way we create individual archives of photographs, objects and letters, and how our ideas of archive and memory have altered in the age of the iPhone.

We are seeking the funding to produce the book and create some special events to coincide with publication. We want to engage our readers not only with Sue Rose's work, but in thinking about their own ways of assembling archives. We will be holding three writing workshops themed around the notion of personal history, archives and photography; and a panel discussion featuring Sue Rose and the poets Hannah Lowe and Anna Robinson. We hope to hold these events in some very special places in London, to be confirmed as our campaign gets going.

For these ambitious plans to be realised, we need your help. We have some brilliant offers for our sponsors, including advance copies of the book (and a chance to have your name in the publication), a special limited-edition print, a discounted place on one of our writing workshops, and a personalised psychogeographical walk around London.

We are counting on the support of sponsors who love poetry and photography, who are interested in memoir and local history, and who are passionate about the work of independent publishers, such as ourselves. This is an exciting time for us, and we hope you will share in our project.

story:
Dear Family and Friends,

 

As a child I was taught, “Give someone a fish and they’ll eat for a day, but teach someone to fish, and they’ll eat for a lifetime.” I was raised to be a strong and determined Christian man, ready to take on all challenges and challengers. I was inspired the day I heard President Ronald Reagan’s first Inaugural Address as a kid at daycare, and that I wanted to be just like him.

 

The time has come. It has been no secret to many of you that I have wanted to serve our community in Jefferson City. While my life has taken many interesting and exciting turns, I have never let the calling of public service disappear. As you may remember, in October of 2008 I won “America’s Got Talent.” That experience put me on the map in the music world, but I made sure it helped put our area and our great state on the map worldwide.  I told America where I came from because I am proud of Southeast Missouri. Remember, you can never forget where you came from and be truly successful.

 

I take pride in our area and all the small towns we cherish. I believe that the future success of the 149th District is LIMITLESS! Rome wasn’t built in a day, and with my leadership, and the lessons I’ve learned growing up here, we will continue to build upon the strengths of our region and make it even more prosperous!

 

Together, we can tell Jefferson City who we are.  Please take the time to make a contribution today!

 

Government is simply too large and infringes on too many of our Liberties. We must end this practice now or it could bury us, and our children, in generations of further debt and potential despair. We need to eliminate burdensome regulations, free up capital for job growth, and invigorate our local economy.  Add to those proposals, alternatives to Medicaid expansion to improve Healthcare, or even addressing how Common Core must be stopped in order for us to maintain local educational control.

 

We have been placed in an incredibly unique situation. We have been called to return our nation, and our area, to its former economic glory! Our military prowess is unprecedented, but our ability to stop inflation and reckless spending by some of our current leaders is our generation’s next great challenge.  

 

I believe it takes a clear vision, and a love for your home, in order to lead effectively. There are some in our state legislature who hold seats and accomplish very little simply because they are beholden to maintain the status quo. Please ask these questions before you vote again:

“Do I believe my new state representative will work diligently and fight to garner the attention needed for our area to be revived and thrive?  Can I trust my new representative to relate to my lifestyle and my struggle in making a living for my family?  Has he experienced life from a low-income perspective? Has he been educated in the school of hard knocks, self-determination, and hard work overcoming tremendous odds to achieve a high level of success?  Or have they only known the life of privilege afforded them by family wealth. Will my new representative remember me after the election when he or she is surrounded by the power, perks, pomp and circumstance of the wealthy power players who swoop into Jeff City who seek to turn the heads of our representatives from the direction of the people back home and join in the “Good ‘Ole Boy network” in Jeff City?”

I believe we need to redefine how we see ourselves in Southeast Missouri, especially in the 149th District - the poorest district in the entire state! We need a true VOICE to speak to the needs of our citizens. The 149th is the heart of Missouri’s rural economy, and the backbone of this state. There is absolutely no question. WE PRODUCE FOR ALL MISSOURIANS and the NATION! And we have our Farmer’s to thank for that!

 

I want to be your VOICE in Jefferson City, but I need your help. Your gift of $500, $250 or $100 will help me with the literature, yard signs and media to get out my message. Please make your contribution today.

 

I am a small-business owner, and I struggle with the regulations government puts on me, as well. And I am small in comparison to many of my friends throughout the business community. In my 2012 campaign, I was endorsed by the Missouri Chamber of Commerce.  We deserve a defender of our economic rights in Jefferson City. How can I grow as a businessman if the system is working against me? How can I heal if the healthcare system deems me unfit?

 

I want to live in a state where my dreams are not regulated, and my ideas for future growth are not crushed upon inception because I can’t afford to expand and hire those in need of employment, or provide those employees quality healthcare.

 

Taxes must be lowered to spur economic growth, and to get businesses hiring and people spending again. Right now, we are in a holding pattern in the 149th because we cannot see prosperity beyond the “Great Recession.” We are afraid to take risks for fear that we will be punished for doing so. Government scares off new businesses by the way they choose to limit economic expansion through burdensome legislative regulations and restrictions.  Without new businesses where are all of these new jobs going to come from. 

Government must be more transparent or else we the people simply won’t trust it! President Reagan felt that the nine most terrifying words in the English language were, “I’m from the government and I’m here to help.” Well, the same sentiment rings true today. We know the right things to do based on our upbringing and values, and we don’t need government telling us not to trust our inherent instincts, such as how to raise our families, how to worship, or whether or not we can own a firearm.

 

I am pro-life because I feel, in my Christian heart, that life begins at conception. In my 2012 campaign, I was endorsed by Missouri Right To Life. God placed us all here for a reason and with a distinct purpose, and I will fight for the rights of the unborn.

 

I come from two generations of military veterans from WWII, Korea, and Vietnam. We owe our veterans everything for the sacrifices they have made for our freedom. I will fight for Veterans Rights in Jefferson City.

 

Today, I write you to ask for your HELP and support in my bid for State Representative for the 149th District.

 

I care deeply about our traditional conservative Missouri Values and our local workforce. While serving on two gubernatorial appointed Workforce Investment Boards in Jefferson City, I was a part of improving the skills and livelihoods of our families and friends. But times are changing, and our skills also have to become more refined for the new economic climate.

 

As a Missouri lawmaker, I will be fiscally accountable, and fight for those who cannot defend themselves from an overspending and ever-expanding government. I will be the VOICE for working Missourians and a defender of our families. It is with that desire to see our values take root throughout state government that has led me to run for the legislature.

 

Now to the heart of the matter. IT WILL TAKE MONEY TO WIN! My primary opponent is wealthy enough to self-fund his entire campaign. So please give what you can to ours!

 

The contributions to Friends of Neal E. Boyd will be invested in numerous billboards, mailings, yard signs, and media to get the word out and win!

 

Your gift of a campaign contribution made today is vital, and will allow me to continue an effective campaign that will be necessary for a victory. There are no longer any limits on the amount that can be contributed. Every gift of $500, $250, $100, $25, $1 will go a long way in winning the November 4th election!

 

To donate, please go to “nealeboydformissouri.com” or send a contribution to: Friends of Neal E. Boyd, PO BOX 687, Sikeston, MO 63801

 

I thank you again for a lifetime of support! We have had a lot of successes over the years. Please give me the opportunity to give back to our area and make you proud once again! Together we will win this race! God Bless You, All!

 

Sincerely,

Neal E. Boyd

 

Paid for by Friends of Neal E. Boyd, John McMillen, Treasurer

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, please simply spread the word and make some noice about my upcoming campaign! 

  • Go to nealeboydformissouri.com
  • LIKE "Neal E. Boyd for Missouri" on Facebook

story:
Short Summary

The Thought of Creation

This book was written after many years of research and comparison between the Torah, Kabbalah, and science books. I started on this subject following a personal crisis. I had the opportunity of seeing people and phenomena beyond those experienced in the daily life. “Go out of Egypt,” I was told. The meaning of it was to step out of the material routine, and start dealing with spirituality.

  I tried to examine all new information and study on the topic of the creation of the world, and the connection between the Torah and science. I searched for proofs to this connection in the most thorough way possible. Was the world created by accident, or with an initial thought? What was the world created for? Is the Big Bang the beginning of creation, or was the world created much earlier? What is the universe made of? What maintains it? What will happen to the universe in the future? When was man created? Was man created from the monkey? Is there any kind of connection between all of humanity? How can you even research creation? Can you possibly prove the existence of God? How can you even reach Him? Who can provide answers to that?

The answers to these questions are “hidden” in the Torah. The Torah is a secret language. The Hebrew word for “world”, Olam, hints on the words: Hidden – Ha’alem, Ne’lam. Scientists study the world every day, and the results of their studies are surprisingly similar to the prophecies of the Torah. Jewish thinkers, world intellectuals, and tzadikim, are able to find a connection with the hidden worlds. They told us that there is a Creator to the world – God. The world was created with initial thought: The thought of creation. Man has a special and unique role in the world; to connect with the Creator by thinking of, and helping his fellow men, “Love your neighbor as yourself”. The nation of Israel is a “bridge” that connects the material world with the Creator. Will we successfully climb the right bridge? Will man connect the world and humanity? Will the nation of Israel successfully carry out its task? “Love your neighbor as yourself”... this is how the soul is built. Let’s connect to it… Good luck.

What We Need & What You Get

Right now, I have hard copies of the book in hebrew and a website in english and hebrew, you can see the website here:

http://www.thekingof.us/

 

I need an Amount of 4000$ for:

1. finish to translate the book to English.

2. make an eBook and improve the web site (Add the option to buy the book online, as hard copy or eBook)

  • If I will not reach the goal I will improve the website right now but i will still translate the book and make an E book.

FAQ:

Do you ship international?

Yes! Please add $10 to cover all shipments outside israel (if you choose the hebrew hardcover).

Do you plan to make hardcover for the English version?

not now. I want to spread the book to the world, so I try to keep the production expenses as low as I could.

What will be the e-book format?

the E-book will be released in ePub and Mobi format. The ebook will be RM-free

In what language the e-book will be?

The eBook will be in english. if we will reach the goal, we will make also an hebrew eBook.

 

Dear Friends

I wrote this book in order to bring good to the world and not for making money.
I need your help to finish the translation of the book to English, make an eBook and spread it to readers all over the world.


 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, please:

• Share this campaign with your friends and family

• Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc.

story:
Vi feirer Norske Verdier

Norge er et fantastisk land!
Men...

Det er ikke mye politisk satire for tiden...
Det ønsker vi å gjøre noe med.

Se forøvrig flere filmer på:
http://godtnorsk.net

Og rommet for offentlig debatt har blitt ganske snevrert. Den norske modellen der "det å møtes på midten og å kompromisse seg frem til enighet", og den politiske tendensen med å sette politisk betente saksfelt over i upolitiske forvaltningsorganer, slik at politikerne kan skyve selskaps-strukturer, eller forvaltningslovgivning foran seg i stedet for å diskutere bakenforliggende prinsipielle problemer "fordi vi har det så godt i Norge", eller andre følelsesladde argumenter, har gjort det nærmest umoralsk å diskutere prinsipielle problemstillinger i norsk politikk.
Vi diskuterer hvor mange som skal bo på rommet på sykehjem.
Ikke OM vi skal ha sykehjem.... :)

#godtnorsk er et forsøk på å sette fokus på enkelte slike paradokser med en humoristisk/satirisk vri.

Om man ser bort fra "Nytt på nytt", har den politiske satiren nærmest forsvunnet fra den norske virkeligheten og mediebildet. Vi ønsker å livne litt opp i en halvdød kunstform. Systemkritikk, med kjærlighet til systemet.

Virkemidlene i de forskjellige filmene vil være forskjellig. Fra rent propagandistiske spissformuleringer, til absurditeter, til svart humor.


Vi trenger penger, du får moro, litt ubehag
(og forhåpentligvis på sikt en litt bedre samfunnsdebatt)

Realkostnaden for å produsere en #godtnorsk film er i størelsesorden 35.000 NOK, slik vi har laget dem så langt.
Og det reelle målet med kampanjen er å komme så nær dette som mulig.
Vi sitter ikke egentlig på resurser til å kunne dokuementere Norges rolle ute i verden og paradokser som Rom-/bæsj-/tigge-debatten vs Schengen/EU og norsk skole- og sosiallovgivning og menneskerettighets lovgivning.

Eller paradokset mellom at Norge som ikke kan eksportere våpen/ammo til krigende land, likevel evner å selge våpen gjennom statseide Nammo/Kongsberg til krigende land. Og være stolte av å ha omgåt sin egen lovgivning. 

Paradokser rundt NAV.

Paradokser rundt store norske selskapers oppførsel internasjonalt, hvordan de følges av NORAD og  andre statlige institusjoner for å sikre norske eierinteresser i utlandet, under dekke av "utviklingshjelp og en ikke korrupt utviklingsmodell". 
Er det ikke korrupt om det er norske eierinteresser som sitter igjen med pengene? :)

Paradokser rundt norsk debatt. For eksempel rundt den hyggelige lille ikke-krigen i Afghanistan, der vi sendte norske soldater og snikskyttere til den andre siden av verden for å kjempe for norske verdier og skoler for jenter.
Hvordan debatten om norges rolle i Afghanistan, ble gjort "landssvikersk" i det den første nordmannen døde i en krigslignende handling på det humanitære oppdraget de var ute på.

Vi mener egentlig ikke noe om det var "rett" eller "galt" å delta. Men det er interessant hvordan prinsipp-debattene ble kvalt. Og vi tror det er viktig å fortsette de prinsipielle diskusjonene. Ikke finne "endelig fasit" og "ferdig snakka" på komplekse problemer.

Myter om "norskhet".

Språk... Hvordan kom vi til å bruke de samme termene som man gjorde i Sør-Afrika under Apartheid, som f.eks.:
2. generasjons nordmann av pakistansk opphav.
Sier igjen ikke at det nødvendigvis er gakt, men når ble det rett?

Statoils kampanje "Kraften i det mulige", ble en veldig direkte inspirasjon til å gjøre dette:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jmEUyiuY29s

Den forutsetter at vi har det vanskelig i Norge og skaffer oss god kompetanse "mot alle odds". Og at "Fordi det er vanskelig det vi gjør, så er det bra".
Det er minst to klare logiske brister i dette resonemanget. Og likevel så trykker vi det til vårt bryst og gleder oss over det, slik mange gjorde i en periode vi ikke liker å bli minnet på, der vi samlet oss om "norske verdier" og myter.

Hvorfor skal du funde oss?
Fordi du liker ideen og vil se flere filmer.
Vi lager dem allerede, vi har bare ikke egentlig råd.

Har vi kompetanse/mulighet til å lage dem.
Ja, da.... :)


The Impact

(følger Indiegogo's disposisjon her...)
Det vi ønsker å oppnå er å riste litt opp i norsk politisk debatt.
Det meste handler for tiden mer om å "ikke støte", enn å stå for prinsipielle synspunkter.  Thorbjørn Jaglands respons til Anders Behring Breivik, var:
Ti dem i hjel.

Vi tror det bare forsterker det demokratiske underskuddet å være så redd for konsekvensene av å ta debatter, at man lar ting utvikle seg under trykk.

Enighet er egentlig ikke noe mål, ved denne kampanjen, men å få frem reell uenighet og se om vi kan greie å leve med den. Vi snakker gjerne om at Norge er et fargerikt fellesskap. dette er en måte å prøve å få frem noen nyanser i palletten. Også om diskusjonene blir ubehagelige.

Likevel virker politikere generelt lite interesserte i å diskutere de paradoksene vi ser rundt oss, "fordi vi har det så godt", eller fordi det er tradisjon for å diskutere en sak av gangen. Om man gjør alt på detaljnivå, vil jo ikke paradoksene være synlige.

Og i alt fører dette til uendelige mengder newspeak og endring av innhold i gode ord og intensjoner.


Risks & Challenges

Om vi ikke har råd til å arbeide vidre med dette, vil vi jo til slutt måtte slutte... :)

Men vi tror tiden er moden for en form for problematiserende humor igjen...
Og vi tror mer på humor enn gateslag som virkemiddel for å røske litt opp i debatten.

Vi ser at vi bruker tilbakemeldinger vi får på å lage bedre filmer. Det vil si at vi håper og tror at vi blir bedre etterhvert. Så langt har vi satt oss noen mål og begynt å arbeide etter dem. 4 filmer er ute. 3 til under arbeid.
Helt på egenhånd.

Nå håper vi at flere blir med!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Hjelp oss å spre filmene. Bruk dem i debatter. Få dem inn i aviser og "vanlig" media. Vi stiller gjerne opp i offentlige debattfora. Både for å diskutere kampanjen og sakene vi tar opp.

    Filmene publiseres samlet på:
    http://godtnorsk.net

    Hjelp oss å finne sponsorer og samarbeidspartnere.

    Hyr oss inn i andre sammenhenger, slik at vi har råd til å fortsette.

    Kom med innspill til saker og vinklinger om typisk norske paradokser.

    Lei oss inn som foredragsholdere.

    Støtt oss.
    Spre informasjon om kampanjen.

    For å si det like utilslørt og ikke-norsk som George Bush forfriskende sa det etter 911 da han hadde bestemt seg for å innvadere Afghanistan og Irak som en løsning på verdensfreden:
    This is a Crusade :)

story:
Dear friends,

Our friend and sister Laurie Ishii, whom many of you have had the pleasure of working alongside with in a ministry/outreach/media setting, is in need of our love and help right now.

She and her dog Pablo can no longer afford to stay in their apartment in Hollywood.  I am looking to help her find affordable housing through HUD and other programs, but in the meantime, Laurie needs to raise money to cover the next two months' rent and utilities.  She also needs money to cover the cost of moving and to help her find a new home.  

As you know, Laurie is one of those rare gems who befriends the homeless, the prostitutes, the pimps, the lonely, and the down-and-out.  She has touched countless people's lives with her love, compassion, generosity, outreach, evangelism, and testimony.  She would literally give you the shirt off her back if you were in need.

I hope that we can come together as a community and body of Christ to help her in HER time of need.  The money we raise will be handled by me, per Laurie's request.  I will make sure that the rent goes directly to her landlord and that the rest of the money will be used to pay for necessary expenses during this transition.  

Any amount you donate and each person you share this campaign with would be greatly appreciated.  Please let me know also if you have any leads into affordable housing or any organizations/programs that can help Laurie.  Under no circumstances will I allow Laurie and Pablo to be separated.

Thank you and God bless!  

- Yealee
