Since you can't judge a book by it's cover (although it's a pretty awesome cover), here's some of what's inside. The more you help me raise, the more quotes I'll post!
 

Unlocked Excerpt 1: Awareness
"What seems like a flaw is merely our higher consciousness telling us we’re not looking at it in the right light yet."
Unlocked Excerpt 2: Trust
"Trust is not a gasoline-soaked blanket that succumbs to the matches of betrayal, never able to be used for its warmth again; it’s a tapestry that wears thin in places, but can be patched over if you have the right materials, circumstances, and patience to repair it. If you don’t, you’re the one who feels the coldest when Winter comes."
Unlocked Excerpt 3: Purpose
"Some people experience a life-changing sensation that transforms how they see the world after a near-death experience, but the way I see it, we’re all dying – nay, we’re all dead – and it is up to us to be our own self-necromancers to find some form of life and spirit to reanimate the corpse of a life spent wanting."
Unlocked Excerpt 4: Wooing
"A man is no more than breath until his breath fashions the words that others cannot forget. But you my darling, are worthy of words not yet imagined – words woven to perfection from the fibres that make envy grow in the hearts of goddesses. Though such words escape me, your presence has infused into my being every aspect of bliss that a life of happiness demands. Every day that I catch but a glimpse of you renews a satisfaction in me that even the greediest or luckiest men could only hope for, yet never have for themselves, because as long as I get to call you mine, I shall never be found wanting. Since the first time I saw you, my eyes had never presented me with beauty more deserving of the word’s connotations."
Like what you read? Want to see more excerpts? The more you pledge, the more I'll reveal!
 


Other Ways You Can Help
SPREAD THE WORD! Even if you can't contribute, tell everybody you know about this amazing book coming out! Post it in forums, talk to people at bus stops, discuss it with coworkers over coffee, email it to family and friends, write it in bathroom stalls or spraypaint the link to this campaign on buildings! Well, maybe not the last two due to legal ramifications, but if you know me personally, you'll have a connection to a future celebrity to brag to people about haha MAKE SOME NOISE! Use the Indiegogo share tools to pass this on through your social networking sites!
 
More From Darkholme
"Rise of the Morningstar" is a poetic-prose novel, neither one nor the other, but rather a plot interlaced with the best from both. For a glimpse of my poems, check out the ones below, or view others by "liking" my Facebook page to catch the latest when it's fresh off the mind!

story:
Keeping Karl on Parl

"Karl Nerenberg has emerged as one of the real bright thinkers on Ottawa politics.  You won't read this analysis in the mainstream media." ~ MP Charlie Angus.

Make something good come out of Parliament - Karl Nerneberg's reporting.  We need a reporter for the rest of us and with your help we can make it happen.

Since 2001 rabble.ca, a non-profit media organization, has been offering news and views on Canadian and world politics to the world. rabble is 100% free to access. We make ends meet through community support (individuals and organizations that support us). In other words, we are a community supported media site. 

In 2011, frustrated with the news coverage of Parliament and the Prime Minister's Office in Canada, we crowd-funded a journalist to cover news on the Hill for the rest of us. Readers (and a few organizations) came through and we sent award-winning reporter Karl Nerenberg to the Hill.

Karl promised to bring new stories and perspectives to Parliamentary Hill reporting and he delivered. Karl writes dozens and dozens and dozens of stories that matter. He goes to Parliament hearings that others miss (even the super boring ones), he digs through the bills to find what is really going on, he looks at the long-view.  In other words, he brings you real news.  He tells stories about the environment, stories about immigration, stories about health care, stories about working people -  stories about politics.

The perks of political coverage

Each year we raise funds to send Karl to Parliament and keep him reporting on the news that matters. The result is important news coverage that is shared with the world.

Our goals this year is to raise $25,000 to cover the year. We aim to raise $5,000 directly from our rabble.ca visitors through an on-site campaign  (and are almost there!) and $10,000 from organizations that support rabble.ca.  We aim to raise the remaining $5,000 through this Indiegogo campaign.

The money raised goes to pay Karl to write pieces every week Parliament is in session (and even when they are prorogued which seems to happen a lot and during some breaks). This works out to about 10 months. If this campaign doesn't reach its goal we will still use all we get to support Karl and keep supporting him as long as we can (and keep fundraising).

At rabble.ca we operate on a shoe-string budget and take the trust donors show us with their support very seriously. Each year we put out a comprehensive annual report on how we made and spent our funds to bring news to the world. You can read our annual reports here.

Perks? You know it. We got the Karl on Parl fridge magnet. You can get an unpublished audio interview with Karl the politics of Parliament  a "best of Karl" book, an invite for an exclusive Google Hang-out with Karl, you can be our Parliamentary Correspondent for the day, or even have dinner with Karl. 

Spread the word

If this campaign can't make your donation cut, but you want to help, please help us spread the word through your social networks (and through Indiegogo share tools).

story:
+The Stanley Hotel Writers Retreat - New Year's Crystal Ball+

December 30th, 2014-January 3rd, 2015



My name is R.J. Cavender and I love working with horror writers.

That's why I'm hosting this second writers retreat at the historic and haunted birthplace of Stephen King's The Shining, The Stanley Hotel in Estes Park, Colorado.

If you want to join us, simply register by choosing a package, then we'll give you the details on how to receive the group rate at the hotel when you make your reservations.

*Editing Packages and Event Registration does not include your hotel room or transportation fees. Hotel room rates are listed at the bottom of the page.*

But if you register now, you have an entire year to make your travel plans. And your registration does include all our group discount perks, select editing packages, inclusion on any outings/trips over the weekend, and a guaranteed tour of Room 217.

I'll be setting up daily critique groups and nightly dinners, giving those interested a chance to hang out with fellow authors. But these aren't mandatory, and if you'd just like time alone to write, you can do that too! We don't want to set a rigid schedule or any programming that would take away from your writing time, since this is a retreat and not a convention or conference. So no dealers room, and limited programming. Instead we're offering a unique experience with a great group of authors and publishing professionals, in a fantastic hotel with a history steeped in horror (fiction?)

Each package includes different perks that should fit the need of all authors, whether you're looking for some feedback and a polishing of your work...or you're just needing a great place to write and get away. Let us host your once-in-a-lifetime writing escape, and we'll promise you a great time in a scenic and spooky locale.

For the last few years I've served as the pitch session coordinator for two horror writers conventions, one of which I was also a co-chair. So I've had some solid experience seeing how hosting events operates from the inside. If we meet our goals, the funds will cover travel and event costs for two editors to be present and available to work with authors at the event, and will also cover the cost to rent a van to take authors on day trips into Estes Park. Stretch goals will go toward bringing in another editor to cover author edits and a possible end-of-event party. I'm not looking to line my pockets or make a profit from this venture, as this will be a 'working vacation' for myself, as many events like this have been for the last few years. I just want to put on a great event, with some talented authors, in a wonderful location...something that we'll all remember for years to come. I hope you find this idea as exciting as I do, and I truly hope you'll join us for this unique and haunting writing experience!


Group discount tickets will be available through the hotel for the Friday night Murder Mystery dinner at The Stanley Hotel and the annual Shining Ball on Saturday night, as well! Group rates are also available for ghost tours of the hotel. I'll also be looking into group discounts for tours of Estes Park and any other sort of savings that I can pass along to our guests. I just want our writers to have a chance to get some work done...but be ready for fun when the occasion arises, as well. 


Event registrations/packages are transferable, but non-refundable. If you're not entirely sure if you can make it, please don't register. Funds for this event will be spent as they come in, securing rooms, vehicles, and other event expenses. Cancellations will create problems, so commit to this now...don't flake out...and we'll see you then!

Fees for cancellation with the hotel and every last detail to reserve rooms are listed below. Confirmation of perk/package redemption will be within 24-hours, with instructions on how to redeem your room discounts at The Stanley Hotel once you've registered.

We hope to see you next December!

Confirmed Authors Guest List
== To Be Updated as Guests Register ==



About Your Hosts/Editors

R.J. Cavender is an Associate Member of the Horror Writers Association of America and the twice Bram Stoker Award®-nominated editor of the +Horror Library+ anthology series from Cutting Block Press. Horror Library IV (co-edited with Boyd E. Harris) won the 2010 reader's choice Black Quill Award from Dark Scribe Magazine in the Best Dark Genre Anthology category.

R.J. is also a publishing consultant and co-editor of the Bram Stoker Award-nominated Horror For Good: A Charitable Anthology, which includes stories by award-winning authors Jack Ketchum, Ray Garton, Ramsey Campbell, and Benjamin Kane Ethridge. R.J. is the resident horror specialist at The Editorial Department, Managing Editor of horror at Dark Regions Press, an acquisitions editor at Blood Bound Books, and pitch session coordinator for World Horror Convention.

His favorite novel is The Shining. 




*Hotel Reservation Information*

Attendees will be responsible for phoning in their reservations at (970) 577-4040 Monday – Friday 9am-4pm.

To receive special group rates, attendees must give the group discount code they received upon registering through this campaign. 


Individuals will be responsible for paying their own room, tax and incidental charges. Guests will call The Stanley Hotel to make a reservation from the group room block and will be required to pay a deposit equal to 1 night room rental.

Group rate of $655.00 per room covers entire 5-night stay-- December 30th, 2014-January 3rd, 2015.

Single or double occupancy.

Individual Deposit Policy: All attendees will be required to pay a Deposit equaling one night’s room and tax will be taken at the time of the reservation being made.

Individual Cancellation Policy: Individual cancellations received within 30 days of arrival will be charged at the full rate for the entire stay, whether or not the group block commitment has been met or exceeded.

Crystal Ball Tickets

The tickets to the formal ball with dinner are available at a group discount of $149 per person and are not included with any package or offer. If interested in attending, please let your host know when registering, as tickets sell out very quickly.

Cut off Date

The block of rooms will be held until November 30, 2014.  Those rooms not reserved prior to this date will be released for general sale.  Reservations requests after this date will be taken on a space available basis at the higher of the contract rate or rate available at that time.  Should such requests be accepted, such room nights will be credited to your block for purposes of any calculation of attrition.

Room Assignments

The reservation department will attempt to accommodate specific requested room types, but cannot guarantee specific room types, locations, or room numbers.  Requested room types that are not included in the group block will be charged the prevailing guestroom rate at the time the reservation is made.

Pre/Post Group Rates

The group rates will be honored on space available basis for group attendees up to 3 days before or after the group’s scheduled stay.

Check-in/ Check-out/ Change Rooms

Check in time begins at 4:00 pm.  Room availability cannot be confirmed until that time. 

Check out time is 11:00 am. 

No Shows & Early/Late Departures

Rooms which have been reserved by and whose occupants fail to show on scheduled day of arrival will be billed for the total lodging amount for the contracted time.  Early departures and/or late arrivals will be charged the contracted nightly rate for the entire reserved stay.

Splitting Room Charges

If group attendees are to pay for their own rooms, tax and incidentals AND are sharing rooms, the following must be considered:

The Stanley Hotel is unable to divide certain charges (telephone calls, restaurant charges, incidentals, etc.).  It is the responsibility of the individual whose name appears on the reservation folio to finalize all charges between the occupants BEFORE check out.

It is the responsibility of the group leader or meeting planner to inform all attendees of the above.

Package Delivery and Storage

All incoming boxes will incur a $5.00 per box handling fee.  All outgoing boxes will incur a $5.00 per box handling fee in addition to the shipping charges (if the hotel incurs these shipping charges) and must be made via FedEx or UPS with appropriate tracking information.  These charges will be billed to the Master Account.

Materials for your function may be sent to The Stanley Hotel no earlier than 72 hours prior to the beginning of your event.

All packages must be properly addressed to the both client and the conference services manager; they must also outline the name of the group/event and the dates of the function. 

Shipment contents and delivery schedules are not the responsibility of The Stanley Hotel.  Return shipments must be completed within 48 business hours after the close of the event; clients are responsible for packaging and completing all shipping documents prior to departure from the hotel.

of 
horror at Dark Regions Press, an acquisitions editor at Blood Bound 
Books, and pitch session coordinator for World Horror
 Convention.His favorite novel is The Shining. *Hotel Reservation Information*

reservations at (970) 577-4040 Monday – Friday 9am-4pm.
To receive special group rates,

Individuals will be responsible for paying their own room,

Group rate of $655.00 per room covers entire 5-night stay-- December 30th, 2014-January 3rd, 2015.  Single or double occupancy. 

Individual Deposit Policy: All
attendees will be required to pay a Deposit equaling one night’s room and tax
will be taken at the time of the reservation being made.
Individual Cancellation Policy:

the full rate for the entire stay, whether or not the group block commitment
has been met or exceeded.
Crystal Ball Tickets

story:
Short Summary

"Shabbat Across Israel" is a study about the significance of the Shabbat tradition in my life, and its importance to Judaism. At age eighteen, I had been through roughly 936 Friday night Shabbat dinners at my Grandparent's house--but on June 2, 2006 the chair at the head of the table was empty for the first time. The sudden passing of my invincible Grandfather showed me the importance of my family's weekly tradition, for in the midst of sorrow, observing the Sabbath held us together. 

 That realization got me thinking--when we examine the history of The Jewish People, we see a history filled with persecution. So how is it that after thousands of years we are still one of the major religions of the world? What is it that has kept us strong throughout the generations?

 I believe the thread that holds us together is the Sabbath; I am embarking on a journey across Israel to explore the meaning of this tradition in all walks of Jewish life across the ethnic and socio-economic spectrum. The mission is to express the collective Jewish family through the observation and experience of Shabbat Across Israel.  Through my journey, I hope to help others discover the beauty of Shabbat, and gain an understanding of how connected we are as Jews.  Whether you’re in New York or Israel on a Friday night…it is Shabbos, and Jews all over the world are united for twenty-four hours, not only with each other—but with their past, as well as their future. This research will not only benefit the Jewish people, but it will show all people the threads that have kept the Jewish Family together generation after generation. 

What We Need & What You Get

I would like to offer you the opportunity to be a part of something that may play a phenomenal role in the Jewish Future. A financial sponsorship would enable me to conduct my research across Israel for the next year. For you, it would mean participating in something that will help the next generation of Jewish leaders reconnect to their roots.  I want to give the gift of Shabbat to Jewish students, and help them rekindle a love for our traditions. My research is the key to understanding the common thread that links Jews of all backgrounds, all over the world.  It connects us to each other, to our past, and most importantly--to our future. 

I am hoping to raise $10,000 to aide in my tuition! I need your help!

The Impact

Throughout the year, I will maintain a written blog and video blog in order to establish an audience. As a young woman, I can offer a fresh perspective on the significance of this powerful tradition, and I can tell it in a way that is accessible to young adults. With the use of social media, my journey will be documented in many forms and can further highlight the important role that our traditions play in Jewish life. I have several friends employed in Hillel programs around the U.S.A, who are excited to share the web content I produce with their students. I am also currently in the process of arranging several Shabbat Experiences with additional organizations such as Hillel and Birthright. I hope that by meeting with students I can gain a sense of what Shabbat means to them, and of how they connect to the collective Jewish family.

 During my year in Israel, I will write a memoir detailing my journey and what I learn. My desired audience is the young adult group—my own generation—although I do not wish to limit myself, or the books potential to reach a wide age range. I feel that beginning a conversation on the importance of our traditions in today’s fast paced world is vital to maintaining the Jewish people’s place in it for today, and for future generations. I see a growing amount of teenagers, young adults, and even some grown adults rejecting their Jewishness--to them it seems archaic.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help! 

Share my project with your community. Send it to family, friends, whomever. 

NOTE: My application to Hebrew University is currently under review. If I do not get accepted, I will still be going to Israel-but the money raised will go towards my accommodations and living expenses while in Israel, instead of tuition.

story:
Why Help?

Malaysia is one of the most religiously repressive nations on the globe.  Other nations may enact more severe penalties upon religious taboo, however Malaysia is one of the few nations to encounter religious restrictions in the face of such religious diversity (as a result of a slim 51% ethnic majority).

Add to this mixture, a generation of young people that are growing more disillusioned with a religion that is being enforced on them by the state based on nothing more than their ethnicity. In a nation where one's birth dictates religious expression, educational opportunities, vocational success and social status, we need to give a voice to those who do not have religious freedom and choice!

What We Have So Far

We need to interview 100 people; in order to do that we have created two items.  The first is our "The One Hundred" T-Shirt (currently being printed!) which puts interviewees at ease - "Hey look a T-Shirt, these guys are legit!"

The second item (which we are very proud of), is our survey rig.  This $40 dollar laptop (that's right $40 dollars in parts and donated gear) allows us to illicit and record consistent interview material with the touch of a very portable button.  Not bad for $40 and a week of programming.


What Will "The One Hundred" Look Like?

So what will "The One Hundred" look like?

  • The author will interview 100 youth (these youth will be a statistical representation of the country's demographic make-up: 60% Malay, 24% Chinese, etc.)
  • The book is meant to examine, challenge and record young Malaysians' perspective on their faith.
  • The book is Christian, the book will unashamedly present questions from a Christian perspective. 
  • The goal is the questioning and analysis of each religions material and formal foundations - only from there will the author present Christian thought and engage personal stories.  
  • The book is expected to be 150 pages and will endeavour to protect the identity of all interviewees as much as is possible

Where Will The Contributions Go?

Rewards and travel (and campaign fees).  That is it.  Rewards are meant to engage students and remaining funds go towards travel.  Unfortunately in a country replete with crime, rewards are needed to engage youth and avoid suspicion. $500 USD or $1600 MYR is sufficient to cover all rewards and travel.  $50 will go towards the fees associated with this campaign.

What Do You Receive?

Besides helping Malaysian youth, all contributors will receive an electronic copy of the book (English or Bahasa Malaysia) and will be amongst the first to be offered copies of the paperback (English) for purchase.  Bahasa Malaysia paperback copies of the book will not be available for purchase at our first printing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Pass this along to anyone you know would be interested in donating
  • We have done the utmost to insure we respect both the letter and intent of federal and local Malaysian law, however we appreciate it if you restrict the distribution of this campaign to positive supporters (due to possible extra-judicial retaliation).  Thanks

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who Is This Guy And What Is This?

My name is Stephen Leininger. I'm a writer living in Baltimore. I won't bore you with details of my upbringing. I mean, the important thing is that I wrote this book, right? Right?? 

20/40 is my debut novel. It tells the story of Derek Wilson, a 20-something who crashes funerals whenever he can. He searches for purpose in the lies he tells. But soon he meets new friends who he comes to like and grow close to. These friends are the best people he's ever known, and life seems okay again. But when Derek loses one of the things most important to him, ghosts begin to emerge from the past, threatening to rob him of everything he's come to love. 

You can read the first two chapters of 20/40 here:  https://www.wattpad.com/189624084-20-40-preview-chapter-1

Here's How You Can Help:

Even if you contribute as little as $1, you're helping. And there's a reward for that! Your name goes on a list of names for everyone who contributes in the back of the book, just for you! To read the book, it's $2 for an eBook edition, which you can order for the major eReaders, Nook and Kindle. Pretty awesome, right?

If you donate $9 then you get a physical copy of the book, signed by me AND with a personal note, if you want one, (or if I feel whimsical that day!) and $20 will get you a signed poster AND a signed book. This campaign revolves entirely around you, affordable prices, and things that I can write my name on. 


Other Need To Know Stuff:

The point of this is not the money. I don't need the money. This is essentially a pre-sale for the book at discounted prices and poster bundles for some of you with space on your walls. 

  • This is set to $500 because it's the minimum that IG has. It would be incredible if we meet it, but it's not life or death.
  • This is all about me creating this book, you guys liking it, and being able to own it for cheaper than 75% of other books. 
  • I just want people to like me. 
  • All funds will be used to produce and ship your orders, which is why there aren't any extra costs for shipping!
The reason all the prices are so low is because I hate going to a store and seeing a medium-sized paperback book for $15-$20. It's not worth that much, guys. Stop it. My stuff is affordable and awesome. 

Timeline:

The estimated delivery date is set to April to account for any challenges that I may encounter. I'm expecting the final edition to be done in the next 2 months with nonstop work, but accounting for shipping to me and then shipping to you and any incidents, I say April gives plenty of time. My plan is for you to get your stuff before then, and I'll update you all on all major events, so no need to worry!

If You Can't Contribute:

Again, no worries! Even if you just share this page and get your friends to check it out, you are helping, and that's awesome! Make some noise for this thing, and we'll get this ball rolling together! 
So remember:
  • Get the word out and start the chatter about this campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! (they told me to say that!)
You can also follow me on Instagram and on facebook. 
Thanks guys!
See you, Space Cowboy.

story:
I’m the founding and senior pastor of Eastpoint Church in Spokane Valley, WA. I also love to write, and I’m the author of three published books. (Click here to see my books.)

Madeleine L’Engle once said, “There is nothing so secular that it cannot be sacred, and that is one of the deepest messages of the Incarnation.” I believe this to be true, and it’s why I want to publish a pumpkin story to add a “sacred voice” to the not-so-sacred holiday of Halloween.

This fun and illustrated kids' book will introduce children to a grumpy pumpkin named Pete. Pete leaves his home, ends up in a dark and scary place, but then he is found by kind Farmer Dale. It’s a story of restoration and forgiveness.

As you can imagine, creating and publishing a full-sized (8.5 x 11), full-color children’s book is not cheap. Here’s a breakdown of the total project cost of $2,500:

·  $ 1,000 to pay the artist for ten color illustrations

·  $ 750 for media support and advertising

·  $ 500 for an initial run of books for distribution to potential reviewers/endorsers

·  $ 250 for editing

I know this book will impact the lives of many children! It’s time to put something fun, amazing and godly in the hands of parents for Halloween.

So here’s how you can help:

·  Give a tax-deductible gift of as little as $15, and I'll send you a digital version (in a pdf format) of my book: Perfectly Imperfect ~ A Devotional for Grace-Filled Living!

·  For a gift of at least $35, you will receive a free and signed copy of Pete the Prodigal Pumpkin when it releases.

·  For a gift of at least $75, you will receive a signed copy of Pete the Prodigal Pumpkin plus a free and signed copy of one of Kurt’s three other books (your choice)!

If just 70 people give at least $35 we will easily reach our publication goal. By the way, any funds received in excess of our goal will remain in the Essential Life Press (ELP) accounts for future projects.

This is a Christian book, published by Eastpoint’s publishing ministry (ELP), and a project consistent with our mission to advance the Gospel. Therefore, all gifts are fully tax-deductible (less the actual cost of whatever you receive in exchange for your gift).

Please use the Indiegogo share tools on this site to pass the word!

story:
What is AWP?

The Association of Writers and Writing Programs (AWP) sponsors the largest annual gathering of creative writers in North America. In April 2015, some 12,000 writers attended the meeting in Minneapolis. Turnout is expected to be even larger for the 2016 meeting in LA. 

What is the AWP LGBTQ Caucus?

In addition to hundreds of panel discussions and readings, the AWP conference features a number of caucus meetings, representing constituencies including women writers, indigenous-aboriginal American writers, 2-year college educators, and other groups. 

The LGBTQ Caucus provides a safe and inclusive space for LGBTQ writers to network and discuss common challenges and concerns. Our major issues involve representation, visibility, and incorporating our personal identities into our writing lives in the many settings in which we work. We organize to develop queer representation for future AWP conferences and initiatives to nurture the creative and professional lives of our members. 

Pictured above: The Executive Committee chosen by the attendees at the AWP LGBTQ Caucus in Minneapolis in 2015. From left, Tiffany Ferentini, Bee Spaethe, Michael Broder, and Miguel M. Morales. 

Why an AWP LGBTQ Caucus Hospitality Booth?

At the AWP 2015 LGBTQ Caucus meeting, attendees said they wanted a strategy to help LGBTQ writers deal with the overwhelming and often disorienting experience of an AWP conference, with its thousands of attendees, hundred of readings and panels, and scores of offsite events. We especially wanted to offer support to young LGBTQ writers who might be attending their very first AWP conference.

We decided on a hospitality booth on the exhibit floor as the focal point of our efforts to address this need for orientation and support for new and returning LGBTQ writers alike at AWP 2016 in LA. 

Pictured above: Queer poet Celeste Chan reading to a rapt audience at the 

Queer Voices LGBT Reading organized by IntermediaArts at AWP 2015 in Minneapolis.

Aren't Hospitality Booths Boring?

Not ours! We're going to snag ourselves a booth and turn it out and into a FABULOUS homospitality booth! LGBTQ writers, newcomers and regulars alike, can stop by, meet and greet, have a snack, and share experiences—good, bad, and simply baffling—with fellow LGBTQ writers. Network. Make new friends. Find someone to go for drinks with later at one of the hotel lobby bars, or to attend one of the many offsite readings that will take LA by storm. 


Pictured above: The AWP LGBTQ Caucus logo, designed by Eleanor Schlegel.

What are the Benefits to Having a Booth? 

Having a booth will further establish and increase visibility of the LGBTQ writers at AWP by providing us with:

  • A listing for the Caucus in the 2016 AWP Conference Planner
  • An expanded listing with a logo and description on AWP's website
  • A physical space where LGBTQ writers can interact, socialize, network, and learn from each other's experiences
  • Increased awareness of LGBTQ writers and their role in AWP
  • An opportunity to strengthen our Caucus by recruiting new members

... and more.

Why Should I Donate?

  • Are you an AWP member and member or ally of the LGBTQ community? 
  • Are you already an AWP LGBTQ Caucus member? 
  • Are you a queer writer eager to network with other queer writers at the largest gathering of creative writers in North America?

If you answered "Yes"to any of these questions, consider supporting our effort to fund an AWP LGBTQ Caucus Hospitality Booth in Los Angeles in 2016.

Pictured above: Charles Rice-Gonzales and Nivea Castro at AWP 2015 in Minneapolis.

What We Need & What You Get

The AWP Conference Bookfair consists of more than 800 exhibits, including large publishing companies, small independent presses, journals, academic writing programs, and literary advocacy organizations. Most of the exhibit spaces are 4' by 7' tables, but many of them are also 10' by 10' booths. 

A booth at the AWP Bookfair costs $875. We set our fundraising goal at $1,200 to cover the cost of the booth, a banner, stickers with our new logo (see above), a guide to AWP for LGBTQ writers, some munchies and other goodies for our guests. Should we exceed our fundraising goal, those funds will be dedicated to furthering AWP LGBTQ Caucus presence and activities. 

Want to Support the Caucus? Perks Include, but are not Limited to:

  • The ability to shout out loud and proud your support with our fabulous (and much sought after) AWP LGBTQ stickers, courtesy of Lambda Literary Foundation (see below)
  • Your name on caucus promotional material exhibited at the booth
  • Signed LGBTQ books as penned by some of today's best LGBTQ authors
  • The opportunity to have your fiction, poetry, or nonfiction manuscript critiqued by some of the best names in LGBTQ lit
  • The opportunity to secure a prime slot at our booth to host your own book signing

... and more.

Pictured above: Spoken word poet Neil Hilborn and Tiffany Ferentini, Community Coordinator of the AWP LGBTQ Caucus, at the Button Poetry booth at AWP 2015 in Minneapolis. 

Pictured above: Our AWP LGBTQ sticker, courtesy of Lambda Literary Foundation. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't support the Caucus financially, that doesn't mean you can't help increase visibility for LGBTQ writers at AWP 2016. 

  • Share the AWP LGBTQ Caucus campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and any social media hub that's home to your queer writer friends.
  • Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter.
  • Tweet loud and be proud! Our official hashtag is #AWPLGBTQ

What is AWP?
The Association of Writers and Writing Programs (AWP) sponsors the largest annual gathering of creative writers in North America. In April 2015, some 12,000 writers attended the meeting in Minneapolis. Turnout is expected to be even larger for the 2016 meeting in LA. 



What is the AWP LGBTQ Caucus?
In addition to hundreds of panel discussions and readings, the AWP conference features a number of caucus meetings, representing constituencies including women writers, indigenous-aboriginal American writers, 2-year college educators, and other groups. 
The LGBTQ Caucus provides a safe and inclusive space for LGBTQ writers to network and discuss common challenges and concerns.
Our major issues involve representation, visibility, and incorporating our personal identities into our writing lives in the many settings in which we work. We organize to develop queer representation for future AWP conferences and initiatives to nurture the creative and professional lives of our members. 


Pictured above: The Executive Committee chosen by the attendees at the AWP LGBTQ Caucus in Minneapolis in 2015. From left, Tiffany Ferentini, Bee Spaethe, Michael Broder, and Miguel M. Morales.

story:
Hi, I'm Juan Salinas and I'm a lecturer in the Psychology Department of the University of Texas with a PhD in Neuroscience. I've created a new kind of vampire myth that is not only plausible for the concrete science nerd thinkers out there but is also able to comment on, draw from, and explain traditional vampire lore.
 
Without giving away too many details, in my world vampires are another primate species that coevolved along side humanity. They have no fangs, they can eat normal food, walk in the sunlight, and generally act just like humans. They have raspers on their tongues similar to lampreys, that they can hide, and they do need to feed on blood. And they have another adaptation that they can use to navigate in the dark, cause amnesia in their victims and sometimes accidently induce incredibly vivid, horrific, monstrous hallicinations.
 
I am self-publishing this project and it will be a series. The first book is on target to be completed by the end of March and I already am fleshing out the story arc for book number two.
 
Your contribution will pay for:
  • Editing
  • Proofreading
  • Formatting for multiple ebook platforms (so it can be made aviailabe through Apple, Barnes & Noble as well as Amazon) as well as print (paperback and hard cover)
  • Cover Design
Now, I'll grant you this project isn't high art or literature. it's just good old fashioned potbolier pulp fiction. Reading that's just for fun; something to pass the time on a summer's day or while waiting for a flight at the airport. It's not going to change the world. But it might make the time waiting for the Apocalypse a little less boring. But, all kidding aside, I do think that it's a neat twist on an old genre and by contributing you can be part of revitalizing it.
 

Other ways you can help:

  • Share this fundraiser with family and friends.
  • Share this fundraiser on Facebook, Google +, Twitter, etc. 
  • Share and like the project's Facebook fan page, https://www.facebook.com/TheCapstoneChroniclesWhateverStartsMustEnd

 

Here's a blurb about the first book:

Meet Ryan Jackson, a small town kid and freshman at the University of Texas at Austin, and follow him on his journey through an extended vampiric adolescence in the capital city of Texas where "keeping it weird" is more than a motto, it's a way of life. When a classmate is assaulted during a mugging, Ryan turns vigilante, using his talents to find the perpetrator and bring him to justice but he finds out that things aren't always as simple they seem.

story:
Update Aug. 27:

I am so touched by the many people who have contributed to the release of my novel. How exciting to write that! After all this time, it's done! I can't change a word. Lay-out is complete and we're ready to print books and make ebooks! 

Thank you for all the connections this summer-my heart is touched over and over-and the story-sharing on the blog and in emails and Facebook. Maybe I was off-base with traditional publishing- I am being led in the direction of digitally printing soft covers in smaller numbers, and of course, ebooks.

Your generosity is support I needed to get this off the ground-it's healing and scary and joyous to finally let this go. After 18 years, it's a polished stone and with pride, some grief, and a sigh of relief, I hand it to you. I hope you enjoy it.

The Story:

A backpacker falls face-flat in love with a charismatic carpet salesman while on holiday in Cappadocia, Turkey. Leigh doesn’t learn of Ahmet’s work as a freedom fighter until after their three-day Islamic wedding, but she copes with violence as readily as she learns to live without an oven or hot water.

Ahmet's missions mean that he is often absent, highlighting Leigh's comical and poignant struggles to learn the rules in her new life: never throw away old bread, don’t smoke during Ramazan, open the door no matter who knocks, save nothing for tomorrow.

From the beginning, Leigh and Ahmet tell each other stories: he romanticizes revolution and she loves a fairy tale. After they meet a group of Kurdish refugees, they decide to formally write a book.

Together, with the reader as witness, Leigh and Ahmet use the place between truth and lies to create a suspenseful and compelling story. Ahmet details the workings of a guerrilla camp, Istanbul’s underground and a torture centre, while Leigh records her experiences with Turkish baths and toilets, cooking from scratch, family formalities and holidays.

While their joint-narrative blossoms, reality is not as kind, and they soon face some difficult decisions.

Photos at www.lauriefraser.com

The Perks:

Postcard Art:    please see "Gallery" above for postcard images

When you donate $25 or more, you will receive an advance copy of The Word Not Spoken. It’s a thick book (6.25” x 9”, 600 pages, 1 kg) and so it’s expensive to print and mail (details below). If you love the feel of a book in your hands, this is a beaut.

If you prefer an ebook, Kindle now has a free app available- super-easy.

The Plea:

A quality product deserves a fair shot in the marketplace- and that isn’t cheap. Investment is needed to achieve visibility. Once that happens, this book can stand on its own 2 feet and battle it out with the best of them. Solid writing, professional editing and a gripping story will carry it all the way. I’m sure of that.

But right now, I need crowd support and you're in the crowd. Pleasee contribute!

Please share the video!

July 28- I'm doing the last read- maybe my 1000th read- it's ready for print- and I still find things to change and I still laugh out loud. It's just such a great story- Enjoy it, help me advertise it and get it out there. Speak this word with me and help fulfill a 17-year-old promise.

The Writer:

I’m Laurie Fraser (writer, ESL teacher, healer). I based this novel on the years I lived in Turkey, married to a Kurdish man. The Word Not Spoken has been expertly polished with the help of a professional editor. An early draft survived several rounds in a Canadian competition in 2000 (Chapters Robertson Davies). In 1998, Chapter 24 was published in an anthology, Sunday Afternoon, Kobe, Japan.

You can read chapter 1 and stand-alone excerpts at www.lauriefraser.com

The Reviews:

The Word Not Spoken begins as a smart, lively introduction to Turkish custom, geography and human rights issues as threaded through a tender, carefully wrought love story. But that’s only the beginning. As the plot thickens, the story evolves into a sophisticated and satisfying double-layered narrative that poses questions about human action, intention, and the requirements for honest love. This is one impressive book, made stunning by the fact that it is a debut novel.  The people, places and conundrums of Turkey will lodge under your skin forever.

 - Jean Lenihan, Los Angeles Times arts writer

 The Word Not Spoken brought back much of what I observed during my stay in Turkey as a Kurdish refugee from Iran in the late 1980s: the wonders of Göreme, the breathtaking sites of Istanbul, the fear of the secret police throughout the country, and the hardship the Kurds had been enduring for decades.  Reading it I remembered, sighed and cried, but at the same time, I laughed, and above all, hoped that one day truth, justice and freedom may prevail in Turkey. 

This is a brilliant novel that dives deep into the psyche of its characters and paints scene after scene of Turkey and Kurdistan’s rich and distinctive identities. I’ve enjoyed it immensely.

 - Jaffer Sheyholislami, Ph.D. Assistant Professor, School of Linguistics and Language Studies, Carleton University 

The Budget:

Direct and projected costs are $38,150.00. This campaign is expected to cover most or all of these costs. Several friends and family members have donated their time and expertise, and I am forever grateful to them (especially Jac Reid & Chris Fraser) for the progress we’ve made to this point. Other professionals have been paid on credit. Editing has been paid for.

$11,000            printing soft covers off-set (1,000 qty)

$ 1,500             printing hard covers digital (45 qty)

$15,000            postage soft covers ($15 each- 1 kg to Canada & US, 1,000 qty.-                                                                yes, therein lies the rub)

$ 1,200             postage hard covers (45 qty)

$  1,000            printing & posting postcards (1,000 sets of 3)

$ 1,500             website

$   950              video

$ 6,000             marketing (Goodreads spot, Kirkus review, SEO, online ads, print                                                                     ads)

$   500              book launch (September 30, 2013)

 $1,500             or more? Kurdish charity

$ 1,300             Indiegogo’s share of funds (fees, Pay pal, credit card processing)

Total costs       $38,150.00

Campaign goal    $21,000.00  (Indiegogo takes 4 % if I reach my goal and 9% if I don’t- therefore the goal is set lower than what I’m praying for.)

Some unsold books will be used for reviews/promotion, “Pass Along Books” and donations.

story:
Short Summary

CR's Leading English Language digital newspaper, Inside Costa Rica (http://insidecostarica.com) has been published daily since 2002.  

 

We operate on a shoe-string budget, in fact we don't even maintain offices in the traditional sense.  We are all 'on the ground' reporters and journalists.  

 

We make little if any profit when certain prolems arrise.  

 

For instance, our main vehicle now needs $3,000 in repair to get back on the road.  We don't have the funds at the moment which is hindering our newsgathering and business ability. 

 

We are a small proup of both Costa Ricans and Expats simply doing what we jove - journalism.  The financial rewards are next to to nothing, we just want to keep operating and bringing real, hard news to the English speaking population here.

 

In a small Central Amerian county of just 4 million people, and being an English language publication, our audience is limited but growing - some 45,000 unique monthly readers who read about 250,000 newspages per month, and growing.

 

With your support, we have big plans to grow our newsgathering and more original reporting.  Can you help us, both to surive and grow? 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

Right now we are looking for $10,000 towards the repair of our most important vehicle ($3,000), plus we are in severe need of a few new tools of the trade - some smartphones and better photographic equipment.

Each and evey donor will be mentioned on a special page on ICR.  Those who contribute $100 or more will get a special treat.

Shoud we not reach our entire goal, the first order of business is getting our work truck back on the road.  All funds will go directly to absolutely needed improvements for our small but scrappy news organization.  

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Read our news site: http://insidecstarica.com
  • We provide a much needed service for English speakers in Costa Rica and the rest of Central America.  Our news is frequently utilized by national syndicators like Reuters, AFP, and more.  In many cases we are the only reliable source of English news for the entire region.  
  • All of our material is originally writen or from our syndication parter,AFP.

Other Ways You Can Help

SIf you can't contribute yourself, please SHARE this campaign wih everyone you can and help us save Inside Costa Rica.  Some of competitors are better funded than we are, but we know that our covearge of real issues beats them hands down.  We work for the love it, not the profit potential, and just need the opportunity to keep doing what we love.

 

Your generous donation will allow a small, independent news site continue to function for another 10 years.

story:
My name is Stephanie Georgieff, and I am raising funds to publish my book, The Black Madonna Journey of the Human Heart. 

The book covers my own journey, taking a pilgrimage to the major shrines in Spain, France, Poland and Switzerland. While witnessing the devotion of those who seek these works of art, I made deep discoveries anlong the way. Linking history, the Camino de Complestela, my understanding of science and the significance of the Divine Feminine, The Black Madonna Journey of the Human Heart allows readers to understand that the Black Madonna is actually a loving symbol of the enfoldment of Christ consciousness in our own lives and the evolution of Humanity. 

This study is a truly unique approach to the subject melding academic research and the longing of the human heart. 

The book is ready to go to the publishers, and all the money raised will go to production costs.

story:
I established Under the Volcano Books in Mexico City in 2011 after falling in love with the city and moving there - and seeing what it lacked, a real English language bookstore affordable to the local population. (All books tend to be expensive in Mexico, often twice what they cost in the U.S.- while the minimum wage here is around $5 a day.)

I found that I could use my knowledge of the literature written in English to choose from the wide selection of discount books available north of the border, and drive them down to make them available to the large English readership in the world's biggest city. (Yokohama and Tokyo are clearly two cities.)

It's been a long learning process, and what I've come to understand is that while expats and visitors and the local wealthy have their own channels for finding a wide selection of reading material in English, for people of lesser means, students and bargain travelers my store is the only place here for them to go. What they want - forget Travel, Politics, Sociology, Religion, Music, Languages (they are already reading in English) and Skills - is the essence that can't be exactly translated. They want the literature written in English, in the original.

I want to offer them everything they might be looking for, and more.

The cost of driving to Texas (the closest U.S. state), buying some 1500 books at rock-bottom discount prices, and coming home, amounts to $2500. Additionally, we've incurred debt to a few generous individuals whose patience is not infinite, and the infrastructure of the store itself needs some work: a bathroom in need of restoration, a broken lamp, a broken stereo, and new bookcases for this radical 50% expansion of our stock.

I can already see that to the greater extent we can fulfill our customers' needs, the more books they will buy. Some fifty bestsellers fly off the shelves as soon as they are stocked, some surprising - W.H. Auden: Selected Poems? Middlemarch? - and some not so much - Lolita, On the Road, and the great novel that is our store's namesake, Malcolm Lowry's Under the Volcano.

What can we say about our passion for literature? For something that is made strictly of words, it is hard to put into words. It explores worlds beyond our imagining, and calls us home. It is a body of the deepest truth, made of the wildest fabrications. It can be silly, pretentious, wrongheaded even as we marvel at its excellence, but without it many of us feel we are barred from our full humanity. It is magic, it is dreaming; it is the stuff of which our daily reality is made and shaped and sustained, and we had better use it wisely.

If you don't know me, my name is Grant Cogswell, and I didn't just fall off the turnip truck. My efforts to build a monorail system for the city of Seattle and stop a highway tunnel megaproject along that city's waterfront met ultimately with defeat - but not without some monumental triumphs first. There is a book and movie about me: Grassroots, by Stephen Gyllenhaal. I have published a book of poems, The Dream of the Cold War, released by Publication Studio in Portland. But Under the Volcano Books is a living thing. We are open every day, and except for Tuesdays, I am here. You can view the store's website and our blog at www.underthevolcanobooks.com.

Please help us reach our goal with a donation, and by sharing our video and project using Facebook, Twitter, email, and the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you for being part of this amazing dream.

story:
The Todd Kincannon Book Project

Useless Idiots: The Proper Care and Feeding of Liberals

I'm considering writing a book about liberals, their incredible dumbassery, and how to fight back effectively. The working title is "Useless Idiots: The Proper Care and Feeding of Liberals." I plan to chronicle many of the things I've learned about liberals over the years, most of which I've learned since getting on Twitter a few years ago. More importantly, I'll explain how regular folks who are not obsessed with politics can fight the Left and win without going to work for a congressman and moving to Washington. Conservatism needs to recruit and train far more weekend warriors and achieve minimum safe distance from the professional political class in DC, and my book will be a step in that direction.

To fight liberals, you must first understand liberals. I'd always had a vague idea that liberals were incredibly useless people, but I really didn't know how deranged they were until encountering them on Twitter. I generally thought they were nice folks who cared about the poor and downtrodden so much that they wanted government to be a giant charity. That's a bad idea, but its proponents are not fundamentally evil people.

But it turns out very few on the Left actually care about the poor and downtrodden. They just pretend like they do to get votes. Most liberals only care about establishing governmental dominance over anyone and everyone who doesn't think like they do. They don't care about liberty or any of America's founding ideals. Liberals are nothing more than ideological imperialists, seeking to dominating dissenters in every way possible.

The mainstream media filters liberal insanity so much that the average person doesn't get to see them for what they are. But on social media like Twitter, nobody is there to filter them, and direct observation of liberal lunacy is possible. After careful study, I've concluded that liberals are basically people-shaped animals, wild and ornery creatures who often look and sound like civilized human beings but are really savage lunatics who think "Lord of the Flies" is a model of moral government.

In addition to observing the psychosis that is modern liberalism on social media, I've experimented with a number of political combat tactics against them. I've carefully documented what works and what doesn't, and though I've shared quite a bit of this material on Twitter, I want to report my findings in a long form, cohesive treatment. My purpose is to train conservatives in political combat the way Saul Alinsky trained the Left. It is the only way we will ever win our country back.

That being said, writing a book is a lot of hard work, and I'm a capitalist. The reality of my life is that my dog Noodle eats a lot and my wife Ashely constantly needs a new pair of shoes. I can't go wasting a bunch of time writing a book if nobody is going to read it. Noodle might experience hunger for the first time and Ashely might have to wear a pair of shoes more than once. Either would be a crisis in my life making Armageddon look like a LARPer slapfight at the Renaissance Faire. Therefore, I want to make sure a reasonable number of folks actually want to buy a book from me before I go to the trouble of writing it.

If I can pre-sell a couple hundred copies or so in a week, I'll write "Useless Idiots" and publish within the next three months. Every $15 qualifies for an e-book and every $20 qualifies for a real book printed on actual paper (quaint, I know). I will personally inscribe real books if you wish. Obviously I can't do inscriptions with e-books, but I can tell everybody to follow you on Twitter.

If the goal is not met, you get your money back automatically. If the goal is met, you'll get a copy of "Useless Idiots" in time for summer reading by the pool (unless some liberal kidnaps me and tortures me with eyelid-taped endless viewings of Theron K. Cal's documentary "The Sellout Diaries: Volume One"). I bet you'll enjoy "Useless Idiots," and if you don't, you can always give it to somebody as a crappy hand-me-down Christmas present. Heck, you can do that even if you like it.

Obviously, you don't have to limit yourself to one copy, and be sure to tell your conservative friends about it. Indiegogo has a "share" feature that will allow you to share this on Twitter and Facebook, by email, etc. If you chip in, you'll want to help me reach the goal by telling your conservative friends and getting them to chip in too. That maximizes your chances of actually getting a book and not a refund.

One last thing: I've complained in the past that some conservative pundits only care about selling books and don't care about fighting the Left. The purpose of "Useless Idiots" is to give you tools and tactics for fighting liberals, not to make me rich. I don't care about making the New York Times Bestseller List. I only care about giving conservative Americans the tools and tactics they need to take America back from the rabid Left before it's too late. And it's almost too late.

story:
Visita Tachira

Hola mi nombre es Máximo Sánchez, soy fotógrafo y diseñador web y vivo en el Estado Táchira; para mí, el estado más andino y hermoso de Venezuela.

Dese el 2010 comencé a tomar fotografías de la región que incluía hermosos paisajes naturales y retratos de personas que viven aquí.

También inicié el portal Web www.VisitaTachira.com que desde entonces ha mostrado dichas fotos y más recientemente, incluye un directorio turístico GRATUITO para empresas y locales comerciales de la región. Una guía útil para los turistas y visitantes que puedan venir.

Pero esto es solo el comienzo...

Con tu ayuda queremos potenciar este proyecto con miles de imágenes en alta resolución que puedan ser usadas libremente por cualquier persona u organización dispuesta a mostrar las bellezas del Estado Táchira.

La idea es hacer un banco de imágenes turísticas del Táchira que puedan ser subidas a la Web y utilizada por cualquier persona, revista, portal o institución que desee mostrar y promover a este hermoso Estado.

Tu aporte no sólo ayudará a impulsar este proyecto, sino que llevará alegría y felicidad a todos los rincones que visitemos durante nuestra aventura.

Fotos y sonrisas

Alegría y felicidad, porque en nuestras visitas a los pueblos y caseríos del Estado Táchira, no solo haremos fotografías y grabaciones documentadas, sino que además entregaremos pequeños pero significativos donativos a niños y ancianos que viven en pobreza en estas zonas de campo

Qué necesitamos


Para empezar nuestra travesía, ya tenemos un vehículo, listo para viajar. Ahora lo que nos falta es conseguir una buena cámara y dinero para costear el viaje que tendrá una duración de 2 meses, visitando los rincones y lugares más hermosos del Estado Táchira.

Comida, hospedaje, alimentos y ropa que se va a donar, son tan solo algunas de las cosas que tenemos que pagar a diario.

Con tu valiosa ayuda, mostraremos en fotos lo bueno y hermoso de Venezuela, en Internet fotos y videos que enamoren al mundo y nos lleven como región a ser más prósperos en materia turística.

Recuerda que el material fotográfico será de libre uso.

Recuerda también, que lo que nos motiva es captar lo hermoso del planeta y lo hermoso de la gente que en esta parte del mundo vive.

20% de la recaudación será donado

A muchos lugares a donde iremos hay niños que viven en pobreza, nuestra costumbre cuando visitamos un lugar por varios días, es hacer una donación en ropa o comida.

Con tu ayuda, 20% de lo recaudado será para concretar estas donaciones en tu nombre que llevan alegría y felicidad para todos. Incluso para ti mismo. Dios te lo multiplicará.

Solo me resta dar las gracias de ante mano por colaborar en este proyecto que inicia en 45 días, Dios quiera alcancemos la meta para hacer de este sueño una realidad

Tu contribución lo hace posible

Viajar alrededor del Táchira, tomar las mejores fotos de paisajes y lugares, captar rostros de personas que tienen esperanza y alegría, entregar donativos en cada lugar gracias a ti, es lo que nos motiva.

Llevamos tiempo haciéndolo y ahora lo haremos de nuevo y en grande gracias a ti. VisitaTachira.com es un proyecto consolidado que simplemente requiere tu apoyo para acrecertar su aporte al turismo y a la felicidad de la gente en la región.

Las fotografías serán netamente turísticas, paisajes, rios, montañas, animales, personas, sembradíos, campo, riegos, hortalizas, todo lo que hace al Táchira una región especial.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar


Sabesmo que quieres ayudar y este es el momento. Ayudando a Visita Táchira, ayudas a conservar el ambiente, a preservar y reconocer un lugar de Venezuela donde se puede respirar aire puro, donde se ve gente campesina, donde se ven niños con carencias pero felices.

Si no puedes contribuir ahora, por favor ayúdanos a difundir esta campaña, ya sea usando las herramientas de Indiegogo o compartiendo en tus redes sociales nuestra página Web y nuestra página en facebook

Website: www.VisitaTachira.com
Facebook: www.facebook.com/visitatachira
Twitter: www.twitter.com/visitatachira

Una vez más, GRACIAS!!

story:
The Book

Bold, bright, funny and original, Monolith is a work of science fiction like no other. Part dark comedy, part philosophical treatise, the story takes a look at the human condition and the limits of morality. 

Set in the year 2137, Monolith follows the story of a recent college graduate named Travis Nguyen who has been commissioned to write a book, the first to be printed on paper in nearly 125 years. Nguyen chooses to write about a controversial topic - a curious series of events aboard a spaceship called the USCC Meno that the world government has kept under wraps for three years. What Travis finds while digging for the truth of what happened to the crew of the Meno is both humorous and horrifying. Chilling and unprecedented, Nguyen's discovery ultimately leads to a better understanding of what makes, and breaks, a man, and what ought to be done to make sure such misfortune is never had again.

A project three years, four drafts, and thousands of pages in the making, Austin Allen's science fiction epic Monolith: or, the Greatest Joke the Universe Ever Told is finally ready for publication! However, with how many copies are in demand, the price for designing and fitting the book's cover art, and with the rising cost of publication, progress forward is at a standstill. 

We Need Your Help!

Here's where you come in. Each contributor who pledges $10 or more will score a copy of Monolith (eBook at $10, paperback at $25+). Once we reach the goal of $1500, cover design can enter its final stages and publication will start almost immediately. So, what can you do to help? Easy! Pledge two five dollar bills or more and score some cool rewards, or pass the word on to your friends and family. The more people who can get excited about this book, the sooner you can get your copy delivered to your door!

Support Idaho Science Fiction! Please Contribute TODAY!

What's in it for YOU?

$1,500 is not an enormous amount, but it's enough to keep production at a halt. Any help in reaching our funding goals will be greatly appreciated, and of course, will not go without recognition! Here are some of our neat perks for preordering and funding the publication of Monolith: or, The Greatest Joke the Universe Ever Told (NOTE: perks are cumulative, so if for example you contribute $50 you would receive ALL perks for $10, $25 and $50 combined, etc.):

 

$10 Contribution

The entry level contribution will score you an eBook copy of the finished book (compatible with all eReaders and Tablets!)

$25 Contribution

eBook copy, plus the finished paperback edition once published! (Shipping limited to US)

$50 Contribution

eBook, paperback edition, AND digital download of the original music track by Austin Allen, "Stories of Tyrone pt. 3" as featured in the pledge video! Paperback edition at the $50 level is SIGNED BY THE AUTHOR, and can ship anywhere in the world (Excl. Antarctica, unless if scientists REALLY want a copy)!

$100 Contribution

eBook, SIGNED paperback edition, digital download of "Stories of Tyrone pt. 3", AND get your name added to the "acknowledgements" section of the finished book!

$250 Contribution

Same perks as $100, plus a digital PDF copy of ALL of the original handwritten pages and notes written for the book (nearly 900 pages of supplemental material)!

$350 Contribution

$250 level perks, plus a high quality canvas print of the book's final artwork (Not pictured yet, but truly amazing!) signed by the artist! (Limit 15)

$1,000 Contribution

$350 level perks, plus one of the original FOUR notebooks the book was written on. Potentially some serious gems in there, not to mention collector's value if the book gains publicity. (Limit 4)

 

How your contributions help

Every contribution will go towards the publishing, printing, and shipping of Monolith to readers worldwide. Once the goal of $1,500 is reached, final steps in post-production can finish, and publishing will start almost immediately!

A contribution for Monolith is not just a vote for Austin's book to get published - it's a pledge to help promote creative arts in Southeastern Idaho! SE Idaho is a region that is brimming with creative people and fantastic ideas, but rarely does the region get noticed for this. Help support Southeastern Idaho Sci-Fi with a contribution for Monolith!

 

Can't contribute money?

No worries! Your time and consideration are sometimes more than enough to keep this project going. If you can't contribute money, help to instead spread the word about Monolith! IndieGoGo is loaded with plenty of tools to share the news about Monolith and other indie projects on Facebook, Twitter, and more. So, if you can't give money, give a helping hand by telling others about the book! The more people who learn about Monolith, the sooner people get to read it!
story_txt:
The Book
Bold, bright, funny and original, Monolith is a work of science fiction like no other. Part dark comedy, part philosophical treatise, the story takes a look at the human condition and the limits of morality. 
Set in the year 2137, Monolith follows the story of a recent college graduate named Travis Nguyen who has been commissioned to write a book, the first to be printed on paper in nearly 125 years. Nguyen chooses to write about a controversial topic - a curious series of events aboard a spaceship called the USCC Meno that the world government has kept under wraps for three years. What Travis finds while digging for the truth of what happened to the crew of the Meno is both humorous and horrifying. Chilling and unprecedented, Nguyen's discovery ultimately leads to a better understanding of what makes, and breaks, a man, and what ought to be done to make sure such misfortune is never had again.
A project three years, four drafts, and thousands of pages in the making, Austin Allen's science fiction epic Monolith: or, the Greatest Joke the Universe Ever Told is finally ready for publication! However, with how many copies are in demand, the price for designing and fitting the book's cover art, and with the rising cost of publication, progress forward is at a standstill. 
We Need Your Help!
Here's where you come in. Each contributor who pledges $10 or more will score a copy of Monolith (eBook at $10, paperback at $25+). Once we reach the goal of $1500, cover design can enter its final stages and publication will start almost immediately. So, what can you do to help? Easy! Pledge two five dollar bills or more and score some cool rewards, or pass the word on to your friends and family. The more people who can get excited about this book, the sooner you can get your copy delivered to your door!
Support Idaho Science Fiction! Please Contribute TODAY!


What's in it for YOU?
$1,500 is not an enormous amount, but it's enough to keep production at a halt. Any help in reaching our funding goals will be greatly appreciated, and of course, will not go without recognition! Here are some of our neat perks for preordering and funding the publication of Monolith: or, The Greatest Joke the Universe Ever Told (NOTE: perks are cumulative, so if for example you contribute $50 you would receive ALL perks for $10, $25 and $50 combined, etc.):
 
$10 Contribution
The entry level contribution will score you an eBook copy of the finished book (compatible with all eReaders and Tablets!)
$25 Contribution
eBook copy, plus the finished paperback edition once published! (Shipping limited to US)
$50 Contribution
eBook, paperback edition, AND digital download of the original music track by Austin Allen, "Stories of Tyrone pt. 3" as featured in the pledge video! Paperback edition at the $50 level is SIGNED BY THE AUTHOR, and can ship anywhere in the world (Excl. Antarctica, unless if scientists REALLY want a copy)!
$100 Contribution
eBook, SIGNED paperback edition, digital download of "Stories of Tyrone pt. 3", AND get your name added to the "acknowledgements" section of the finished book!
$250 Contribution
Same perks as $100, plus a digital PDF copy of ALL of the original handwritten pages and notes written for the book (nearly 900 pages of supplemental material)!
$350 Contribution
$250 level perks, plus a high quality canvas print of the book's final artwork (Not pictured yet, but truly amazing!) signed by the artist! (Limit 15)
$1,000 Contribution
$350 level perks, plus one of the original FOUR notebooks the book was written on. Potentially some serious gems in there, not to mention collector's value if the book gains publicity. (Limit 4)
 


How your contributions help
Every contribution will go towards the publishing, printing, and shipping of Monolith to readers worldwide. Once the goal of $1,500 is reached, final steps in post-production can finish, and publishing will start almost immediately!
A contribution for Monolith is not just a vote for Austin's book to get published - it's a pledge to help promote creative arts in Southeastern Idaho! SE Idaho is a region that is brimming with creative people and fantastic ideas, but rarely does the region get noticed for this. Help support Southeastern Idaho Sci-Fi with a contribution for Monolith!

No worries! Your time and consideration are sometimes more than enough to keep this project going. If you can't contribute money, help to instead spread the word about Monolith! IndieGoGo is loaded with plenty of tools to share the news about Monolith and other indie projects on Facebook, Twitter, and more. So, if you can't give money, give a helping hand by telling others about the book! The more people who learn about Monolith, the sooner people get to read it!

story:
The Book [background]:

I felt inspired to write this book about a year ago, but I only started writing the book back in November, 2012.  I believe that the manuscript is a finished product at this point.  I am seeking some assistance in the final costs of publishing, so that I can get the book out into the market by April.  I will be releasing the book digitally through Amazon Kindle, iTunes and Google Books.  As well as using CreateSpace to sell printed copies "on-demand" through the Amazon.com book store.  My goal is to spread the message of the Gospel.  So, all proceeds from sales of the book will be going to a fund that I am setting up so that I can start planning and going on missions trips.

The Book [content]:

The signs, miracles and wonders that God poured out on the disciples are waiting to be poured out on and through you! Simple Christianity does not bring a five point solution to gain phenomenal cosmic powers.  Simple Christianity is a dramatic and bold leap away from the mainstream ideals that have so often consumed and hindered Christians today.

Will your life be changed by reading this book? Absolutely! Will you come away from this book with a better realization and understanding of God’s love toward you? Yes, indeed! 

Use of Funds and Delivery of Rewards: 

All of the funds will go toward publishing expenses for both the printed book as well as the ebook version.  There are various fees to produce a book, including: ISBN numbers (did you know that you need an ISBN for each medium you intend to publish a book under?), Editing, Proofreading, Cover Design, Interior book layout and design, etc.

story:
Hello,
My name is Ashley and nearly six years ago my son was born, he was born with a facial birthmark (port wine stain) that covered about 85% of his face, this was initially upsetting but you accept this as you have unconditional love for your child, but you can't help but notice other people starring which has increasingly got worse as he as got older.
People make comments like what's that in your face hence the tittle of my book, he also gets some really nasty remarks which can be very upsetting.
I want to publish this book to help children understand that everyone is unique and different in there own ways and to raise more awareness and acceptance of birthmarks.
My sons birthmark is only one thing he has to contend with in life, he has rare neurological condition called sturge weber syndrome (www.sturgeweber.org.uk) which has meant his life has been quiet challenging as he has stroke like seizures, weakness in his left side of his body, glaucoma, behavioural problems and learning delay, this is a few things that make his life more challenging, however I must stress that he is an inspiration to is all, he takes everything in his stride and is a bubbly and happy little boy.

What We Need & What You Get


  • Illustration commission fees £1300
  • Printing setup fees £300
  • Initial prints £300
  • Website £400 to advertise and sell the book
This will enable the book to be published and available to buy.

The Impact

I aim to distribute this books to school, healthcare professionals and parents, so they can use this book as a tool to help people and other children understand why there child is different and that there many other differences to some more noticeable than others. It will help raise more awareness and acceptance of people with facial differences and show that everyone is unique.

If you can't help by making a contribution then please help by raising awareness of my book, share using the indiegogo share tools or by visiting www.facebook.com/whatsthatonyourface and sharing with your friends.

story:
Hello!  My name is Stacey, and I have written my first novel, titled Scarlett Blade: The Bandit Queen. The story was actually dreamt in one night (ITS TRUE!) 

Its now finished, the only thing left is to have it published! Which is a problem, as i am struggling to come up with the $5000 to have it self published with Bookpal. Bookpal will publish and distribute the finished novel for me and send me some copies, which I am more than happy to sign and send out to some of my contributors!

I also have a few more novels started and in the works. Thus if I am successful in getting Scarlett Blade published and out there, I'll be able to produce more novels for my future (hopefully) fans to enjoy. The first chapter will be put up in an update shortly.

 

If I'm not fully successful with my funding goal, I'm going to try to get it published still, it just might take a little more time to get it done. This is something that I have wanted long before the concept of my novel came along.

I have always been an avid reader and loved writing, it would be a dream come true if I am able to get published. 

Perks:

  • Autographed copy of book plus a special thank you gift for the first 10 people who donate $50.

  • Autographed copy of Scarlett Blade: The Bandit Queen for the first 20 contributors who donate $40.

  • Ebook of Scarlett Blade: The Bandit Queen for Ipad or Kindle for the first 30 contributors who donate $20.

For all my Friends on Facebook, if you don't want to help by donating, thats perfectly fine, all I ask is that you get the word out there to your friends ad family who might be interested in this project. 

A great BIG thank you to all who help out by contributing and an even BIGGER thank you to my friends and family who have read the novel in its various stages and told me to GO FOR IT!

story:
A SOURCE OF RICH STORY: THE PLACE I CALL HOME

I love my neck of the woods and its endless source of rich story, image, and language.  This book is the first of several projects sprouted from the valleys, hills, and hollows I call home.

All money collected goes towards the publication of The Readyville Mill, a children’s picture book, written by me, Connie Foster, and illustrated by Carl Carbonell.

 

THE READYVILLE MILL -- IS IT FICTION OR A REAL PLACE?

While this story is a work of fiction, the Readyville Mill is a real place. The original grist mill, built in 1812 by Charles Reedy, burned from some unknown cause during the American Civil War. The mill was rebuilt in the 1870s, which is the structure that stands today. Soon thereafter, the Readyville Mill generated some of the first electricity in Middle Tennessee. Tomm and Martha Brady purchased the mill in 2006 and began restoration. The mill is currently open for brunch on Saturdays. For more information visit www.readyvillemill.com.

 

THE STORY SEED

The Readyville Mill is about a young boy who wants two things:

  1. He wants to solve the mystery of electricity.
  2. He wants his daddy to take the time to answer his questions for a change.

The seed for this story comes from my own dad who was born in the Short Mountain community, but his father moved the family to Readyville when dad was five years old. While the mill was generating electricity at that time and while dad’s family was living in a rented house wired for electricity, they had to move back to Short Mountain without experiencing the luxury of electric lights. 

 

CAMPAIGN GOAL

The goal of this campaign is to raise $2,000 to pay for illustrations, layout, publishing, marketing, and a webpage for the book.

 

Thank you for visiting this page. I hope you will consider joining us in this project. If you can’t help with a contribution at this time, it would be great if you could share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, your other social networking sites, and by email.
