Hold on tight.” Then, he was gone - literally and figuratively. Staring at the phone, I thought, “Thank you but, WTF? A greasy pole?!” All those brutal years of working crazy hours, having no limits or balance, and I was at the bottom of a greasy pole? I hated the analogy and found myself wishing for a ladder. The visual wasn’t inspiring to a gal who likes nice clothes and heels. Perhaps well-intentioned, his message made clear that I wasn’t part of the “real club” and the uncertain climb would continue. It would be slippery, dirty and hard. Worse, you could never let go with either hand if you hoped to make it to “the top” (whatever that was). That visual has never left me. 
Years into private practice, I was having cocktails with some male alumni from my prosecutor days. The “banter factor” was high. The guys were talking law firm business referrals and salaries. I’m not usually one to be at a loss for words, but I sat in stunned silence. My salary was roughly half what they were making! Not only didn’t I have a seat at the table, I was clearly paying for the chair some guy was sitting in. After a period of preparation and nursing my wounded ego, I went to speak with someone in Big Law leadership. At a fancy restaurant, he shared that my hard work was highly valued and would pay off down the road. He agreed I was paid under-market. “It must seem unfair,” he said. Then, he shared the law firm had to make choices. My lower salary helped the law firm pay higher salaries to more senior lawyers, even if they weren’t producing the same hours or revenue. “Be patient,” he said, “You’ll get there by fifty.” I tried to keep my jaw from hitting the salad plate. At the pace I was working, I could be dead by then. I wondered if he would have said the same thing to a guy. I left the job and more than doubled my salary in a year. The scary thing? For business and culture reasons, I didn’t even take the highest offer. 
Fast forward to 2020. I met leadership expert and best-selling author Gary Heil. Who knows why he took my calls or what he found so amusing about our debates. What could I possibly have to offer someone of his caliber, I wondered? Turns out I was a worthy adversary, he seemed to enjoy our sparring, and he became my provocateur. In fact, he was the first person to call me on my shit (or at least the first I was willing to listen to). While I wanted to challenge him on the failures of the leadership training industry, he pointed out flaws in my arguments on culture and Big Law. Gary pushed me to think bigger and beyond my comfort zone. In the end, he was right to push back. I couldn’t criticize others for their failure to lead if I wasn’t willing to lead myself. You’ll learn that meeting Gary, among others, was pivotal to my journey, my reckoning, and the direction I took when I reached a crossroads. He seemed to know where I was going before I did. He helped me realize I wasn't alone. And, for that, I'm eternally grateful. 

You will love this book if you: 
Love honest, candid, challenging stories told with grit, heart, and humor 
Are juggling career and motherhood in a non-stop, chaotic world that doesn’t seem to get it 
Are grappling with workplace inequities and wondering if you are alone 
Are considering a career pivot and questioning whether you have the ability to pull it off 
Wonder why businesses lose women leaders and what they are doing wrong 
Wonder what our amazing kids think of our crazy working mom juggling acts


The Book - Infinitely More
Infinitely More is written in several parts. 
You will enter the wild and crazy world of a warrior working mom who moves between battlefields and playgrounds, courtrooms and classrooms, prosecutors and playdates, international air travel and carpool, memos and finger-painting. Believing she is impenetrable, she doesn’t see the ultimate burnout coming – until it does and hits her like a Mack truck. In the weeks and months that follow, she must examine how she arrived at this place, how to survive, and how she will move beyond. Slowly, she musters the courage to tap back into the grit, resourcefulness and resilience she has known for so long. She must overcome fear, rediscover her purpose and explore if another world is possible. With the help of unexpected heroes and leaders, she begins to see opportunity and limitless potential in the unknown. She faces hard lessons. She finds silver linings. She finds another way.
This is a deep, humorous, and inspiring story of the redemption and relaunching of a high-powered rebel career mom whose kids and unexpected heroes won’t let her off the hook.This book looks at this voyage from many angles:

From reflections, to hard lessons, to time lost and silver linings that offer hope 
To overcoming the deeply engrained fear of the unknown 
To moments of reckoning and redemption 
To a vision for the future that is brighter, full of possibility and closely aligned with purpose – and family

I hope you find helpful tools to think about the career you want to build that allow you to fully embrace your life.Pivots are possible. You have more power than you think. 

What We Need & What You Get

Before I start, I am not making any money off of this book. Any profits will be donated to charities dedicated to gender equality, supporting women in their career mobility and training the next generations of women leaders. This section is dedicated to upfront costs only.
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021. 
The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!) 
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats). 
The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication. 
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”). 
You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback. 
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title. 
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process. 
I have some bundle perks listed and will have some surprise perks along the way. (You can contact me if you would like to design your own creative bundle perk, and I'll see if it something we can arrange. I make no promises but loved out-of-the-box thinking!) 
And much more!

Campaign Goals
Tier 1: Hit $5,000 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)Tier 2: Hit $6,000 and the book will get a hardcover editionTier 3: Hit $8,000 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

 
About the Author
Amy Conway-Hatcher is a Partner with Schertler Onorato Mead & Sears, a boutique law firm in Washington, D.C. whose team of prominent lawyers handle a wide range of high-profile complex legal, business and reputational matters. Amy is the kind of lawyer who solves hard problems (the kind people don’t want you to know about like bribery, fraud and harassment) and keeps your name out of the media headlines. She is the first woman Special Counsel for the Commission on Judicial Disabilities & Tenure in Washington, D.C. and serves as a director on the Board of the Women’s Bar Association Foundation.Amy wrote this book to take charge of her life and career, and to hold herself accountable for supporting her peers and the next generation of women leaders. Another “secret” reason for finishing her book is to avoid being called a hypocrite by her two kids and darling husband who lovingly remind her of her own sage advice to “embrace change,” "overcome fear," “find opportunity in the unknown,” and “take risks.” She’s finally taking her own medicine.Amy is a recovering 24/7 work-a-holic equity partner in Big Law who now finds time to be the mom she always wanted to be - cheering her kids on in volleyball and chasing them to get off electronics to play with her or to tackle their chores and homework. After all, they convinced her to pivot and spend more time with them! She is a founding member of Chief in Washington, D.C., an elite private membership network dedicated to connecting and supporting executive women. As a member of a number of professional and charity organizations, she is making up for lost time to help women rise, achieve career goals, and thrive in pivots. She's passing on and living the advice a wise woman shared, “Be a voice not an echo.”  Last, but not least, Amy is developing some hobbies, something she was never able to say with a straight face - until now.

We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship. Other Ways You Can Help

story:
Stompin' Ground

This is a good ol' fashion' hard-copy-only grassroots kind-of-anonymous 'zine designed to enhance our individual and collective human experiences. This community-generated passion project is an outlet for art, prose, poetry, philosophy, and esoteric explorations that inspire us to expand and connect.

Your contribution will help this manifest in the third dimension so that we can give it away for FREE to the community. (Printing is expensive, y'all.)

Stompin' Ground is vibrant, modern, and irreverent.

... it's pushing boundaries.

... it's like a little party that you get to carry around.

Get It Printed, Have a Party

Your help is needed to:

  • Raise a total of $4,000 
    • Printing Volume I: $1,500
    • Printing Volume II: $1,500
    • Free, public launch party at IX Park: $1,000

Speaking of the launch party... it's gonna be off the chain! You've probably been to a wild party before... but have you ever been to a feral one? Not only will the party introduce Stompin' Ground to the community, but we'll all get to immerse ourselves in the theme of this first volume: Going Feral. 

The Impact

We have been blown away by the number of people wanting to contribute to this project. Even as we approach the print date, we're still receiving submissions for the first volume! 

  • The responses we've gotten evidences the thirst for this in our community.
  • The focus of this project is not on the 'zine founders --- we are happily behind the scenes, supporting a project that showcases our contributors, inspires the audience, and hopefully catalyzes expansion of thought and transformative interactions. 
    • That said, both founders are competent professionals who take the responsibility of your contributions seriously and will ensure that the funds are used in a timely and impactful manner, as we have outlined. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this link with other people. 
  • Contribute to the next volume! (Vol. II: The Container)

story:
Story of My Book

Evolutionary Rescue - Leading Systems Change (title is evolving), is a book that features stories of bold, diverse, and creative leaders who are transforming systems.

My name is Jyoti Jani Patel and I am the author of Evolutionary Rescue. I wrote this book because I want to share the knowledge I gained from leading change and teams at Boeing for over 13 years. I also want to share how my intersectional identities influence how I see the world and show that diverse leaders are best positioned to lead systems change.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that organizational equity and innovation are closely linked. I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for creativity, belonging, and systems thinking. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you access your own power, build a healthy team culture, and use that creative energy to lead systems change.

In this book, you'll learn about transformation at nested layers in the system, from the micro to the macro. In addition to my own stories leading change at Boeing Test & Evaluation as a creative leader and engineering manager, you'll read stories from my exclusive personal interviews, including...

  • How Rebecca Bastian, VP of Community and Culture at Zillow, directed the real estate giant’s resources to help address the housing crisis in Seattle.
  • How Aubrey Blanche, Head of Diversity and Belonging at Atlassian, designed a performance management system that challenged unconscious bias and solved for equity.
  • How Don Kennedy, CFO of the Charleston County School District, is challenging the racial segregation of children in the Charleston School District through engaging with both sides of the political spectrum in his community.
  • How Dennis O'Donohue, VP of Boeing Test and Evaluation, spearheaded one of the largest internal mergers in company history to distribute access to resources & expertise, and reduce the cost of testing.

 

You will love this book if you love candid stories, intersectionality, and social justice.

Evolutionary Rescue is a nonfiction book that speaks to women leaders, leaders of color, and creative leaders who want to look at leadership and organization development in a new way.
 

 

The Book - Evolutionary Rescue 

The book is written in 4 parts and explores the synchronicity between the self, the team, and the whole system.

Part 1: The Micro and Macro Frames contains the introduction + chapters 1 and 2. You’ll understand how the interconnectedness of shifting global dynamics are signaling that it is time for our organizations to progress from a inequitable and exploitative dominant cultural mindset. You’ll also learn how navigating different cultural contexts promotes whole system awareness through my personal stories of intersectional identities as a woman of color, engineer, DJ, & global citizen.

Part 2: Self Awareness contains chapters 3 and 4. You’ll read about my story of growth through crisis, and how I walked away from a dream job at a Fortune 100 Aerospace company to reclaim my power and creativity. You’ll also hear stories of leaders from tech and non-profit orgs who overcome inertia and empower individuals through cultivating creativity, resilience and responsiveness. 

Part 3: Team Connection contains chapters 5-8. You’ll read first hand stories from women in tech about systemic bias and how diverse and inclusive teams overcome that by creating relational cultures of belonging. You’ll learn how to generate collective flow, and how to harness the power of conflict and feedback from diverse masterful facilitators and leaders. 

Part 4: Adaptive Systems contains chapters 9-11, and the conclusion. You’ll learn how intrapreneurs, entrepreneurs, and educators are shifting whole systems and orienting them towards the common good. You’ll learn how decentralized power structures promote equity and how leaders are operationalizing systems change using scenario futuring, technology nudges, and inclusive design.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book.

Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish Spring, 2021.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

And much more!

 

About the Author


Jyoti Jani Patel (She/Her/They), founder of organization design firm Spille, partners with executive teams to align people and processes to a compelling, heartfelt vision. She helps leaders and teams cultivate the courage to have conversations that matter. Her approach is informed by global life experiences as a flight test engineer, artist, storyteller, and leader of change. 

Spille’s programs deliver power & creativity, cultivate cultures of equity & belonging and promote future-focused, whole system thinking. 

Jyoti is passionate about social and gender equity in the technology space, and infusing playfulness, candor and creativity into team culture using design and systems thinking principles. Oh, erm, and Legos!

In her free time, you can find her cooking global cuisine, DJing dance music on vinyl, and raising two bombastic little girls.

For more information, you can connect with Jyoti at jyoti@spilleplay.com and @jyotibfly on LinkedIn, Instagram, and Twitter. Check out her latest creative leadership collaboration at www.TheEmpathyTour.co.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #LeadSystemChange and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

story:
Who I Am

Hi, I'm John WM Thompson. I live and work in Denver, Colorado. You may have read essays I've published in the Hairpin, The Toast, or Mask Magazine, or even seen a story of mine in far-flung places. I may be a total stranger. Welcome, in any case.

What I'm Doing

I have an abiding love for both beautiful books and very strange, unsettling short fiction. I always look forward to new work by established names that I know, discovering talents that are new to me, and evangelizing the weird. Anthologies, the vast majority released by small presses such as Undertow, Cthonic Matter, Centipede Press and Perpetual Motion Machine, were gateways for me, in all senses of the word.

I'd long harbored dreams of arranging my own murderer's row of talent and helping to birth a collaborative, weird collection. But only recently has it become a real possibility. Mooncalves is the culmination of those dreams, the project I've always wanted to make.

I should stress straightaway that this crowdfunding effort is not critical to the life of the anthology - this is purely a fundraising effort to expedite its creation. In the long term, it will happen whether or not anyone decides to chip in; I consider this something I'm giving back to the community of writers and readers who love what I love, as much as something I'm gifting to myself.

The Numbers

There are two broadly equal groups of costs that I have to account for.

The first cost group is logistical: There are some things that I can do myself, but as much fun as DIY bookbinding sounds, print processes will be outsourced. I've received referrals from veteran publishers on the logistical side of things. I plan a limited run of hardcover books, 200 plus author copies and those arranged for you, the donors, here (if this seems like a low number, I assure you it isn't). A designer and a copyeditor will likely also need to be consulted. I've budgeted for them.

For seriously good quality books and help shaping them up, I'm looking at about $3k expense all told, and that's with public domain art like the Odilon Redon painting I used for the mockup.

The second is creative cost: Every contributor will be paid, and to get some of the writers I most admire, I may need to pay more. I won't be able to pay professional rates ($.09/word, a little $500 for a 6k word short story), but I don't want to hand out minimum honorariums (which would be $50, flat) if I can help it. Ideally I would put aside at least $2k.

Any funds raised through this campaign will go toward those author honorariums. Without help, I'll either offer minimums, or delay to raise the compensation. But artists deserve better than they get. 

What You Get Out of This

You can put in for a copy of the anthology at projected cost - you might even end up paying slightly below. But you might also just want to support weird fiction!

What I Get Out of This

One does not publish short fiction in the hopes of making profit. This is a "love of the game" thing, and I'm putting money into this just to create a beautiful object filled with beautiful stories.

And in case you were wondering: My own fiction will not feature in the anthology.

Thank You!

Any help you could provide, I would seriously appreciate. And if you've ever known somebody who's been bowled over, or haunted, by a short story, nudge them toward this project.
story_txt: Who I AmHi, I'm John WM Thompson. I live and work in Denver, Colorado. You may have read essays I've published in the Hairpin, The Toast, or Mask Magazine, or even seen a story of mine in far-flung places. I may be a total stranger. Welcome, in any case.What I'm DoingI have an abiding love for both beautiful books and very strange, unsettling short fiction. I always look forward to new work by established names that I know, discovering talents that are new to me, and evangelizing the weird. Anthologies, the vast majority released by small presses such as Undertow, Cthonic Matter, Centipede Press and Perpetual Motion Machine, were gateways for me, in all senses of the word.I'd long harbored dreams of arranging my own murderer's row of talent and helping to birth a collaborative, weird collection. But only recently has it become a real possibility. Mooncalves is the culmination of those dreams, the project I've always wanted to make.I should stress straightaway that this crowdfunding effort is not critical to the life of the anthology - this is purely a fundraising effort to expedite its creation. In the long term, it will happen whether or not anyone decides to chip in; I consider this something I'm giving back to the community of writers and readers who love what I love, as much as something I'm gifting to myself.The NumbersThere are two broadly equal groups of costs that I have to account for.The first cost group is logistical: There are some things that I can do myself, but as much fun as DIY bookbinding sounds, print processes will be outsourced. I've received referrals from veteran publishers on the logistical side of things. I plan a limited run of hardcover books, 200 plus author copies and those arranged for you, the donors, here (if this seems like a low number, I assure you it isn't). A designer and a copyeditor will likely also need to be consulted. I've budgeted for them.For seriously good quality books and help shaping them up, I'm looking at about $3k expense all told, and that's with public domain art like the Odilon Redon painting I used for the mockup.The second is creative cost: Every contributor will be paid, and to get some of the writers I most admire, I may need to pay more. story:
Hi! I'm liz yerby and I have done lots of comics anthologies and art projects with my comics friends over the last five years. My favorite art is non-fiction comics! Non-fiction comics can be educational, experimental, and collaborative, and Dolly Pardon does all of that. In 52 black and white comics pages, the book covers a quick overview of key points of Dolly Parton's life, but also gets into facts about rides at Dollywood, lesser known Dolly Parton songs and movies, her role in cloning, her butterfly tattoos and her contributions to medical research for the COVID vaccine.



Funds from this project go to printing the book, indiegogo fees, shipping and paying the contributors! Comics artists deserve to get paid! We will not print many books beyond this pre-order, so now is the time to order. Artists involved in this project are BB Andersson, Caroline Cash, Eileen Chavez, Alecia Gatlin, Kathleen Gros, Avery Jepsen-Minyard, Elodie Kahler, Emily Lewis, Emily Nilsson, Samantha Szabo, Morgan Thomas, Amie Wilensky and Liz Yerby. Additionally, Never Angeline North designed the cover of the book, and CJ Alicandro helped with editing and Ira M Leigh helped with editing, and book design. I (liz yerby) also did editing, and book design work as well as my comics pages.

 


The costs for this project include the printing and production of the books, shipping fees, and indiegogo fees.

Any profit made beyond that gets split amongst the artists. There's a few parts for organizing and shipping by me, and a few for editing and design support by Ira M. Leigh, a few parts for the cover design by Never Angeline North and the rest is equal parts for artists pages.

There are a variety of perks to choose from!  Here's what you get with each. Prices do not include shipping.

  •  nice, a digital copy ($3) —  a digital copy of Dolly Pardon
  •  golly, a book ($7) — a copy of the book will be mailed to you.  The physical book is 52 pages long, measuring about 8x5'' and staple bound.  The exterior is cardstock and color printed, while the interior is black and white.
  • hot dang, a fancy book ($12) — this gets you a book and a sticker, and the knowledge you're extra supporting the artists involved
  • a patron of the arts ($27) — this gets you two books and a sticker, and once again, you know you're supporting cool artists who spent time making silly comics

sticker design on far left, as well as excerpts from comics by Emily Nilsson, Avery Jepsen-Minyard, Liz Yerby, Kathleen Gros and Eileen Chavez

The world of comics is both expansive and perceived very narrowly. Most peoples idea of comics is informed by superhero comics by Marvel and DC. But there is a broader world of artful comics by publishers like Fantagraphics and Drawn & Quarterly, and beyond that an even larger selection of self-published zines and independent comics.

Dolly Pardon is non-fiction, but not autobiographical, which is the most well known form of nonfiction comics (including books like Persepolis and Maus). It's a biography not intended to tell every detail of Dolly's life, but to entertain and get weird. The artists have a broad range of styles, some with more tight linework like Amie Wilensky and Caroline Cash, and others who get expressive like Samantha Szabo and BB Andersson! Another thing about this book that is unique is that of the 12 cartoonists involved in this project, none are cisgender men. Many of the artists identify as LGBTQ+ and half of the people working on this book are transgender.

Having such a queer book informs the way we draw and write about Dolly! Dolly is someone who dresses how she wants, wears wigs, get plastic surgery and still somehow charms a lot of conservative America. She subverts stereotypes and critiques capitalism, and gender roles, all the while sharing her wealth.

Please support this project, because I'm excited to share this book about Dolly Parton, as well as to be able to pay the rad artists who contributed to this project.​

 

The artists have already completed their pages, and the book is already designed and ready to be printed. There are only a few stages left for something to go wrong, but as someone who's printed about ten different friend anthologies I feel ready to conquer any hurdles!

We've already budgetted some leeway both around budget and timing, so if printing or shipping costs extra than we anticipated, it will still ensure there is some profit to be split amongst the artists.

 

If you can't contribute but want to help, please share this campaign! Indiegogo has some easy to use share tools at the top of this page.

story:
Our Story

Based in Ypsilanti, Toronto, Brooklyn, Champaign-Urbana and whatever dimensional plane Horror Editor Angela is, The Cultural Gutter was founded in May, 2003 by writer, filmmaker and game designer Jim Munroe and comics critic and artist Guy Leshinski to provide thoughtful writing on disreputable art. Since then, we've had twelve editors in two countries and seven cities write on comics, genre cinema, filmi b-movies, tv, science fiction, fantasy, horror, romance and video games. And in all that time we paid our writers, both editors and Guest Stars. Then we lost our funding grant, but a small, rag-tag band of donors joined forces with the Gutter to keep us online and help us keep our commitment to paying writers for their work. Thus, the Gutterthon was born. And the Gutter has been sustained without ads, subscriptions or a paywall.

At the Gutter we like to think we offer something special and we're kind of proud of it. The Gutter features thoughtful, well-written articles on topics like:  Godzilla vs. MechaRealism; Janelle Monáe as the American cool; Adventure Time and endings; the Telugu James Bond of James Bond 777; Hellraiser and "development hell"; mastering the art of losing; Duran Duran & William S. Burroughs' Wild Boys; and letting something you love reboot. So please click "Back It" and keep the Gutter flowing with the writing you love. Even if you can only throw in a buck, we will thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $1800 and it breaks down to $250/year/writer or about $20/article; $250/year for the Evil Overlord for publishing, promoting, finding new writers, day-to-day site management, making sure the perks are shipped out, and continuing work on The Cultural Gutter Must Be Destroyed, a collection of essays from the Gutter's current line-up. Approximately $400 will go towards website hosting, domain registration and backing up the site. The remaining funds will go toward printing and shipping perks, promotional materials, Indiegogo and Paypal fees, and paying guest writers.

In return, you get our undying and eternal thanks and your choice of some sweet perks. And, hopefully, some writing that entertains and interest you.

Perks Include:

This year Gutterthon is going full pledge break with posters, totes and mugs featuring this year's charming banner, "Sunday in the Park with Gutterthon," designed by Brian Kirby of Shelf Life Clothing Company.

My Pretty Zombie has created a signature nail polish for us,"Disreputable." It's a lovely light green with a blue shift and blue glitter. The swank label was made by the Witchery using art by the Gutter's own Carol Borden. Make sure to check the Gutterthon 2018 gallery to see swatches and the label.

A Cultural Gutter Membership package including a numbered and dated CG Membership Card and a decryption key for decoding the CG Secret Messages posted at the top of the Sponsors Page.

The Cultural Gutter Presents Secret Diagrams of Mantis Fist! Long rumored and often denied, the Cultural Gutter's have been presented in this volume for the first time. In publishing these diagrams, we hope to reassure those who have claimed that we have been hiding martial arts secrets for our own benefit. Instead, this volume contains not only the recently discovered diagrams detailing stances of Mantis Fist kung fu, but places them in context with a brief historical overviews, film reviews and even the accusations of diagram skeptics in their own words. Featuring art by author/illustrator Evan Munday and crazy talk by the Gutter's own Carol Borden. Designed by friend of the Gutter, Andrew Nahem.

Author and cult film icon Todd Stadtman has provided signed copies of his YA punk mystery, So Good It's Bad! "In Please Don't Be Waiting For Me, author Todd Stadtman introduced Scott, Bridge, Micah, and Benny, a tight knit band of teenage punk rockers whose loyalty is tested when one of their number is falsely charged with murder. In [the] sequel, So Good It's Bad, he picks up with those characters for another adventure that is every bit as terrifying, suspenseful and unexpectedly hilarious as the first."

Julie Beman from Chica Non Grata will make a papercraft nightmare for you! Either describe a nightmare for her to work from or have her make a new one for you!

Swank Cinema Detroit t-shirts from our friends at Cinema Detroit!

A sinister 9 x 12 x 1" grimoire with a cover decorated by the Gutter's own Carol and containing blank pages for your unspeakable notes and abominable ideas!

A Space Ladies 2020 mug featuring artwork by Nick Hanover. Sip hot cocoa, tea, coffee or even the brains of recalcitrant humans from this lovely mug in your choice of "The Future is Orange" or "Sensible UN Blue." (Let us know your choice in the comments or via Twitter @CulturalGutter).

A Miss Namikawa mug featuring a space lady and her love beyond all computation designed by Brian Kirby of Shelf Life Clothing Co.! And a Miss Namikawa notecard set featuring the same design!

We will be unlocking more perks as the campaign continues, but even $1 gets our Undying Thanks! (Really, a buck does make a difference).

NEW PERKS: A signed print copy and an audiobook copy of Tales From The Back Of The Bus by John Pivovarnick. "A wild concoction of Vonnegut and Lynch filtered through Mel Brooks, this is one rollicking existential ride through the ugly '80s world of Hollywood and publishing, and I've never read anything like it. Screwball and cosmic horror collide in Pivovarnick's absurd genre-bender that feels like watching Angel Heart and After Hours on a handful of psychoactives." -Thomas Pluck, author of Bad Boy Boogie and Life During Wartime

NEW PERK: A mug featuring the CG logo on one side and the site name on a tasteful green and yellow psychotronic hypnospiral on the other designed by Brian Kirby of Shelf Life Clothing Company!

NEW PERK: A one of a kind robot made by Edward Stafford! Look at how cute it is! Unbelievable. You won't receive the particular pictured robot, but you will receive one like it. It's a one of a kind robot that comes with a name and back story!

NEW PERK:  Choose any ebook from the catalog of the British Fantasy Award-winning publisher, Fox Spirit Books! Click through to look at their catalog, choose a book, and let us know which you have selected in the comments here or at @CulturalGutter on Twitter. Choose any ebook from the British Fantasy Award-winning Fox Spirit Books catalog! ANY of them! This includes anthologies containing short stories by the Gutter's own Carol: Weird Noir; Noir Carnival; Drag Noir; You Left Your Biscuit Behind; The Girl At The End Of The World, Vol. 1; Piercing The Vale; Things in the Dark; and, Respectable Horror!

NEW PERK: Print copies of Danie Ware's Children of Artifice, published by our friends at Fox Spirit Books! "Caphen Talmar is the high-born son of an elite family, descended from the Builders themselves, his artistic career ruined when his ex-lover broke his fingers. One night, gambling down at the wharfside – somewhere he shouldn’t have been in the first place – he meets Aden. An uncomplicated, rough-edged dockworker, Aden is everything Caph needs to forget the pressures of his father’s constant criticism. But this isn’t just another one-night stand. Aden is trying to find his sister, and he needs Caph’s help. Soon, they find themselves tangled in a deadly game of trust, lies and political rebellion."

NEW PERK: A shark drink cozy with optional laser you can put on its forehead knit by the Gutter's own Beth Watkins!

NEW PERK: Needle-felted Ratbatspider created by fiber artist and film writer Kerry Gately Fristoe!

NEW PERK:  Commission a song! A lucky contributor can have a song written and performed on the disreputable art topic of their choice by Julie Beman and Eric Bloomquist of Chica Non Grata. Provide the prompt and Chica Non Grata will write the song. Listen to the sweet ass songs previous contributors have commissioned at Nocturnal Commissions!

SOLD OUT: A print copy of Cocktails & Capers: Cult Films, Crime, Cocktails, and Cool by the Gutter's own Keith Allison! "Explore a world populated by masked marvels and murderous maniacs, venomous vamps and gentleman thieves, swingin' spies and cantankerous crooners. Cocktails & Capers collects essays covering cinematic, pop culture, true crime, and cocktail history, including: Sweet Smell of Success and the nightclubs of Swing Street; A.J. Raffles, gentleman thief; Louis Feuillade's Fantomas and Les Vampires; the history of the Martini; Diabolik, Kriminal, and the skeleton suit-clad maniacs of Italy and Turkey; James Bond, amari, negronis, and how Ian Fleming and Lucky Luciano saved the Allied invasion of Sicily; the history of masked Mexican wrestlers and the partnership of El Santo and Blue Demon; and the weird, wild world of the Rat Pack in the 1960s and how the grim, violent Matt Helm novels became slapstick spy spoofs starring Dean Martin. These are tales of mobsters, movie stars, masked men, torch singers, crooners, and hustlers -- with dozens of cocktail recipes and music suggestions that pair perfectly."

SOLD OUT: A Medusa Moleskine handprinted by the Gutter's own Carol!  A gray 3.5 x 5.5" pocket Moleskine with a green Medusa handprinted on the cover. Guaranteed 100% non-petrifying!

SOLD OUT: A physical copy of Meredith Lewis' new book, Ask For The Moon: Innovation at Shaw Brothers Studios! "In the 1960s Shaw Brothers Studios revolutionised martial arts filmmaking. Movie mogul Sir Run Run Shaw developed a way to churn out lavish blockbusters quickly and cheaply. An assembly line approach kept his filmmakers busy but access to an extraordinary pool of resources meant they could 'ask for the moon.' This book is a case study exploring how a brilliant, driven entrepreneur and his audaciously creative filmmakers conducted a bold experiment in business and movie-making innovation."

SOLD OUT: Tarot reading by the scholar, raconteur and author of Satan's Sorority, Kate Laity!

If we don't reach our goal, we'll use the funds to print and ship your perks and see how much we can pay each editor. If we exceed our goal, we would use the extra funds to print promotional materials or hire more guest star writers.

SOLD OUT: A digital copy of Dracula In Istanbul, aka, Turkish Dracula, edited by Neon Harbor's Ed Glaser. "For the first time in English comes a remarkable literary discovery. In 1928, Turkish author Ali Rıza Seyfioğlu pirated Bram Stoker’s Dracula, rewriting it with new material, patriotic overtones, and Islam. A rare example of a 'bootleg' novel, it’s also the first adaptation to plainly identify Dracula as the historical warlord Vlad the Impaler."

The Impact

We like to think that the Gutter offers something special: Clear-eyed, thoughtful and thought-provoking writing on disreputable art. If you donate or support the campaign by sharing, you will help keep the Gutter online and running; support our particular take on disreputable art; and help support paying writers for their work.

We ran a successful last fundraiser year, and, thanks to everyone's help, we kept going.  With your help, we can do it again. This year our biggest risk is our increased  hosting cost. We are looking around for a better and lower cost option that meets our particular needs to move the Gutter over to in 2019. The Cultural Gutter's survival does depend on Gutterthon and on you. We recognize that it's a difficult time for creators of all kinds, that platforms are valued more than content. But we believe with your help, we can keep the Gutter flowing with quality writing. 

We know that times are hard for a lot of people and any little bit helps, even a retweet or sharing our campaign on Facebook. Indiegogo has tools that make it easy. Please consider using them even if you can't contribute money. Anything you do to help is appreciated.

Thank you from all of us at The Cultural Gutter!

NEW PERK: A shark drink cozy with optional laser you can put on its forehead knit by the Gutter's own Beth Watkins!
NEW PERK: Needle-felted Ratbatspider created by fiber artist and film writer Kerry Gately Fristoe! 
NEW PERK:  Commission a song! A lucky contributor can have a song written and performed on the disreputable art topic of their choice by Julie Beman and Eric Bloomquist of Chica Non Grata. Provide the prompt and Chica Non Grata will write the song. Listen to the sweet ass songs previous contributors have commissioned at Nocturnal Commissions!
SOLD OUT: A print copy of Cocktails & Capers: Cult Films, Crime, Cocktails, and Cool by the Gutter's own Keith Allison! "Explore a world populated by masked marvels and murderous maniacs, venomous vamps and gentleman thieves, swingin' spies and cantankerous crooners. Cocktails & Capers collects essays covering cinematic, pop culture, true crime, and cocktail history, including: Sweet Smell of Success and the nightclubs of Swing Street; A.J. Raffles, gentleman thief; Louis Feuillade's Fantomas and Les Vampires; the history of the Martini; Diabolik, Kriminal, and the skeleton suit-clad maniacs of Italy and Turkey; James Bond, amari, negronis, and how Ian Fleming and Lucky Luciano saved the Allied invasion of Sicily; the history of masked Mexican wrestlers and the partnership of El Santo and Blue Demon; and the weird, wild world of the Rat Pack in the 1960s and how the grim, violent Matt Helm novels became slapstick spy spoofs starring Dean Martin. These are tales of mobsters, movie stars, masked men, torch singers, crooners, and hustlers -- with dozens of cocktail recipes and music suggestions that pair perfectly."
SOLD OUT: A Medusa Moleskine handprinted by the Gutter's own Carol!  A gray 3.5 x 5.5" pocket Moleskine with a green Medusa handprinted on the cover. Guaranteed 100% non-petrifying!
SOLD OUT: A physical copy of Meredith Lewis' new book, Ask For The Moon: Innovation at Shaw Brothers Studios! "In the 1960s Shaw Brothers Studios revolutionised martial arts filmmaking. Movie mogul Sir Run Run Shaw developed a way to churn out lavish blockbusters quickly and cheaply. An assembly line approach kept his filmmakers busy but access to an extraordinary pool of resources meant they could 'ask for the moon.' This book is a case study exploring how a brilliant, driven entrepreneur and his audaciously creative filmmakers conducted a bold experiment in business and movie-making innovation."
SOLD OUT: Tarot reading by the scholar, raconteur and author of Satan's Sorority, Kate Laity! 
If we don't reach our goal, we'll use the funds to print and ship your perks and see how much we can pay each editor. If we exceed our goal, we would use the extra funds to print promotional materials or hire more guest star writers.
SOLD OUT: A digital copy of Dracula In Istanbul, aka, Turkish Dracula, edited by Neon Harbor's Ed Glaser. "For the first time in English comes a remarkable literary discovery. In 1928, Turkish author Ali Rıza Seyfioğlu pirated Bram Stoker’s Dracula, rewriting it with new material, patriotic overtones, and Islam. A rare example of a 'bootleg' novel, it’s also the first adaptation to plainly identify Dracula as the historical warlord Vlad the Impaler."

The Impact
We like to think that the Gutter offers something special: Clear-eyed, thoughtful and thought-provoking writing on disreputable art. If you donate or support the campaign by sharing, you will help keep the Gutter online and running; support our particular take on disreputable art; and help support paying writers for their work.
We ran a successful last fundraiser year, and, thanks to everyone's help, we kept going.  With your help, we can do it again. This year our biggest risk is our increased  hosting cost. We are looking around for a better and lower cost option that meets our particular needs to move the Gutter over to in 2019. The Cultural Gutter's survival does depend on Gutterthon and on you. We recognize that it's a difficult time for creators of all kinds, that platforms are valued more than content. But we believe with your help, we can keep the Gutter flowing with quality writing. 
We know that times are hard for a lot of people and any little bit helps, even a retweet or sharing our campaign on Facebook. Indiegogo has tools that make it easy. Please consider using them even if you can't contribute money. Anything you do to help is appreciated.
Thank you from all of us at The Cultural Gutter!

Interview with The Korea Daily/중앙일보

My campaign shared on Indiegogo's official Twitter and Instagram pages.

Interview with streetwear collective Bodhi Parts (Part 1 / Part 2)

Interview with 24HR KPOP-TV

 

Story of My Book

K-Pop: The Odyssey is a fun, comprehensive look into K-Pop’s music, industry, and culture through the stories and insights from top experts and resources with a discussion of recent relevant themes. It will be balancing industry, academic, and fan perspectives to bring you a colorful array of viewpoints and topics.

My name is Wooseok Ki and I am the author of K-Pop: The Odyssey. I wrote this book because this is the most fascinating time to learn about K-Pop - it’s the biggest and most relevant it’s ever been on the global stage. K-Pop artists are making global headlines, social media platforms are filled with creative K-Pop content, fandoms are more diverse than ever before, and general public interest is growing exponentially. This isn’t an overnight sensation at all, but rather more of an odyssey - a long, eventful journey full of breakthroughs and setbacks. 

Despite the myriad of K-Pop content today, there’s just simply not enough books out there! The existing books on K-Pop are either theory-driven, artist-specific, or outdated - so how and where should one look to get started and more knowledgeable about K-Pop as a whole phenomenon? As a fan myself, I wanted to create a comprehensive approach while opining on recent topics including Asian representation in Western media, fandoms’ collective social action, musical experimentation over the years, importance of online technology and community platforms, and more. As a Korean-American, I also hope to share my thoughts and experiences engaging with K-Pop in both South Korea and the US to provide a more balanced perspective on the global phenomenon.

In this book, you'll explore direct accounts and interesting discussions from a diverse panel of experts and resources that I've interviewed:

  • The Star - From K-pop idol to international star, how does the star bring inspirations to life? How are talents and visions manifested through the company-artist relationship?
  • The Executive Producer - How is potential rookie talent developed into a full-fledged R&B artist like DEAN?
  • The Songwriter - How are hit K-Pop songs behind top acts like BTS and EXO made?
  • The Business Executive - How were top K-Pop acts like BIGBANG and CL marketed to a global audience?
  • The Content Creator - What drives K-Pop fans’ passion, and what content and platforms are the future?
  • The Trainee - What goes on during the life of a trainee en route to debuting as a K-Pop idol?
  • The Recruiter - How are K-Pop trainees recruited and managed at a major entertainment company?
  • The Journalist - How is K-Pop to be portrayed to a general audience that is unfamiliar?
  • The Academia - How should we approach K-Pop under larger themes of Westernization, fandoms, and history?
  • The Fan - What role does the fan play in relation to the K-Pop artist, the global phenomenon, and the fandom communities?

 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that K-Pop is much more than just ‘popular music from South Korea’. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for K-Pop in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a gateway - the amount of K-Pop content today is endless, and all you need to do is explore. My book will help you learn, recognize, and engage with the most important topics surrounding K-Pop before and as you dive into the movement.

You will love this book if you’re curious about what exactly K-Pop is and didn’t know where to properly look, or are an experienced fan seeking detailed insights into the phenomenon as well as brain-teaser topics relevant to larger societal themes. If you love reading about music, technology, business strategies, or social issues, there will be something for you to enjoy in this book. Even if you have absolutely no idea what K-Pop is and are on the fence about buying this book, I guarantee I will provide you with either knowledge or leisure (or both!) in a fun-to-read manner by the end. I promise!

 

The Book - K-Pop: The Odyssey

The book is written in 4 Parts:

Part 1 contains an exploration into the never-ending question “What is K-Pop?” as well as bigger themes in Globalization and Online Technology. It’ll be setting the main framework on how K-Pop is perceived and defined as well as how K-Pop “got here”. It will discuss the evolution of K-Pop’s global trajectory including Asian success via the Hallyu Wave, US debut projects, Gangnam Style, to BTS today. You’ll be thinking critically about the importance of social media and interconnectedness, as well as technological developments amidst the 2020 coronavirus pandemic.

Part 2 includes a deeper dive into how K-Pop is produced and exported worldwide. It explores the successful K-Pop idol system in greater detail while positing challenges that Korean society faces as a whole. Further, through a series of expert interviews, it will explore how music and talent are produced and promoted around the world.

Part 3 focuses exclusively on K-Pop’s fandom culture. It will be invoking academic resources and recent collective sociopolitical action to provide a detailed overview on the diversity, unity, and ubiquity of K-Pop fandoms. It will illustrate the importance of fandoms to the overall K-Pop phenomenon, as well as address increasing misconceptions due to the fandoms’ prominence.

Part 4 will conclude the book with a discussion of where K-Pop goes from here, in terms of the remaining milestones and challenges to overcome including Asian representation and portrayals in Western media, recent industry strategies, and domestic developments in South Korea.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter!

 

✅  When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book ($5,000), I will publish. 

✅  When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book ($6,000), I will also publish a hardcover edition.

✅  When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book ($8,000+), I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook!

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and:
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a special separate section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • More to come!

 

About the Author

Wooseok Ki is a J.D. Candidate at University of Pennsylvania Law School, with career interests in corporate transactions and intellectual property. He was born in Seoul, South Korea, has lived in various cities across the U.S. and Hong Kong, and has avid interests in entertainment and technology.

As a Korean-American who aspires to bridge the gap between Korea and the U.S. ultimately through entertainment and the law, Wooseok is very passionate about Asian representation in media especially in the music industry. He is fascinated to see that the Korean music and pop culture he was born into is now being celebrated all over the world, and believes it’s only upwards from here. However, he’s also aware that there are many challenges to be overcome.

Wooseok wrote this book because he wants to contribute further to the larger movement of uplifting Asian and AAPI talent and professionals on a global scale. As a longtime K-Pop fan, former competitive dancer, content creator, and future attorney, Wooseok would love to bring the most knowledgeable voices and resources together to deliver a book that will push it to the next level. His experiences from directing a K-Pop dance team, marketing K-Pop concerts at a startup, to working at YouTube analyzing copyright issues and interning this Fall at the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) are only pieces of the puzzle. Wooseok believes that through a fun, comprehensive book on K-Pop, he can better contribute to a bigger picture goal of informing and elevating Korean pop culture to newer heights.

In his free time, Wooseok enjoys streaming the hottest K-pop/hip-hop/EDM tracks, training Brazilian Jiujitsu and boxing, weightlifting, dancing somewhere, playing PS4, and reminiscing about life before coronavirus.

For more information you can connect with Wooseok at wski810@gmail.com, on LinkedIn, @wooskiworks / @kpop.odyssey on Instagram, and @wooskiworks on Twitter.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #KpopOdyssey and tag @kpop.odyssey as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Wooseok Ki

story:
Short Summary

Near the end of 2017, I started working at a conservative megachurch. I had already deconstructed my doctrinal ties to evangelical Christianity, so I was definitely concerned that working there would be problematic for me. What I found was that basically everyone there was decent and well-intentioned. That wasn't a big surprise or anything, but it helped me realize that my problems weren't with the heart of Christianity, but rather, the structure of the Church. This led me to analyzing power structures at large, and I became acutely aware of how group dynamics bred in these systems - be it government, workplace, family, etc. - change how we interact with other people, often for the worse. In my frustration with this concept, I wrote songs. I noticed that these songs carried over a lot of similar themes, keys, and melodies. Then I noticed that characters and plot could be derived from these songs. So even though the album is not yet finished (and probably never will be), a grander story rose out of that process. That story is Ecclesia's Table - a character-driven novel that certainly borrows from the religious themes and metaphors of my upbringing, but is more concerned with the general notion of how we as people allow systems of injustice to persist. Come travel to another world with me in order to see ours more clearly.

The world is a wasteland. It always has been. Moshe, Amaru, and Reenu have never known anything other than the desert that raised them. When the rumor arises that something other than barren landscape could be out there, the three of them make haste for an abundant future. Upon arrival at this established society, the group quickly learns how and how not to get along amidst group dynamics and seemingly sinister mystery. The trials and social politics that Moshe, Amaru, and Reenu face teach them that some rules are useful and some are meant to be broken. Have a seat at Ecclesia’s Table.

Risks & Challenges

Logistically, I don't see many challenges in making this project happen! The book and the rewards have all been finished, it's all a matter of printing and shipping once we reach our goal. Everything is set up and ready to go!

I acknowledge that the content itself is risky. There are somewhat controversial moments and ideas presented in this book, and I'm sure that many Christians will take this as an attack rather than constructive criticism. That makes finding the audience for this story difficult (as many literary agents have told me), so all funds acquired here will go into covering costs for production, the rewards, and making this story widely accessible!

story:
If you're here, you probably already know what this is.

Yes, this is the Background Pony print. There are many people that have expressed interest in it. Many have participated and obtained it during the first run. Others haven't due to a variety of reasons, yet still want to, and I am ready to provide it for them. As gathering funds has become somewhat of a challenge, I am opening a campaign where you can fund the printing yourself.

The end goal is the minimum for the print to go through, as it has been negotiated with the publisher. You can contribute after it is met, no problem.

What's New

Exclusiely for this run, the book has been submitted to over 150 hours of meticulous manual proofreading. Numerous layouting and typesetting errors discovered after the commencing of the last year's release have also been fixed.

Short Summary

The book will be cloth-bound (Savanna 5170 and 5601), with cover elements embossed on it in silver. It is split in two tomes of 550 pages each, set on 60x90 1/16 (220x150 mm) 80g paper. Due to high cost of color printing required by the story, a B&W version will also be available, with colored elements replaced by equivalent typesetted representations.

The colored version will also include a disc containing PDF and e-book versions of the story, assets used during production, and several other extras.

(case and DAC not included due to postal limitations)

What We Need & What You Get

By contributing according the perks on the right, you'll get the book you want to get. Everything is already included: shipping, handling, and extra care.

(suggested method of extra care)

 

Risks & Challenges

I live in Russia. We love books here, and that's why I've started this in first place. But, as Russia is currently not at best terms with the rest of the world, a lot of organization-related things have been very hard to make right. Right now, I hope that we'll be able to make it. Don't worry, there will be no issues with shipping.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't want the book yourself, maybe you know someone else who does! Please share information about this campaign with anyone who will love a great read to accompany them into the new year. Together, we will accomplish anything.

story:
Do you believe in the power of poetry and art to bring positive changes in the world? 

The World Poetry Reading Series Society is hosting the Fourth World Poetry Canada International Peace Festival, to create a space for sharing words and art about peace. Help support our event and contribute to a more peaceful world! 

What is the World Poetry Peace Festival

The Fourth World Poetry Canada International Peace Festival will provide a space for writers, artists, and filmmakers from different backgrounds to share their art with each other and the public. By having diverse voices share their perspectives on and visions of peace, we hope to strengthen cultural bonds and build a more harmonious future. 

Taking place throughout Vancouver in October 2014, the festival will feature poetry displays, readings, books launches, film screenings, and awards for those who have contributed to peace and human rights. It will include our community partners and participants from different countries, such as Japan, India, Afghanistan, Ghana, Gambia, Nigeria, the USA and Canada. 


The Festival Events

  • World Poetry Display at the Irving K. Barber Learning Centre, the University of British Columbia, Vancouver. (October 6th-26th)
  • Festival Reading and Display Opening  at World Poetry Vancouver, Britannia Community Library, Vancouver. (October 11, 1-3 pm)
  • Grand Opening, including readings, launches, and award presentations at the Harbour Centre, Simon Fraser University. (October 19, 1:30-4:30 pm)
  • Dinner and Social Time, location TBA. (October 19, 7-9 pm)
  • World Poetry Peace Poetathon Grand Celebration. World Poetry Night Out celebrates 5 years! New Westminster Public  Library. (October 22, 6:30-8:30 pm)
  • Closing: World Poetry Film Festival, presenting films on peace and human rights. The worldwide launch of the WP Literary Journal. (October 25, 10am-10 pm.)

What is World Poetry

World Poetry is an unique international network that provides a space for poets, writers, and artists from different cultures to share work in their own perspective and mother tongue. Founded 15 years ago, we strive to spread respect, honor, support, peace, and love for all through the arts and education. Our youngest contributor is 12 and our oldest is 100. Our participants have diverse cultural, linguistic, and religious backgrounds, and all come together to create peace. 

What We Need & Why We Need Your Help 

It costs $6000 to host the festival, pay venue housekeeping costs, printing costs, marketing posters, display costs, website costs, give awards to nominated artists, host a dinner for our international guests, and pay for the AV equipment.

We have great in-kind community partners but are operating on no budget. Please make a contribution to help us cover the cost of our festival!  

If we are lucky enough to have extra funds, we will use it to launch the World Poetry International Literary Journal, which will be run by youth. 

Perks for Our Contributors

When you make a contribution, you're helping to create peace and joining in the efforts of people worldwide.

Depending on level of contribution, perks include:

  • A World Poetry Special Certificate of Participation. 
  • A personalized poem written especially for you and suitable for framing.
  • A World Poetry t-shirt or cap. 
  • Your name mentioned on our website and in the program guide as a sponsor.
  • Your name featured as a sponsor for a film.
  • Your name in our sponsor's Hall of Fame.
For more details, see the perks sidebar.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, please try to help us in other ways: 

  • Tell others about our campaign and encourage them to contribute
  • Please share using social media: Facebook, Twitter, blogging, etc.
  • Ask companies, organizations, and groups to consider sponsoring us

The Impact

Why are we focusing on peace?

We are living in a world with too much violence and war. Our brains are not hard-wire for peace, but peace can be achieved through practice and community building. As poets, writers, musicians, dancers, and artists, we want to use our combined creative powers to create peace.

How will it help the world?

Throughout the festival, artists and attendees will be exposed to poems, drawings, dances, and art about peace. We'll share thoughts and ideas of peace with each participant, who will then spread it further.

Imagine a world with less conflict, crime, domestic violence, greed, and jealousy. A world with fewer quests for power and more understanding.

How will it help me? 

You'll be contributing to a better, more peaceful world and future for yourself and everyone around you. You'll feel more peaceful and happy, knowing that you've made a difference. Plus, you will receive our awesome perks! 

Where the funds will go if we do not reach our goal?

The first $500, as well as 5% of the donations, will go towards paying our contracted videographer, Then the rest will go to pay for event costs, the venue, awards, and other expenses.

    Risks & Challenges

    After running the World Poetry Peace Festival for three years, we have a lot of experience running the event. The challenges we have faced include securing venues, finding volunteers, and ensuring the events go smoothly as planned. Our greatest challenge has been financial, as the costs of the festival and society had to be covered out-of-pocket in the past. 

    However, despite these challenges, we are very determined to achieve the vision of peace and support the work of artists from around the world. We have already successfully secured venues for our events, and we'll do the best we can to plan a good festival. We have been lucky to have so much support from members and numerous community partners who have provided in-kind support. 

    Thank you very much for your support and contribution.

story:
Who we are:

  • Joe Paumi has worked in advertising his entire career. As a former Chief Executive Creative Director of one of the world’s largest Advertising Agencies, Joe has created brand identities for some of today’s most popular drugs both here and abroad. Joe has won more than 100 awards internationally for his design and product branding. 
  • Rob Taub has enjoyed an eclectic career in broadcasting and journalism.  A weekly contributor to the Huffington Post, Rob appears regularly on Sirius XM Radio discussing sports, politics and culture. He was the host of Tech Hub on WOR Radio and is also the Weatherman on the Onion News Network. Rob has written, produced and appeared on numerous award winning television shows. 

Our campaign:

  • Middle Age Crisis already exists as a destination website for men over 40 years old.  We want to expand and bundle it as a brand by creating a unique one hour radio program representing this important demographic group which is too often ignored and should never be forgotten.  Most talk radio is angry and polarizing while Middle Age Crisis is funny, informative and always positive!
  •  Contributors will be responsible for literally launching our radio show by enabling us to buy a one hour weekly time slot on WOR Radio 710 (Sunday 10 - 11pm est.) that guarantees us three months on the air.  This will also include web simulcasts and archived podcasts.  During this period we will build our audience numbers and sign on advertisers, who will ultimately finance the show.  WOR was founded in 1922 and is one of the most respected news and talk radio stations in America. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise twenty seven thousand five hundred dollars, the exact cost of buying the allotted time from the radio station. As a contributor you will help launch a first of its kind radio show that is both funny and informative, discussing everything from hair loss to heartburn as well as bourbon to baseball.  

    If we don't reach our entire financial  goal we will move forward with one of the following options:
        1. A 30 minute time slot on WOR Radio.  Costs vary with program length and time periods.
        2. A weekly podcast from a popular New York City restaurant.  Budget will cover equipment and engineering costs. 
          Your contributions will rapidly accelerate the creation of a professional radio program -- from website to broadcast in just two months!  Rob & Joe have more than 60 years of combined media experience, and will draw on a deep well of contacts to bring the highest caliber guests from every field to the program.

          Our mission is to create something special for people over 40 years old (and anyone else with a sense of humor) as we aren't getting any younger.  Let's move forward together!

Veronica Lake a native of Arkansas now resides in California with her Family.She's spent over 16 years in Early Childhood Education. Children has been her greatest inspiration. Eric Carle is one of her favorite Children Books Authors of all time. "The Very Lonely Fire Fly" inspired her to write and create "Polly The Mosquito" Her ideal goal is to reach as many Children and touch their lives through adventure and fun. While creating insects, animals, and nature, it gives their little minds a whole new release on learning. Your contribution will be greatly appreciated and will render to such a great cause for the lives of so many children. She would also love to have the book series interpreted in other languages, including Spanish,German,Porteguese,Swahalie, and much more. She's also going to have them in Audio as well. story:
Join author, historian, and serious cook Hanne Blank in the kitchen for a brand new, exciting subscription-only project, A Girl’s Gotta Eat.

A Girl’s Gotta Eat is a brand new kind of cookbook.  

It's 13 months of seasonal, delicious recipes, each accompanied by a story, essay, bit of memoir – maybe even a rant or two – that arrive right in your email inbox.

From July 2013 to August 2014, it’ll be like having your foodie writer friend show up at your house once a month to tell you stories about this thing she’s been cooking, while she shows you how to make it yourself.  For everyone who misses the food posts from Hanne's old blogs… here’s your solution!

 

What kind of recipes will be in A Girl’s Gotta Eat? 

Oh, you know... just some of the recipes Hanne’s relied on to help her beat a Type II diabetes diagnosis… win a cookie competition… run an underground pop-up restaurant selling locavore dim sum… make traditional homemade liqueurs… and earn the title “best restaurant in Baltimore” from her houseguests. 

Dazzling homemade preserves?  You got it.  Main dishes that satisfy and impress but don't take all day or cost the earth?  But of course.  Desserts so good they’ll make you want to slap your mama?  Do you even have to ask? 

Whether you’re a vegan, a vegetarian, or an omnivore, you’ll find things to love in Hanne Blank’s kitchen.  Vegan substitutions, and replacements for common allergens will be given wherever they seem realistic.

As a bonus, each issue will also include helpful tips and a short description of a particularly cool food or food-related item Hanne’s really excited about at the time each issue goes to press, with info on where to get it and what to do with it once you do.

A Girl’s Gotta Eat issues will be available in PDF and/or EPUB format.

 

For as little as $5 you can get a taste of A Girl’s Gotta Eat, with full 13-month subscriptions starting at just $25. 

 At higher subscription levels there are special bonuses: production credits, dedications, audio, video, birthday goodies, even a dinner party!

 

C’mon over and hang out in Hanne Blank’s kitchen.  After all, A Girl’s Gotta Eat.

story:
<><>[UPDATE: we did it!!!! We have reached our initial goal!!! Thank you so much everyone! Every additional dollar is going straight to Asista to help other people like me get matched with their very own service dog.]
There are no words to adequately express my gratitude at the outpouring of support I've had since the launch of this campaign. When I started this journey, I had no idea how many lives I would touch in trying to save mine. I've met some incredible people who have already helped change the way I see my future. I am moved to tears at the kindness demonstrated by everyone involved, including all who have donated, and everyone who has shared this story. This opportunity has been humbling, educational and the most moving experience I've been privileged to be a part of.  
Asista Staff are talented, dedicated, caring and in need of as much help as possible! I'm going to continue the campaign till Christmas so we can keep the momentum going for Asista. There are many other people in my situation that Asista will be able to help... Please consider this and continue to spread the word and generosity! <><>

I need your help getting a Service Dog for my PTSD

My name is Craig and I have been diagnosed with severe PTSD but can't afford the treatment that had been prescribed for me.

The use of a Service Dog will help me manage my flashbacks & night terrors, allow me to function day by day by helping me manage my anxiety and the issues that have come about from that, helping me enter crowded public spaces without being hyper vigilant of my surroundings.

I am a very proud individual. It pains me to have to admit it but I need help. I had a massive Pulmonary Embolism October 2012 that should have killed me. I had another PE this past Aug 2014 (not as severe as in 2012). Two years ago I was diagnosed with severe PTSD. I've been prescribed a Service Dog as a form of short/long term treatment. Since then I have found an organization that accepted me and matched me up with a 4 legged life saver named Joey. Joey is a 2 1/2 year old pure bred Black Lab who himself is a cancer survivor. Joey was a rescue and has the drive that makes him exactly what is needed to be a Service Dog. When he is not working he likes to relax by frolicking and playing in the snow.

I have been on medical leave (with a huge cut in income) and financially don't have the funds for the change in ownership of Joey. It takes a lot to swallow my pride and ask for help. My life will improve dramatically with Joey in it. Being able to afford his adoption would be the greatest Christmas gift of my life!!

You can have/suffer from PTSD even if you are not a solider, you could be a nurse, parametric, police officer, firefighter, average run-of-the-mill person, woman that had a miscarriage, or a guy who works at your local electronics store. They *ALL* can have PTSD, it's not just a military issue.

The funds I need to come-up with is a fraction of the cost that has gone into training Joey. Anything over the funds raised will be used to further help people living with PTSD by a donation to the organization that supplied Joey to me.

Thank you for reading, for your support, and for sharing this campaign with your family and friends. PTSD really can affect anyone. Please spread the word!

-(All funds received will go towards acquisition of a PTSD Service Dog.)-
