story:
"Changing Season" book + Storytelling Tour

Hi!  We (David Mas & Nikiko) are a father-daughter team at the Masumoto Family Farm who work together every day. We grow organic peaches, nectarines, and grapes for raisins on a small farm in the Central Valley of California. Working the land together as a family is....everything to us. No really, everything: it's moving, hilarious, frustrating, tender, contemplative, and full of love.

We believe that stories are most powerful when they are shared.

We have written a new manuscript, "Changing Season," and it's ready for printing, but we need your help to make it a real book and send us on a California Storytelling Tour! 

The New Book:
"Changing Season" is a compilation of essays that capture the questions and ruminations of two farmers in transition: a young farmer learning from her mentor/dad, and her father who was once a young farmer too, now considering what it means to pass something on. The essays span humor and drama, everything from "The Art of Pruning" to "Old Shovels, Old Friends" and "Feminist Farming." We found a perfect partner to help these stories become public: Heyday Books.

Our Partner:

Heyday Books is an independent non-profit press that is dedicated to publishing projects that celebrate "California's many cultures, languages, and boundary-breaking ideas." They believe in the beauty of California literature and the importance of publishing work aligned in these values. We love Heyday!

This is where you come in....

We're searching for people who want to hear these stories!  We need your help.

Our fundraising goal of $7,500 will cover:

  • the final publishing costs of transforming our manuscript into a beautiful paperback book AND
  • provide travel funds for Nikiko and Mas to organize a California Storytelling Tour (pending the campaign, slated for fall 2016).
Because Heyday is a nonprofit publisher, all of your donations are tax-deductible and will go directly to fund the production costs of the book and the storytelling tour.


More about the California Storytelling Tour:

On the "Changing Season" California Storytelling Tour, Mas and Nikiko will get to read from the book and engage in deep conversations with people around the state. We hope to shine a light on issues of succession and transition between generations and use the framework of storytelling to invite others to reflect on their lives and legacies.


Your contribution will get us to the finish line and launch our storytelling tour. In return, you'll get our infinite gratitude and some fun perks as well. With your help, we know we can do this!  These stories are meaningful and unique; there's not many father-daughter family farm teams these days...and hopefully this book and storytelling tour will help inspire a path for others.


More about Mas & Nikiko

Mas has been writing about farming and food for decades, capturing the serene moments of farm work like the "Lizard Dance" and documenting the family story of immigration, surviving World War II concentration camps, and forging a bond with the land and the Central Valley. He's served on National Council for the Arts (National Endowment for the Arts Board), has been an Irvine Foundation board member, and was former chair of California Council for the Humanities.



Nikiko is an emerging writer and storyteller, and calls herself an "agrarian artist." Her work has echoed the themes of cultural heritage, collective memory, and a search for justice. Her dreams have filled her imagination with poetry and stories about a world full of better farming and better food. You can see some of her ideas on stage in her TEDx talk from 2015 or at the BCFN Youth Manifesto symposium in Italy from 2015 or her one-woman show from 2011. Currently, she's a Creative Community Fellow with National Arts Strategies. She's also a proud board member of the Alliance for California Traditional Arts and Western States Arts Federation, and she serves on the College of Arts & Humanities Advisory Board at California State University, Fresno.

Why now?

In 2015, we were touched by audience responses to an independent documentary film that chronicled a year of our lives titled "Changing Season: On the Masumoto Family Farm." We traveled with the film to festivals and special screenings across the country, and even internationally. 


Without fail, at every screening we shared tears and laughter with audiences. It was clear to us that there is a hunger for the stories that reflect passion for family, farming, and the land.

We were inspired by all those exchanges with people who said "Thank you" and "Keep up the good work." We realized we wanted to create another vehicle for sharing these stories: a companion book.

As the overall farming population ages (the average age of the American farmer is close to 60), the themes and generational stories in this book are even more relevant.

Other ways to help:

Please share this campaign with anyone and everyone! Helping us spread the word is an incredible gift. Thanks!

story:
"THE MAGICAL LOVE GARDEN"

Welcome to our project page and thank you for your time. 

100% of your contribution will go towards the production.

Summary:

Our project is the production of a children’s book entitled “ The Magical Love Garden ".

This book is a supportive tool for children in their journey throughout childhood.  The book also serves parents in providing them with a common language when talking to their children about feelings and emotions.

The purpose of the book is to teach children to recognize and distinguish pleasant and unpleasant feelings inside of themselves and address these feelings free of guilt or shame. We aim to show children that it is acceptable to feel all feelings, to cry or be angry, while at the same time knowing how to release these emotions without hurting others.  We use the metaphor of a magical garden and elements in nature that correspond to how our mind and emotions work.  The book emphasizes that the remedy for any conflict or frustration is patience, forgiveness and love.

 Although this is a children’s story, it gives people of all ages something to think about.

About Us:

My name is Ohad  Amidor and for the past 10 years  I have been engaged in psycho-therapeutic and spiritual work which has helped me a great deal in understanding myself and helping others with their journey.  My girlfriend, Alexis Kohn, holds degrees in art and social work and has worked in the field with children.

We are both students of Sri Prem Baba, a humanitarian and spiritual master teacher.  His teachings touch the innermost core of our being and inspire us to share these messages and love with the world.

We strongly feel the importance of introducing from a young age the concepts in our book.  The intention of this book is to help the new generation know their true nature, which is selflessness and love.

The Project So Far:

The book thus far has only been written in Hebrew. 

The beautiful illustrations, made by the talented Tara Joy, are completed and ready to be inserted into the English version of the book.

We feel that the book will be able to globally reach a wider audience of children if it is translated and published in the English language.

Our Plan:

Our project has been set for 45 days, though we will be happy to start even earlier.         We have split our production into three stages: translating/editing, graphic design/layout, and printing. As soon as the funds are raised to begin part one, we will start our project.

In the final stage of printing, we intend to print 750 books and of course if we are blessed with more funds we will be able to print more copies, which will be lovely!

We promise to keep you close to our project by updating you each step of the way via our projects page.

 What You Will Get :

Any contribution helps. Every journey starts with one step.

For newborn steps we will show our gratitude with an Ecard of thanks created from one of the illustrations in the book. 

For children steps you will receive “The Magical Love Garden” EBook.

For teenage steps we will start using the post office and thank you with a hardcover copy of “The Magical Love Garden”, signed with thanks.

For adult steps you will receive a hardcover copy of the book plus a printed illustration of your choice from the book.

For mid-life steps you will receive a hardcover copy and one printed illustration of your choice. We will also be delighted to send you a copy of Sri Prem Baba's book, "From Suffering to Joy".

For golden steps you or one of your loved ones will be the name of a character in the book. Please send us 4 names of your choice and we will select one of them for a character in the book.  You will also receive a signed copy of “The Magical Love Garden" as well as a copy of Sri Prem Baba's book, "From Suffering to Joy".

For an immortal step you will be immortally remembered in our book by having your name credited in the final version, send you a hardcover copy of the book, a copy of Sri Prem Baba's book, "From Suffering to Joy" and another sweet surprise involving the illustrations in our book.

On the right hand side of our page you can find the full list of contribution amounts and corresponding gifts.


FAQ

1) Do you ship outside the USA or Canada?

Yes we do! If your gift requires shipment, we would appreciate if you would add $5 to help us cover the shipping costs.

2) When will I get my reward?

We will send you the EBook as soon as the layout work is done.

If your gift includes a copy of the hardcover book, it will be sent to you as soon as we it will be printed.

Can we ask for one last thing?

If you like our project and will be kind enough to share our vision with others (word of mouth or of course via the internet with Facebook, twitter etc.) we would be most grateful. 

We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for showing interest and helping us manifest “The Magical Love Garden” into creation.

Aloha and Namaste

story:
Hello Folks!

   My name is Joshua Lerman. I am a writer living in Santa Cruz, California. After four years of brow crinkling labor I have finally finished my first novel. I am elated to be done with this work and to be able to share it with the world. I believe there is merit to both the writing and how the subject matter is handled. But of course, I'm biased. Here is what the back of the book says. It's an excerpt and a short summary.

“I was awake when the sun rose, floating not on a bed of cotton and coils, but a bed of ecstasy, and in that moment I knew what the poets know and what the birds of dawn know: that the rising of the sun is a majestic and cosmic gesture, beyond what the human mind can possibly comprehend. I can tell you that it is futile to try. It only gets one all tangled up. But I suppose the mind is relentless like a little dog pulling on its bone, giving a guttural growl as you try to take the bone away, needing, just needing to hang on to some conceptual understanding. The sanctified reality of life itself exists like a humming ocean unknown, below the dense smoky layer of ordinary perception. Lovers and poets penetrate it at times.”  


Mimi Rizner resides at a psychiatric hospital navigating relationships with colorful patients, villainous nurses, and her own mind, but all she wants is her freedom. She recalls her childhood, living out of the family's camper van, Bertha, her turbulent youth, love found and lost and the precarious months just before being admitted to the hospital. The Sound of Birds is a story about the human mind, the cross-roads of the mystical and madness, belonging and healing.   


If there is merit to this work...

   I would like to see it be successful and reach people. I am raising funds necessary to help with the marketing of this book. Basically what I am looking to fund is:

  • A Kirkus review. This unbiased review will cost close to $600, but a good review would surely lead me on the path of success, namely by gaining a wider audience and possibly getting the attention of publishers or agents.
  • Business cards, post cards and other materials to help me get the word out.
  • A professional website. I will need assistance to have the type of website I am hoping to build and maintain for all my writing.

Any Assistance appreciated.

A few bucks from a lot of people will go a long way. I have put countless hours into this project and truly believe it is good writing and good story telling. Look up my name on Amazon and look it over. Read it. Its pretty short! And if you think it's of substance and benefit, make a donation! 

      Gratitude for considering! May your day be full of beauty and wonder.

story:
My name is Monica Marie Jones and I am an author and motivator. I've made it my personal mission to help writers with education, resources and opportunites to start, continue and grow their writing careers. As a result I am hosting and facilitating the first annual Inspiration Ink Summer Writers Retreat.

By contributing to this campaign you will provide two scholarships for deserving writers. Not only will they be able to work on thier literary project in a serene and inspiring setting among like minds, but your contribution will also allow them to recieve three writing workshops, meals, lodging, and a professional photo shoot to help promote their book and career. Scholarship winners will also recieve support with transportation as well as resources and materials to supplement their experience.

 

Here is the break down of the retreat and my background:
 

The Inspiration Ink

Summer Writers Retreat

Friday July 19th- Sunday July 21st 2013

Walden Woods Resort and Conference Center

2975 Old US Highway 23  Hartland, MI 48855
www.waldenwoods.com

 

An intimate gathering of poets, novelists, journalists, playwrights, songwriters and aspiring and established literary artists of all genres in a serene and inspiring setting. Come with a vision and leave with a completed project or plan.

 

$370.24 Per Person

 

Registration Fee Includes:

  • Lodging for two nights (Friday and Saturday Night)
  • Welcome Reception on Friday (Gourmet Appetizers and Drinks upon Arrival)
  • Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner on Saturday
  • Breakfast on Sunday
  • Swag Bags (Filled with all types of goodies for writers)
  • 3 Writers Workshops (Poetry, Planning Your Project, and Intro to Self-Publishing)
  • Professional Photo-shoot including author head shot (Friday Evening)


Schedule Overview

Friday

  • 4:00 pm Arrival/Check In/Photo Shoot Sessions
  • 6:00 pm Welcome Reception
  •              Gourmet Appetizers and Drinks
  •              Community Building Activities                 
  • 7:00 pm Workshop: Planning Your Project
  • 8:00 pm Night Write!

 

Saturday

  • 6:00 am Morning Muse (Optional)
  •              Prayer/Meditation/Nature Walk
  • 8:00 am Breakfast/Goal Setting
  • 9:00 am Write Time!
  • 12:00 pm Lunch/Sharing Time
  • 1:00 pm Workshop: Poetry
  • 2:00 pm Write Time!
  • 5:00 pm Dinner and Sharing
  • 6:00 pm Open Mic Jam Session
  • 8:00 pm Bonfire
  • 10:00 pm Late Night Write

 

Sunday

  • 6:00 am Morning Muse (Optional)
  •              Prayer/Meditation/Nature Walk
  • 8:00 am Breakfast and Sharing
  • 9:00 am Workshop: Intro to Self-Publishing
  • 10:00 am Full Group Reflection/Next Steps

 

 

Check and Money Order Payments can be mailed and made payable to:

Literary Loft LLC
P.O. Box 441134
Detroit, MI 48244

This retreat will be hosted and facilitated by Author, Publisher and Motivator,

Monica Marie Jones, MSW...

 



Monica Marie Jones

Bio



Monica Marie Jones is an author whose published works include The Ups and Downs of Being Round (Fiction/Self-Help), Taste My Soul (Poetry), FLOSS (Fiction), Swag (Urban Fiction), Sweet Soliloquy (Poetry), Monday Morning Motivation (Inspiration) and Momentum (Financial Freedom and Business Inspiration). She is a contributing author in Chicken Soup for the Girls Soul, New Directions for Youth Development, 44th (A full color coffee table book about President Barack Obama) and Souls of Our Young Sisters: The Next Generation of Women Tell Their Stories, Overcome Their Challenges, and Heal Their Spirits. She has also contributed to several publications and youth development training materials for the High/Scope Educational Research Foundation and the David P. Weikart Center for Youth Program Quality.

She has worked as a columnist and freelance writer for various publications and websites including the Michigan Front Page Newspaper and is an active member of the Motown Writer's Network where she hosted her own radio show, “Marketing and Motivation Mondays with Monica Marie Jones” on the Michigan Literary Network Radio.

Monica received her Bachelor’s Degree and teaching certificate in Elementary Education from Eastern Michigan University. She also received her Masters of Social Work from the University of Michigan.

Monica is a youth development expert that does training and consultation for the David P. Weikart Center for Youth Program Quality.

She is a professionally trained dancer and dance instructor that has danced with Gospel recording artists such as Dorinda Clark-Cole, in several venues around the United States, and a three-city tour in Japan with Kierra 'Ki-Ki' Sheard.

Monica uses her gifts, talents and expertise to inform her work as a motivational speaker with a focus on topics including but not limited to self-esteem, empowering women and girls, fitness and wellness, and youth development.

She is the owner of the publishing and literary consulting company, The Literary Loft; the motivational speaking, training and consulting company, Inspirationista Ink; and a partner in ownership of the real estate investment company, Team JP Enterprises LLC.

For more information visit her website at www.monicamariejones.com

She is a contributing author in Chicken Soup for the Girls Soul, New Directions for Youth Development, 44th (A full color coffee table book about President Barack Obama) and Souls of Our Young Sisters: The Next Generation of Women Tell Their Stories, Overcome Their Challenges, and Heal Their Spirits. She has also contributed to several publications and youth development training materials for the High/Scope Educational Research Foundation and the David P. Weikart Center for Youth Program Quality.  She has worked as a columnist and freelance writer for various publications and websites including the Michigan Front Page Newspaper and is an active member of the Motown Writer's Network where she hosted her own radio show, “Marketing and Motivation Mondays with Monica Marie Jones” on the Michigan Literary Network Radio. Monica received her Bachelor’s Degree and teaching certificate in Elementary Education from Eastern Michigan University. She also received her Masters of Social Work from the University of Michigan. Monica is a youth development expert that does training and consultation for the David P. Weikart Center for Youth Program Quality. She is a professionally trained dancer and dance instructor that has danced with Gospel recording artists such as Dorinda Clark-Cole, in several venues around the United States, and a three-city tour in Japan with Kierra 'Ki-Ki' Sheard. Monica uses her gifts, talents and expertise to inform her work as a motivational speaker with a focus on topics including but not limited to self-esteem, empowering women and girls, fitness and wellness, and youth development.  She is the owner of the publishing and literary consulting company, The Literary Loft; the motivational speaking, training and consulting company, Inspirationista Ink; and a partner in ownership of the real estate investment company, Team JP Enterprises LLC. For more information visit her website at www.monicamariejones.com

story:
About the book

My Skin Colour, My Media, and I is a response to the need for something that exposes children to skin color differences. I need it today, and I have spoken to several parents/caregivers who needed it 10 years ago, and am certain many will need it tomorrow.

Research: It is based on research, discussions with educators, parents, and NGOs working with children. And those who have  and the and benefit from their scholarship, decades of hard work

Illustration: A big component to look forward to, are the illustrations, that are culturally-rooted and represent daily life in the most enchanting way possible. The book:

  • Uses fun exercises like painting, storytelling, writing, reading comprehension, vocabulary.
  • Makes children aware of how media affect them, and enable them to address their feelings.
  • Includes historical events erased by the mainstream, such as stories of historically marginalized social groups.
  • It includes different types of families: gender nonconforming, special ability, mixed-race/mixed-caste/inter-religion, and low-income families. Basically the range of families your child is surrounded by.

  • Helps them self-represent through a handful of media-making exercises.

The ultimate goal of this book is to help children organize, frame, and articulate their thoughts and ideas independently.

Who will benefit from this book?

This is a great self-purchase/gift for parents of all colors, hues, shades. We all need to check ourselves once in a while. In a household, it will be helpful for:

  • Parents / Coparents (Both, biological / adoptive)
  • Grandparents one-and-all
  • Siblings, nieces, nephews
  • Other close family, especially that one pesky relative
  • Nannies / Babysitters
  • Neighbors
  • Play date buddies
  • Your friends
  • Your child's friends

It's a nice-to-have if you're a:

  • Cultural / public institution
  • On a library committee / Librarian
  • Art educator / Media educator
  • Teacher
  • Youth organization
  • Preschool Director and / or teaching staff

$15 go a long way, as do $500

  • We need $8,000 to make this book possible. A bulk of the content will be made available to public for free.
  • Funds will be used for research for this book with a range of experts, local travel, focus groups with parents in U.S. and India, and finally, the illustration, design and publishing of the book.
  • Sponsorship opportunities will facilitate book donations to local libraries, youth centers, or to an institution / location of choice.
  • You will receive limited-edition perks.

The Perks: Limited-edition merchandise

Limited-edition merchandise for is designed to raise critical questions about colourism, using wit and design. If these can spark conversations when they're displyed in your house, or when you carry them around in public places, our goal for raising cultural awareness shall be fulfilled.

The vintage art superimposed with modern dialogue(below) are a commentary on the media’s culpability in promoting and sustaining colourism in our culture. This includes: limited-edition, 4x6 inch, glossy, 2-card set and a zip pouch to carry you skin care products on a day out.

The Colourism Definition Tote Bag is perfect for launching a riveting discussion, where ever you go.

Note: This is a fixed funding opportunity, if we don't reach our goal, you money will be returned within a week of the campaign's end date.

Sometimes, colourism is a feminist issue

While colourism  goes well beyond being gender-specifics, in some ways, it feels like a feminist issue. Girls/women are more impacted due to the social pressure of conforming to beauty standards, in addition to the unforgiving marriage market, where light skin is the most important criterion. The graphic below shows how resources spent on fairness products can be redirected to more important things like literacy and education, especially for women.

 
  • We will raise awareness
  • Conduct original research.
  • The book will be educational, and a resource for individuals, families, and communities alike.

I have spoken and created media about colourism in India. I have been supported by important public institutions for my work. My own personal commitment, and discussions with people across demographics and ethnicities, makes me confident the time to do this is now.

A possible challenge

Culturally, we prefer not to talk about colourism, especially as a first, or second-hand experience. Because it's hard. For all of us. I think the reason for that is that those that are 'lights-skinned' may be uncomfortable acknowledging our light-skinned privilege, and those that are 'dark-skinned' have a hard time accepting our negative experiences. Here're some ways I am trying to circumvent it:

  • Asking site visitors to share and encourage open discussion.
  • Research, articles, FAQs are aimed at embracing the idea that colorism exists and reject the thought that "it's just in the mind" or 'it's okay because that's how it's always been."
  • Bollywood-based memes to highlight their impact, and look at films with fresh eyes. And move on from saying that it's "just shown in films" or "films are for entertainment."
  • We have some subversive gifts / giveaways that help break the taboo around public discussion
So please, fund us, get your goody bag, (or 2!) and make this campaign a success.
 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help me spread the word about this very important, and timely book, as the political climate urges us to come just a little bit closer. Here’re some ways you can help:

  • Like the The Colo(u)rism Project and share posts. 
  • Encourage conversation. Listen. Share.
  • Follow us on Instagram and Tumblr and, again, encourage, listen, share
  • Connect us to journalists / bloggers.
  • Canvas your networks - relevant POC (people of color) groups. Send a group email, CC me (thecolourismproject@gmail.com).
  • Send the campaign link to scholars, art or media educators, media makers, feminists, advocates...
  • In short, make some noise about our campaign.

story:
¿Qué?

Hijos del corralito es la crónica descarnada de una realidad incómoda, inasumible por el sistema, que pone de manifiesto y denuncia un hecho que ningún gobierno querría recononcer; y es que la miseria está llamando a nuestra puerta.

Hijos del corralito cuenta la historia, en lenguaje crudo, de un grupo de chicos de entre siete y catorce años que por diferentes motivos deben sobrevivir como indigentes, siguiendo las leyes marginales del submundo de las calles. En la que fuera señorial ciudad de Buenos Aires, durante la crisis económica y social que se vivió en Argentina por el 2001, la mayoría de estos chicos provienen de hogares desestructurados y sobrellevan no solo historias de violencia familiar y de drogas, sino abusos del mundo que los rodea y la indiferencia de una sociedad que no supo cómo llegaron de repente.

Como escenario: los barrios bajos de Buenos Aires y los olvidados túneles subterráneos de hace dos siglos, antiguos acueductos, donde también parece haber una sociedad propia con reglas específicas a la ocasión. La enorme similitud con la crisis de España, pone de manifiesto la importancia de esta novela, y nos hace temer que en breve podamos estar recorriendo un camino demasiado parecido en un futuro inmediato.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Ángel Mario Fernández.

Descendiente de inmigrantes españoles y argentinos nació en la ciudad de La Plata, capital de la provincia de Buenos Aires. Ha ejercido como periodista, especializado en estudios de Literatura Latinoamericana y Española, publicando en varios países: Italia, Argentina, Estados Unidos, España, México, Brasil y Líbano.

Afincado en España desde 2006 tiene en su haber más de veinte publicaciones, entre las que cabe destacar Las rosas de Anita (Barcelona, 2004) que ha sido traducida al inglés, francés y portugués; la novela juvenil Las clases de literatura (Barcelona, 2011); o el relato Juan se fue a las estrellas, que recibió un premio de Prada Journal habiendo sido traducido a multitud de idiomas.

Por otro lado, Ángel Mario Fernández, ha estrenado nueve piezas teatrales y formado el grupo de teatro Los Rotos (The Broken-Men), compuesto casi en su totalidad por actores y actrices discapacitados.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 850€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Hijos del corralito que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Ángel Mario Fernández vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.
